"__label__Other Yariel Law, M.D."
__label__Other Wheatland Memorial Nursing Home/Bangdung Office

__label__Other Dear Dr. Law:
__label__Other I had the pleasure of seeing Mr. Hess in followup in Cardiology today.
"__label__Other As you know, he is a 53-year-old gentleman who underwent implantation of a permanent pacemaker on 02/11/60 for presyncope and pauses on Holter monitoring."
"__label__hyperlipidemia.mention.after_dct His past medical history is significant for hyperlipidemia, gastroesophageal reflux disease, and asthma."
"__label__Other Prior to his pacemaker placement, an exercise stress test was performed because of his history of exertional chest pain."
__label__Other He was able to exercise for 8 minutes and 4 seconds.
"__label__Other The test was terminated for 7/10 substernal chest pain, but no hypotension and no overt EKG changes were noted, so we proceeded with the pacemaker implant."
"__label__Other Since the implant Mr. Hess describes that his intermittent symptoms of lightheadedness and shortness of breath have vanished, however, he has noticed that he is sleeping less well and occasionally has nocturnal palpitations, which potentially could represent pacing from his pacemaker."
__label__Other Interrogation today of his Medtronic Kappa QQ 626 pacemaker reveals that his underlying rhythm is sinus tachycardia with intact AV conduction.
__label__Other His estimated battery longevity is 89 months.
"__label__Other The atrial impedance is 569 ohms, the ventricular impedance is 529 ohms."
__label__Other The P-wave is 5.6 mV.
__label__Other The R-wave is 31.3 mV.
"__label__Other The threshold in the atrium is 0.75 V at 0.4 mV, and the threshold in the ventricle is 0.75 V at 0.4 msec."
"__label__Other In summary, Mr. Hess is doing extremely well after his pacemaker placement."
__label__Other His pacemaker incision is extremely well healed.
__label__Other There is no sign of erythema or hematoma.
"__label__Other However, his sinus tachycardia is mildly perplexing."
"__label__Other Looking at his heart rate histogram, it appears that this sinus rates have varied from 80-120 beats per minute for the most part aside from some low heart rate that potentially are nocturnal."
__label__Other I have performed some pacing maneuvers today in clinic to attempt to determine whether the mechanism of his current tachycardia is sinus and it appears that this is sinus tachycardia.
"__label__Other For this reason, I have performed a TSH today, which is normal, however, I suggest to you that potentially a cursory endocrine workup and potentially a repeat echocardiogram at your facility might be indicated."
__label__Other I am available to discuss these findings with you at any time.
"__label__Other I plan to see Mr. Hess in followup in three months' time, and if any issues arise in the interim, please do not hesitate to contact me."
"__label__Other Sincerely,"
__label__Other ______________________________

__label__Other Dear Dr. Gordon:
__label__Other I had the pleasure of seeing Mr. Hess in followup in Cardiology today.
"__label__Other As you know, he is a 54-year-old gentleman who underwent implantation of a permanent pacemaker on 02/11/2060 for his presyncope and pauses on Holter monitoring."
"__label__hyperlipidemia.mention.during_dct His past medical history is significant for hyperlipidemia, gastroesophageal reflux disease, and asthma."
"__label__Other Prior to his pacemaker placement, an exercise stress test was performed because of a history of exertional chest pain."
__label__Other He was able to exercise for 8 minutes and 4 seconds.
"__label__cad.test.before_dct The test was terminated for 7/10 substernal chest pain, but no hypotension or overt ECG changes were noted."
__label__Other We proceeded to pacemaker implant and Mr. Hess has done well since that time.
__label__Other He remarks that his intermittent symptoms of lightheadedness have resolved.
"__label__Other However, he occasionally still has nocturnal palpitations as well as occasional exertional chest discomfort."
"__label__cad.test.before_dct He tells me that he underwent testing at Wheatland Memorial consisting of a stress test with MIBI imaging that perhaps showed an abnormality, though the report of this test is not available to me today for review."
__label__Other Interrogation today of his Medtronic Kappa CTE 226 pacemaker reveals that his underlying rhythm is sinus tachycardia with intact AV conduction.
__label__Other The estimated longevity on the battery life is 95 months.
__label__Other The atrial impedance is 544 ohms and the ventricular impedance is 519 ohms.
__label__Other The P-wave in the atrium is 5.6 mV and the R-wave in the ventricle is 31 mV.
"__label__Other The threshold in the atrium is stable at 0.5 V at 0.4 msec, and the threshold in the ventricle is also stable at 0.5 V at 0.4 msec."
"__label__Other In summary, the pacemaker appears to be working quite well."
"__label__Other However, Mr. Hess persists in a perplexing sinus tachycardia that has been present since his last pacemaker interrogation."
__label__Other I have therefore ordered an echocardiogram to rule out any ill effects of the sinus tachycardia or any structural heart disease that may be causing the sinus tachycardia.
"__label__Other In addition, I have performed a 12-lead ECG, which appears to show sinus mechanism rather than an atrial tachycardia."
"__label__Other Today in the office, his sinus rate is 109 beats per minute with stable blood pressure."
__label__Other Mr. Hess and I have checked thyroid studies in the recent past and those have been unremarkable.
"__label__Other I have discussed this case with Dr. Quatrell Swanson who has agreed to assist in Cardiology care for Mr. Hess in the near future, since Dr. Law is moving his practice to the NCHC."
__label__Other I plan to see Mr. Hess in followup in three months' time for his pacemaker.
"__label__Other If any issues arise in the interim, please do not hesitate to contact me."
"__label__Other Sincerely,"
__label__Other ______________________________

__label__Other ATTENDING CONSULTATION NOTE 
__label__Other DIAGNOSIS: Recurrent renal cell carcinoma.
__label__Other HISTORY: Mr. Slater is a delightful and active 80-year-old man who was incidentally found to have a renal mass in 2133.
"__label__Other At that time Dr. Updike performed a left partial nephrectomy, and the final pathology showed a 1.5 cm clear cell renal cell carcinoma."
__label__Other Since that date he has remained well with no clinical evidence of recurrent disease and has had interval CT scans.
"__label__Other For the last 2 years, enhancing nodules have been noted within the region of the partial nephrectomy."
__label__Other A biopsy performed approximately 1 year ago did not demonstrate any cancer within modestly enlarged retroperitoneal lymph nodes.
__label__Other CT scan was repeated in December of 2137.
__label__Other This again showed some enlarged retroperitoneal adenopathy and also enlargement of the soft tissue nodules.
__label__Other Biopsy in March of this year showed probable recurrent renal cell carcinoma of the clear cell type within the nodules.
__label__Other Biopsy of an adjacent adrenal gland showed no cancer.
"__label__Other His metastatic workup has included CT scans of the chest, which have demonstrated small pulmonary nodules of uncertain significance."
__label__Other He has met with Drs.
__label__Other Eagle and Yzaguirre.

__label__Other Dear Wanda:
__label__Other Nancy Werner is doing better than the last time I saw her in May
"__label__Other in that the triglycerides have decreased to 460, pretty much where"
__label__Other they had usually been.
__label__Other The LDL is now quite low at 93 but the HDL
__label__Other has declined to 34.
"__label__Other All in all, the results are compatible with"
__label__medication.statin..during_dct better glucose control and the action of Atorvastatin 10 mg is
__label__Other likely responsible for the very low LDL but on the other hand
__label__medication.fibrate..after_dct discontinuation of the gemfibrozil probably lowered the HDL.
__label__Other The
__label__medication.statin..during_dct effect on triglycerides of the low dose of the Atorvastatin is
__label__Other minimal and overall the triglyceride lowering effect is overrated
__label__Other except at the high dose of 80 mg.
__label__medication.statin..during_dct Even at 80 mg Atorvastatin could
__label__Other not compare to the fibrates in the triglyceride lowering action.
"__label__medication.statin..during_dct Her current medications are Atorvastatin 10 mg, Lopressor 25 mg,"
"__label__medication.ace_inhibitor..before_dct Procardia 60 mg b.i.d., Capoten 50 mg t.i.d., and  Insulin 22 units"
__label__Other A.M.
"__label__Other Labs: Cholesterol 220, TG."
"__label__Other 460, HDL 34, LDL 93."
__label__Other Blood pressure is 120/80.
"__label__medication.fibrate..after_dct I restarted the Gemfibrozil, 600 mg b.i.d."
__label__Other and left her on the
__label__medication.statin..during_dct Atorvastatin 10 mg.
__label__Other Although I don't expect any side effects with
__label__medication.statin..during_dct this low dose of Atorvastatin and Gemfibrozil I warned Mrs. Werner
__label__Other and her husband that if she should have generalized muscle aches or
__label__Other weakness she should contact us and discontinue medication.

__label__Other there had never been any previous open wounds.

__label__Other encompasses a significant proportion of the lateral aspect of the

__label__Other mid foot.

__label__Other and there is a good posterior tibial Doppler signal at the ankle.

__label__Other left foot which likely began as a pressure (decubitus) ulceration

__label__Other significant local sepsis and there is a large area of soft tissue

__label__Other debridement today.

__label__Other 	Reason for visit:
"__label__hypertension.mention.before_dct    55 y/o Columbian male with a history of HTN, hyperlipidemia, severe AS s/p AVR (St. Judes) in 3/17 and recent composite arortic homograft replacement for MRSA/VISA endocarditis presenting for follow-up."
__label__Other Interval History:
__label__Other    The patient's complicated cardiac history dates back to 3/17 when he underwent mechanical AVR for symptomatic severe AS.
__label__cad.mention.before_dct He had preserved LV function and pre-operative cardiac catheterization showed multi vessel non-obstructive CAD.
"__label__Other He initially did well, but had a prolonged hospitalization in 7/17."
"__label__Other At that time, he developed acute cholecystitis and post-ERCP pancreatitis which was complicated by phlegmon and pseudocyst formation."
__label__Other He was admitted to PNC in 1/18 for elective open cholecystectomy and roux-en-Y cyst-jejunostomy.
__label__Other He underwent the GI surgery on 1/11/18.
__label__Other His post-operative course was complicated by recurrent GIB upon re-initiation of anti-coagulation for the mechanical AVR that prolonged his hospital stay.
"__label__Other Unfortunately, he developed line-associated bactermeia and sepsis 4 weeks into the hospitalization."
__label__Other He developed high fevers on 2/07/18 ad he had serial cultures positive for MRSA that had intermediate sensitivity to Vancomycin.
__label__Other He was initially treated with Vancomycin and Gentamicin with addition of Rifampin later in the course of treatment.
__label__Other He developed progressive PR prolongation on ECG and  a TTE on 2/10/18 and TEE on 2/11/18 showed vegetations on the aortic prosthesis with evidence of annular involvement with abscess.
__label__Other A follow-up TEE on 2/17/18 showed worsening aortic root abscess and he was ultimately taken to the OR by Dr. Elrod on 2/17/18.
__label__Other The intraoperative findings were notable were notable for severe aortic root involvement and he underwent composite aortic homograft replacement that was complicated by severe RV failure.
"__label__Other On POD 0, he had recurrent malignant arrhythmias (VT/VF) which required ~ 50 defibrillations and open cardiac massage."
"__label__Other A TEE done after stabilization showed global akinesis and severe TR, and preserved LV function."
__label__Other Emergent coronary angiogram showed evidence of RCA vasospasm.
__label__Other An IABP was placed and he was treated with beta blockade and for vasospasm.
__label__Other HE was taken to the OR for closure on 2/22/18.
"__label__Other His course was subsequently notable for ARF which transiently required CVVH, development of HIT, and vascular emboli to the right lower extremity which led to dry gangrene og the right 3rd digit."
__label__Other ABI testing revealed no evidence of PAD.
__label__Other He was followed by ID and was placed on daptomycin and Bactrim.
__label__Other He was seen by Vascular surgery and was not deemed to require any surgical intervention and was scheduled for outpatient follow up.
"__label__Other With supportive care, he was successfully weaned off IABP and ventilatory support and transferred to the step down unit."
__label__Other His course there was notable for mild hyperkalemia that was felt to be related to Bactrim induced RTA.
__label__Other He also had severe depression that was felt to be related an adjustment disorder.
__label__Other He was discharged to a rehab facility on 3/22/18 and was discharged from rehab 12 dyas ago.
"__label__Other Since discharge, he reports doing relatively well."

__label__Other Assessment and plan:
"__label__cad.event.before_dct    In summary, this is a 78-year-old gentleman who has a history of coronary artery bypass grafting, closure of PFO, and ligation of the left atrial appendage and Maze procedure which was done in July 2096."
__label__Other His anginal equivalent prior to that was dyspnea on exertion and he did well for a period of time but now has dyspnea on exertion again.
__label__Other There are a number of factors involved here.
__label__Other He has atrial fibrillation which is now recurrent but the rate seems to be reasonably well controlled.
"__label__Other I doubt that, that is playing a role in his shortness of breath."
__label__Other He also has a history of plural effusions which could have been contributing to shortness of breath as well and that has been dealt with corrosion of the pleura.
__label__Other He has mitral regurgitation which in the past was said to be moderate and he has had the closure of PFO.
__label__diabetes.mention.after_dct He has insulin-dependent diabetes and hypertension.
__label__Other He also has low platelets.
__label__cad.mention.after_dct The recurrence of the exertional dyspnea is certainly worrisome for recurrence of coronary disease particularly with the exercise test showing anterior wall ischemia.
"__label__Other It may be that there are other issues contributing to this, the atrial fibrillation and mitral regurgitation."
"__label__Other He has murmur consistent with mitral regurgitation, but he has no evidence of decompensated congestive failure at this time."
__label__Other Blood pressure is elevated somewhat and I think that increase in his Avapro might be worthwhile.
__label__Other He also has chronic renal insufficiency which makes things more complicated as well.
__label__cad.mention.after_dct My feeling is that we are dealing with recurrence of coronary disease and I spoke with the patient about this.
__label__Other He is clearly limited in his exercise capacity and wants to have something done.
"__label__Other I would like to get an echocardiogram to be sure we are dealing with constrictive disease, but I think he will probably need to have a cardiac catheterization."
"__label__Other I would like to get the echocardiogram, bring him in for cardiac catheterization, and see if there are narrowings either in the graft or in his native arteries that may be contributing to the anterior wall ischemia."
__label__Other Starting him on an antiarrhythmic to see if we can reestablish sinus rhythm may be worth considering or perhaps cardioversion after the cardiac catheterization.
"__label__Other Because of renal insufficiency, cardiac catheterization is a little bit more complicated and that the low platelets are also an issue we need to address."

__label__Other 89 Buck St
"__label__Other Sioux City, FL  76546"
__label__Other VivianLee Jorgenson
__label__Other MR# 471-90-84-7
"__label__Other November 24, 2071"
__label__Other This is the first visit for Ms. Jorgenson who is a 64 year old woman who presents 
__label__Other for management of papillary thyroid cancer.
"__label__Other Her symptoms began in May, 2071, "
__label__Other when she felt a prominence in her neck.
__label__Other She did not experience any dysphagia 
"__label__Other or voice changes, but presumably was felt to have an abnormality on thyroid "
__label__Other examination.
"__label__Other She underwent a thyroid biopsy in June, 2071, at a local "
__label__Other hospital.
__label__Other The pathology which was read at JMH revealed numerous follicular 
__label__Other cells with chromatin grooves suspicious for papillary carcinoma.
__label__Other She was 
__label__Other subsequently referred to Dr. Geiger at JMH for thyroidectomy and underwent 
__label__Other thyroidectomy on 9/17/71.
__label__Other The thyroidectomy was uncomplicated though there 
__label__Other was inadvertent displacement of a parathyroid gland and this gland was then 
__label__Other reimplanted.
"__label__Other According to the operative report, the carcinoma was felt to be "
__label__Other locally extensive though no laryngo-tracheal nerve invasion was present.
__label__Other The 
__label__Other pathology revealed a (R) 6 cm papillary carcinoma with capsular and 
__label__Other lymphovascular invasion.
__label__Other There was an additional focus of papillary 
"__label__Other carcinoma, follicular variant, in the (L) thyroid lobe that was 0.3 cm."
__label__Other Of 
"__label__Other note, the tissue was stained for calcitonin and this was negative."
__label__Other The tumor 
__label__Other did stain positively for thyroglobulin.
"__label__Other Since undergoing thyroidectomy, Ms. Jorgenson has done fairly well."
__label__Other She has been 
__label__Other maintained on 75 mcg daily of Levoxyl.
__label__Other She says that she feels generally 
__label__Other well on this dose though she does endorse slight fatigue.
__label__Other She denies any 
"__label__Other changes in her sleep, hair, skin or bowels."
__label__Other She does endorse a one pound 
__label__Other weight gain over the last two months.
__label__Other She denies any paresthesias or other 
__label__Other symptoms consistent with hypocalcemia.
__label__Other She denies any history of thyroid 
__label__Other disturbances prior to her diagnosis of cancer.
__label__Other She is now referred for 
__label__Other consideration of radioiodine ablation.
__label__Other Past Medical History:Notable for congestive heart failure.
__label__Other She has an 
__label__Other ejection fraction of 25%.
"__label__hyperlipidemia.mention.before_dct She also has a history of hypercholesterolemia, "
"__label__hypertension.mention.after_dct hypertension, and anxiety."
__label__Other No history of childhood irradiation.
__label__medication.beta_blocker..before_dct Current Medications:Digoxin 0.25 daily; Coreg 12.5 mg daily; Levoxyl 75 
__label__medication.statin..before_dct mcg daily; Lipitor 10 mg daily; Coumadin 5 mg daily; Lasix 40 mg daily; 
"__label__medication.ace_inhibitor..during_dct captopril 50 mg, tid; labetolol 100, bid; nitroglycerine."
__label__Other Allergies:No known drug allergies.
__label__smoker.past Social History:Remote history of tobacco.
__label__smoker.past She quit 4 years ago.
__label__Other She 
__label__Other endorses rare alcohol use.
__label__Other She is married with four children.
__label__Other Family History:Negative for thyroid cancer.
__label__hypertension.high_bp.during_dct Physical Exam:Blood pressure is elevated at 188/92.
__label__Other Weight 208.
__label__Other Pulse 
__label__Other 88.
"__label__Other In general this is a somewhat tired, slightly pale-appearing woman in "
__label__Other NAD.
__label__Other HEENT:  PERRLA.
__label__Other EOMI.
__label__Other No proptosis or lid lag.
__label__Other Neck: supple with a 
__label__Other large well-healed thyroidectomy scar.
__label__Other No 
__label__Other Page 2
__label__Other remaining thyroid tissue or lymphadenopathy is appreciated.
__label__Other Lungs: clear to 
__label__Other auscultation bilaterally.
"__label__Other Cardiovascular: normal S1, S2, regular rate and "
__label__Other rhythm.
"__label__obese.mention.during_dct Abdomen: soft, slightly distended, non-tender, moderately obese."
"__label__Other Extremities: trace pedal edema, 1+ distal pulses."
__label__Other Neurologic: reflexes are 
__label__Other slightly delayed.
__label__Other There is no tremor of outstretched hands.
"__label__Other Review of Labs:Of note, include a TSH of 1.65 from August, 2071, that was "
__label__Other prior to surgery.
__label__Other Free T4 at that time was normal at 1.1.
__label__Other Calcium prior to 
__label__Other surgery was slightly elevated at 10.6 though several calciums drawn after her 
__label__Other surgery were in the mid-8 range.
__label__Other Impression:This is a 64 year old woman with a history of congestive heart 
__label__Other failure who is now s/p total thyroidectomy for papillary thyroid cancer.
__label__Other Ms. 
__label__Other Jorgenson is potentially at higher risk for recurrence given the fact that she is 
"__label__Other older at the time of diagnosis, she had a large-size tumor, and she had "
__label__Other multifocal disease.
__label__Other Plan:Check a TSH and thyroglobulin today for a baseline.
__label__Other We suspect that 
__label__Other she may be undertreated on her current dose of Levoxyl.
__label__Other I have recommended 
__label__Other 131I treatment.
__label__Other Benefits and risks were discussed.
"__label__Other In addition, I think she "
__label__Other would tolerate thyroid hormone withdrawal.
__label__Other TSH and calcium were drawn today.
__label__Other We will plan to arrange  for 131I for January.
"__label__Other Hilda Vincent, M.D."
"__label__Other Brittany Farrar, M.D."

__label__Other Dear Dr. Van:
__label__Other I had the pleasure of participating in the care of VivianLee Jorgenson during her recent hospitalization at Goulds Hospital.
__label__Other This lovely 67-year-old female ended up having no discernable coronary artery disease on catheterization.
"__label__Other At the time of the cath, her pulmonary capillary wedge pressure was 12."
"__label__Other During the course of her hospitalization, we noted as well that she had had runs of nonsustained VT and asked our EP colleagues to comment on the appropriateness of an ICD."
"__label__Other They felt that this could certainly be rediscussed in the future, but at the present time, there was no compelling indication for her to receive an ICD."
__label__medication.statin..after_dct Her medications at discharge include Lipitor 20 mg p.o.
"__label__Other q.d., digoxin 0.25 mg p.o."
"__label__medication.ace_inhibitor..during_dct q.d., captopril 50 mg p.o."
"__label__Other t.i.d., Lasix 40 mg p.o."
"__label__medication.aspirin..before_dct b.i.d., enteric-coated aspirin 81 mg p.o."
"__label__Other q.d., Nexium 20 mg p.o."
"__label__Other q.d., Synthroid 300 mcg p.o."
"__label__Other q.d., Aldactone 25 mg p.o."
"__label__medication.beta_blocker..before_dct q.d., Coreg 25 mg p.o."
"__label__medication.calcium_channel_blocker..during_dct b.i.d., and Norvasc 5 mg p.o."
__label__Other q.d.
__label__Other It has been a delight to participate in the care of this lovely woman.
"__label__Other If there is any questions or issues, please feel free to call."
"__label__Other Sincerely,"

"__label__Other falls, concerning for either an evolving intracranial process"

"__label__Other weeks, however, but also presents with melena over the past"

__label__Other the brain to evaluate for intracranial injury or abnormality both

__label__Other does not show any large subdural or mass lesion.

__label__Other anemic has melanotic heme-positive stool.

"__label__Other etiology, but it seems like it has been a slow progression, and"

__label__Other troponin at present.

"__label__cad.event.before_dct This is an 82 year old male with CAD, DM, HTN, hyperlipidemia, and CRI who presents for elective cardiac catheterization for reevaluation of an RCA stent, which was placed in 12/95 in the setting of an STEMI."
__label__Other This catheterization is in preparation for planned CABG by Dr. Xaysana on 4/23/96.
"__label__Other Mr. Jarvis's cardiac history began in 12/95, when he was shoveling snow."
"__label__Other At that time, he developed dizziness, diaphoresis and nausea."
__label__Other He went inside and had an episode of syncope which lasted approximately 5 minutes.
"__label__Other His initial EKG showed 1 mm STE in II, III and aVF and 1 mm STE in V5 and V6."
__label__Other An EKG seven minutes later showed an increase in STE in the inferior leads and STE in V3 to V6 with a max of 4 mm in V3.
__label__Other He never developed chest pain.
__label__cad.test.before_dct An emergent cardiac catheterization at that time showed a left main with minor distal disease.
__label__Other The LAD had a proximal 80% stenosis.
__label__Other The LCx had mid 40% diffuse disease.
__label__Other The 1st OM had a tandem lesion of 90%.
__label__cad.test.before_dct The RCA was large and dominant and had a proximal ulcerated 90% stenosis with haziness.
"__label__Other Given these findings, a 2.5 X 15mm BMS was placed into the proximal RCA with and excellent result."
__label__Other His peak CK was 305 during that admission.
"__label__Other An echo performed at that time was a technically difficult study, which showed diffuse inferior hypokinesis."
__label__Other He was discharged home in 12/95 in stable condition and follow-up with Dr. Xaysana in his office to discuss possible CABG.
__label__Other It was decided that the patient should have a repeat cardiac catheterization prior to the CABG to determine whether RCA restenosis is present.
__label__Other He is then scheduled to have CABG with Dr. Xaysana on 4/23/96.
__label__Other The patient has been feeling well at home from a cardiac standpoint.

__label__Other HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS:  This 58-year-old white male comes to the office for followup regarding his recent chest pain.
__label__Other Chest pain.
"__label__Other The patient was in his usual state of compensated health, but approximately one month ago after clearing significance note from his driveway, the patient started to note some anterior chest discomfort."
__label__cad.event.before_dct He has a long history of coronary artery disease and this includes angioplasty and coronary artery bypass grafting in 2065.
"__label__Other The pain did not radiate up to his neck or arm, but when the pain persisted even after returning from Blountstown, he went to Roper Hospital North two days ago because of his chest discomfort to see his cardiologist."
"__label__Other He was admitted to the hospital, had a cardiac catheterization, which according to the patient did not show any specific lesion."
"__label__Other The doctors felt that he did not have a myocardial infarction, but that in fact his abnormality was due to a chest wall/muscular type syndrome."
"__label__medication.aspirin..before_dct He was discharged on anti-inflammatory medicine and the patient had noted that when he took the aspirin over the past month, his discomfort was improved."

__label__Other Dear Dr. Barron:
__label__Other Thank you very much for your kind referral of Frances Preston to the Cardiovascular Division of Weston General Hospital.
__label__cad.event.before_dct I saw her in consultation this afternoon for her diagnosis of a recent myocardial infarction.
__label__Other Please allow me to summarize her history for our records.
"__label__hyperlipidemia.mention.during_dct Frances is a very pleasant 51-year-old Danish woman who has cardiac risk factors including hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and recently diagnosed glucose intolerance."
"__label__cad.symptom.before_dct It appears that she had been having a several-month history of anginal-type symptoms, although a stress test obtained in March showed no significant ischemia."
"__label__Other On 04/09/2076 she was in New York helping a family member with start up of a restaurant, when she woke up in the morning with a sudden onset of chest discomfort and lightheadedness, and according to her daughter suffered a cardiac arrest."
__label__cad.event.before_dct She was taken emergently to Cabrini Medical Center where she was found to have an inferior wall myocardial infarction and underwent coronary stenting.
__label__Other I do not have records from this admission that she does have her stent cards that indicate that she received a 3.5 x 23 and 3.5 x 13 Cypher drug-eluting stents to the right coronary artery.
"__label__Other Per her daughter's report, she had a significant lesion in another blood vessel, which was felt to require percutaneous coronary intervention."
"__label__Other Unfortunately, we do not have details of the remainder of her coronary anatomy."
"__label__cad.event.before_dct Since her myocardial infarction, she actually has felt quite well."
__label__Other She no longer has the angina that she had prior to her MI.
__label__Other Her major complaints are that she occasionally feels lightheaded and somewhat fatigued but overall feels well.
__label__Other She is able to walk normal distances without cardiac symptoms.
"__label__hyperlipidemia.mention.during_dct Her past medical history is notable for hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and glucose intolerance."
"__label__medication.aspirin..before_dct Her present medications include aspirin 325 mg a day, Plavix 75 mg a day, metformin 500 mg a day, simvastatin 40 mg a day, nitroglycerin p.r.n., amlodipine 10 mg a day, hydrochlorothiazide 25 mg a day, and lisinopril 20 mg a day."
__label__Other She has no known drug allergies.
__label__Other Social History:  She is married and has three children.
__label__Other She is presently accompanied by her daughter Landis who handles the majority of her health care.
__label__Other Landis can be reached on a cell phone at 944-351-0904.
__label__smoker.never She has never used tobacco.
__label__cad.event.before_dct Family history is notable for several aunts with myocardial infarctions and a sister whose has had a prior stroke.
__label__Other There was a significant history of glucose intolerance in the family.
"__label__Other Review of Systems:  Cardiac:  No chest pain, PND, orthopnea, dyspnea, or lower extremity edema."
__label__Other Musculoskeletal:  No myalgias or arthralgias on lipid-lowering therapy.
__label__Other All others are negative.
"__label__Other On physical examination, she is an overweight yet well-appearing female in no apparent distress."
__label__Other Her blood pressure is 131/86 and her heart rate is 61 beats per minute.
__label__Other Her weight is 213 pounds.
__label__Other Her neck shows 2+ carotid upstrokes.
__label__Other There is a hint of a bruit in the left carotid.
__label__Other The carotid upstrokes are full.
__label__Other Her lungs are clear to auscultation.
"__label__Other The heart is normal to palpation, no thrills are palpated and the PMI is nondisplaced."
__label__Other The heart is regular in rate and rhythm and a 2/6 systolic ejection murmur is heard best in the right upper sternal border throughout the precordium.
"__label__obese.mention.during_dct The abdomen is obese, soft, nontender with normal bowel sounds."
__label__Other Her extremities show no edema.
__label__Other Her EKG in the office today shows normal sinus rhythm at a rate of 61 with a normal axis and intervals.
__label__cad.event.before_dct She has Q waves and T-wave inversions in leads III and F consistent with her recent myocardial infarction.
__label__Other I do not have a recent lipid profile on file.
"__label__Other On 04/16/2076, she underwent an echocardiogram."
__label__Other She has normal left ventricular function with a mild intracavitary gradient of 9 mmHg.
__label__Other She has mild aortic sclerosis with a velocity across the aortic valve of 2.2 m/sec.
__label__Other There are no significant wall motion abnormalities.
__label__Other She has only mild mitral regurgitation.
"__label__cad.event.before_dct In summary, well we do not have records, it is fairly clear that Mrs. Preston has had an inferior wall myocardial infarction treated with coronary stenting."
__label__Other She did receive drug-eluting stents.
__label__cad.event.before_dct The good news is that appears that her left ventricular function is very well preserved suggesting that she did not have a large myocardial infarction.
"__label__cad.mention.during_dct What is less clear, however, is the status of her other coronaries, there is some suggestion that she may have significant coronary artery disease at this time."
"__label__Other From a clinical standpoint, I certainly do not think that she requires a cardiac catheterization at this time."
"__label__Other She is fairly asymptomatic, and is doing well from the cardiovascular standpoint."
__label__Other I think what would be more helpful in guiding recommendation is whether she has significant underlying ischemia at this point.
"__label__Other To this end, I have arranged for her to undergo an adenosine PET scan to assess for residual ischemia."
__label__Other We will guide our recommendations regarding cardiac catheterization based on the results of the study.
"__label__medication.statin..before_dct In terms of her lipids, it appears that she has been switched to Lipitor."
__label__Other The goal for her LDL should be in the 70s and her HDLs ideally be in the 40s.
"__label__Other In terms of antithrombotic therapy, she did receive drug-eluting stents."
"__label__medication.aspirin..before_dct Therefore, she should certainly remain on aspirin for the remainder of her life and Plavix for an absolute minimum of one year."
"__label__medication.thienopyridine..after_dct After a year, it would likely be acceptable for her to stop her Plavix for brief periods of time should it be necessary for other medical procedures."
"__label__medication.thienopyridine..after_dct However, up until that time her Plavix should not be discontinued without a discussion with myself."
"__label__Other She is on a very good medical regimen, although I think she would benefit from a beta-blocker."
"__label__medication.beta_blocker..after_dct The hydrochlorothiazide appears to be a new medication for her, and therefore I went ahead and discontinued this and started her on extended-release metoprolol at 25 mg a day."
__label__Other This can certainly be cut uptitrated for better blood pressure control.
"__label__Other I will call her daughter Landis with the results of her PET scan and further recommendations, and we will go ahead and make plans for her to see me again in six months."

__label__Other Dear Dr. Barron:
__label__Other I would like to give you followup on our mutual patient Frances Preston.
"__label__cad.symptom.before_dct As you know, I referred her to the cardiac catheterization laboratory because of progressive worsening angina and a stress test suggesting anterior ischemia."
__label__Other We performed a catheterization on 12/14/2076.
__label__Other We utilized the right radial artery for access.
__label__cad.event.before_dct We found that she developed a significant in-stent restenosis lesion within the previously placed Cypher drug-eluting stent.
__label__Other This is undoubtedly the cause of her symptoms.
__label__cad.event.before_dct We were able to treat this lesion with balloon angioplasty and ultimately stented with a 3.5 x 24 Taxus drug-eluting stent.
__label__Other The stent was postdilated with a 4 mm noncompliant balloon to high pressure.
__label__Other The final angiographic result was excellent.
__label__Other The following morning she was doing quite well and we discharged her later in the day.
"__label__medication.aspirin..before_dct She will remain on her usual medications and I have stressed the importance of remaining on aspirin once a day for the remainder of her life and Plavix for a minimum of a year after this procedure, though I will likely favor indefinite therapy."
__label__Other I plan on seeing her again on 01/24/2077 in followup.
"__label__Other If you have any further questions regarding her care, please do not hesitate to contact me."
"__label__Other Sincerely,"

__label__Other who has had decrease in mental status and activity since 3 days
__label__Other ago.

__label__Other between 100 and 101.3.

__label__Other reports a decrease in energy.

"__label__Other hemodialysis Sunday, Tuesday, and Thursday."

__label__Other today but has much less energy than usual.
"__label__Other She has a cough, no"
"__label__Other nausea, vomiting, or diarrhea, has constipation, takes lactulose,"
__label__Other and has a normal bowel movement.
__label__Other Last BM was Thursday evening.
__label__Other This is a normal spacing of her usual bowel movements.

"__label__Other to her visiting nurse, the urine looks dark."
__label__Other Blood pressure is
__label__Other running in the low 100 in the last month.
__label__Other Change in mental
__label__Other status for 5 days means that she is not as talkative as usually
__label__Other is.

"__label__Other failure, foot ulcers, and hypothyroidism."

__label__Other coming regularly.

__label__Other her chart.

__label__Other Dear Dr. You:
__label__Other Thank you for asking me to consult in the care of this complex patient.
__label__Other Mr. Xuereb is a 55-year-old white male who presents with an ischemic right foot.
__label__Other He has a longstanding history of lower extremity occlusive disease and has worked as a high school principle.
"__label__Other He has undergone previous right SFA angioplasty in 2059, previous left SFA angioplasty and stent placement in 2062, previous right fem-pop above-knee bypass grafting in February 2070, previous left leg fem-pop bypass grafting with saphenous vein in April 2070 and a redo right fem below-knee popliteal bypass graft with a bifid saphenous vein performed in September 2070."
"__label__Other After this last procedure, the patient at the time of follow-up office visit was noted to have a nonfunctioning graft with an ischemic right lower extremity."
__label__Other He denies any history of trauma.
__label__smoker.past He is a former smoker.
__label__Other He denies any history of hypercoagulable states or history of significant coronary disease.
__label__diabetes.mention.before_dct He does have longstanding non-insulin dependent diabetes mellitus as well as hypertension and COPD.
__label__Other Past surgical history is as above.
"__label__medication.aspirin..before_dct Medications include Glucophage, Lopid, Prilosec, Norvasc, hydrochlorothiazide, Lipitor, Effexor, Plavix 75 mg q.d., aspirin, albuterol, Serevent, Nasacort and Pulmicort."
__label__Other No known drug allergies.
"__label__hypertension.mention.after_dct Review of systems is positive for diabetes, asthma and hypertension."
__label__Other All other review of systems is negative as per H&P sheet.
"__label__Other Habits, he is a former tobacco smoker."
__label__Other He denies alcohol use.
"__label__Other Family history is positive for MI, stroke and cancer."
"__label__Other On physical exam, the patient is a well-developed and well-nourished male in moderate discomfort."
__label__Other Respiratory rate is 12-14.
__label__Other Pulse is 60-70 and regular.
__label__Other Weight is 172 pounds.
"__label__hypertension.high_bp.during_dct Blood pressure is 170/90 in the right arm, 150/90 in the left."
__label__Other No jugular venous distention.
__label__Other Normal respiratory effort.
__label__Other Lungs are clear to auscultation.
"__label__Other Heart, regular rate and rhythm."
__label__Other No murmur or bruit.
__label__Other He has no palpable abdominal aortic aneurysm.
"__label__Other He has normal carotid, brachial, radial and femoral pulses bilaterally."
"__label__Other Absent pedal pulses on the right with Doppler signals, which are monophasic."
"__label__Other On the left side, he has adequately perfused foot with normal capillary refill and Doppler signals."
__label__Other He has moderate edema in the right lower extremity.
__label__Other No varicosities.
"__label__Other He does have dependent rubor, cyanosis of the right forefoot and purplish discoloration of the tips of the right second to fifth toes."
__label__Other The right great toe is blanched.
"__label__Other He has no abdominal masses, tenderness or hepatosplenomegaly."
"__label__Other He has grossly intact musculoskeletal tone and strength with no dermatitis, ulcers or sores."
"__label__Other He is alert and oriented to person, place and time with slightly depressed affect."
__label__Other Assessment and Plan:  
__label__Other 1.
__label__Other Ischemic right lower extremity consistent with thrombosed bypass graft.
__label__Other We will plan to admit the patient for treatment with intravenous heparin and plan to schedule him for an urgent arteriogram within the next 24 hours.
__label__Other We will attempt to identify any possible way to re-establish flow  with either thrombolysis and/or angioplasty and stenting.
"__label__Other If this is unsuccessful, he will ultimately require redo fem-pop bypass graft."
__label__Other 2.
__label__Other Tobacco abuse:  The patient needs to continue to remain abstinent from smoking.
__label__Other 3.
__label__Other Hypertension:  Moderately controlled on current medications.
__label__Other His previous angiogram did not reveal any evidence of any hemodynamically significant renal artery stenosis.
__label__Other We will adjust him as appropriate from a medical standpoint.
__label__Other 4.
__label__diabetes.mention.before_dct Non-insulin dependent diabetes mellitus.
"__label__medication.metformin..after_dct The patient's blood sugars are currently under good control on Glucophage, which we will need to hold post arteriogram."
__label__Other I will keep you informed as to the status of this very nice patient.
__label__Other Thank you for allowing me to participate in his management.
"__label__Other If I can be of any further assistance and management of this or any of your patients with cerebrovascular, aortic, renovascular or low peripheral vascular disease, particularly those in need of a minimally invasive vascular procedure, please feel free to contact me directly."

__label__Other Dear Dr. You:
"__label__Other I had the pleasure of seeing our mutual patient, Mr. Jaquante Xuereb, in follow up evaluation in our vascular surgery clinic here at the Santa Rosa Infirmary today."
"__label__Other As you remember, he recently underwent a revision of his lower extremity bypass graft with thrombectomy of the fem-pop bypass graft and subsequent jump graft to the below-knee popliteal artery."
__label__Other He returns today for follow up evaluation.
"__label__Other He has a warm, well-perfused foot with a palpable dorsalis pedis pulse."
"__label__Other Unfortunately, over the last ten days he has developed increased erythema and tenderness on the medial aspect of his left knee with superficial skin breakdown consistent with either a staph or a strep cellulitis."
__label__Other He had been on a course of p.o.
__label__Other antibiotics over a week ago for treatment of strep throat as well.
"__label__Other The patient has been increased his activity and prior to this time had been extremely active with no erythema, tenderness or drainage from his leg."
"__label__Other My concern is that he has increased warmth with blanching and erythema on the medial aspect of his knee consistent with a superficial cellulitis and I believe that he would benefit from hospital admission with a course of IV antibiotics, bedrest and elevate."
"__label__Other We will tentatively plan to admit him for localized wound care measures, treatment with IV Nafcillin on a q.4 hour basis."
"__label__Other In addition, he has intact femoral pulses on the left side."
__label__Other He does report when he was ambulating he was having increased difficulty with claudication in the distal left lower extremity and calf region.
"__label__Other Most recent vascular lab studies dated November 29, 2070 reveal an ABI of 0.96 on the right, 0.56 on the left."
__label__Other I will keep you informed as to the status of Mr. Xuereb.
__label__Other My concern is that if he does infect this PTFE graft we do not have any suitable autogenous conduit to perform an additional reconstruction and he would stand a very high chance of losing his limb at the knee level.
"__label__Other If I can be of any further assistance in the management of this or any of your other patients with vascular disease, particularly those in need of a minimally invasive vascular procedure, please feel free to contact me directly."
"__label__Other Sincerely,"
"__label__Other Shane R. Herring, M.D."

"__label__Other Patient Name: XUEREB, JAQUANTE;  MRN: 1344351"
"__label__Other Dictated on: 04/27/2071 by LILLIAN STEELE, N.P., PH.D. "
__label__Other Mr. Xuereb returns to clinic for evaluation and management of recurrent ulcerations on the hypertrophic scar tissue along the medial aspect of the right lower extremity.
"__label__Other Today, on physical examination, the wound bed measured 1 cm x 0.7 cm."
"__label__Other The wound bed was covered with yellow biofilm, which was debrided."
__label__Other The underlying wound bed contained moist red tissue with a few drops of bloody drainage.
__label__Other The margin was clear.
__label__Other IMPRESSION:  There has been epithelialization of the wound along the medial aspect of the right knee.
__label__Other There has been no further disruption of the epithelium overlying the hypertrophic scar tissue.
"__label__Other PLAN:  We will continue with dressing changes every two to three days per the following protocol: spray the wound with AllClenz wound cleanser followed by irrigation with normal saline 30 cc x 3; apply skin protectant to the periwound margin, Panafil paste 1/8"" thick to the wound bed, gauze dampened with normal saline (cut-to-fit), covered with DuoDerm secured with Medipore tape."
__label__Other Mr. Xuereb will return to clinic in two weeks.

__label__obese.mention.before_dct Identification:  Patient is a 53-year old markedly obese female 
__label__Other complaining of bilateral weight knee pain.

"__label__Other stiffness, any jelling phenomena."

__label__Other the knee.

__label__Other to Briggs Stratton and dropped to 270 lb.

"__label__Other better, but currently she is back up to over 300 lb."

"__label__Other of 5 ft. 1 in., she is in pain."

__label__Other she has and she will go ahead with a dental visit that she had
__label__Other planned.

__label__Other deal with until she sees you.

"__label__Other question of PMR and she had ""25 shots"" of steroids but I have not"
__label__Other given her steroids and she has done reasonably well.

"__label__diabetes.mention.after_dct she does have a history of a recent mild anemia but has diabetes,"
__label__hypertension.mention.after_dct hypertension and hypercholesterolemia and medications include
"__label__medication.metformin..after_dct metformin, verapamil 250 b.i.d., Avapro 150 q.d., Pravachol 20"
"__label__Other q.d., Bumex, Bentyl, Prilosec and Allegra."

__label__Other her pain.

__label__Other was otherwise unremarkable.

"__label__Other revealed a blood sugar of 208, abnormal LFTs with an AST of 62"

__label__Other A/P:
"__label__hypertension.mention.before_dct Pt is a 69 yo F with PMH notable for DM, HTN, peripheral neuropathy and s/p MI with multiple admissions for rule out, who presents with chest pain, shortness of breath, nightsweats, dizziness, and new mediastinal lymphadenopathy with a lung nodule not noted on prior chest X-rays."
"__label__cad.event.before_dct This constellation of symptoms may be viewed in several different ways:  from a cardiac standpoint, as presentation of unstable angina, given her hx of MI and cardiac risk factors; from an oncological standpoint, as a pheochromocytoma or carcinoid syndrome, given the sympathomimetic nature of her symptoms such as dizziness, abd pain/nausea, chest pain and dyspnea, and the findings in Ab CT and Chest CT, or a primary lung cancer given her history of smoking; from an infectious disease standpoint, as possible reactivation tuberculosis, given that she has a history of TB infection and treatment."
"__label__cad.event.before_dct I believe the priority of the differential should be granted to the oncologic and infectious etiologies, given that she appears to be ruling out for an MI, has little to no ischemic changes on EKG, and is chest pain free with continued exacerbation of her shortness of breath and sweating."
"__label__Other Workup should proceed in the direction of ruling out TB, and establishing the nature of the pulmonary nodule and mediastinal lymphadenopathy."

__label__Other He took 12 biopsy cores and all 12 demonstrated prostate cancer.
__label__Other In 4 it was Gleason 6 and in the remainder Gleason 7.
__label__Other Many cores had a predominant Gleason 4 pattern.
__label__Other Many of the cores were heavily involved with 40% involvement or more.

__label__Other IMPRESSION AND PLAN:  Mr. Meyer is a young man with a significant and quite bulky prostate cancer.
"__label__Other I certainly do not think active surveillance is an option for him, which is a shame, as that was his preference."
"__label__Other Left untreated, I think he will be in deep trouble at some stage over the next few years."
__label__Other His second choice for treatment is prostate brachytherapy but again I believe his disease is too extensive for this and brachytherapy would represent significant under treatment.
"__label__Other On balance, my preference for him is either to have a radical prostatectomy, perhaps followed by postoperative radiation or alternatively, if he wishes to avoid surgery and he does, for him to have high-dose external radiation in conjunction with neoadjuvant and concomitant androgen deprivation."
__label__Other While I think he will recover good voiding function after either of these treatment combinations his sex life is under threat and he is aware of this.
__label__Other We will defer the final decision next week until he has had his scans.
"__label__Other Obviously, should they show extensive extracapsular disease then surgery will be off the table, if they show nodal disease the same is true and we will be thinking in terms of long-term androgen deprivation."
__label__Other Hopefully neither of these scenarios will occur.

__label__Other DATES OF RADIATION: 5/27/95 - 7/24/95 (58 elapsed days) 
"__label__Other DIAGNOSIS: Prostate adenocarcinoma T2B Nx,  Gleason 4+3 = 7,  PSA 7.1"
__label__Other CONCISE HISTORY: Mr. Meyer is a 63 year old man who was found to have an elevated PSA of 7.1 on screening exam.
__label__Other An abnormality was also noted on DRE at that time.
"__label__Other Prostate biopsy was performed, and all 12 cores were positive for disease, including 8 cores with Gleason 7 disease."
__label__Other Prostatic MRI showed no evidence of extracapsular extension.
__label__Other CT of the abdomen and bone scan revealed no evidence of metastatic disease.
"__label__Other He was treated with definitive radiation to the prostate and seminal vesicles by IMRT, with concomitant Zoladex treatment."
__label__Other SPECIAL TECHNICAL CONSIDERATIONS: The patient underwent CT-based imaging to define the target volume and the normal tissue structures and 3D treatment planning was performed for treatment with IMRT.
__label__Other Daily localization of the prostate was done using the BAT ultrasound.
__label__Other SUMMARY OF RADIATION AND TREATMENT ADMINISTERED: The treatment site was the prostate gland plus the caudal seminal vesicles followed by a boost to the prostate alone.
__label__Other The patient underwent external beam radiotherapy to the prostate and caudal seminal vesicles to a dose of 45 Gy given as 25 fractions of 1.8 Gy/day.
__label__Other He then underwent a boost to the prostate only of 34.
__label__Other Gy given in 17 fractions of 2 Gy/day for a total dose of 79 Gy.
"__label__Other CLINICAL COURSE: The patient developed mild nocturia and more frequent bowel movements, for which he took Flomax and Metamucil."
__label__Other Mr. Meyer has tolerated his androgen deprivation therapy well.
__label__Other FOLLOW-UP: Mr. Meyer will follow up with us in 3 months with a PSA in advance.

__label__Other Dear Dr. Shirley:
__label__Other Thank you for referring Irene Yarbrough for evaluation of her atrial fibrillation.
__label__Other Mrs. Yarbrough is 55 years old.
__label__Other Over the past year she had had menorrhagia and 
__label__Other underwent endometrial biopsy in September of 2078 followed by total abdominal 
__label__Other hysterectomy in early October of 2078.
__label__Other Her post-operative course was 
__label__Other complicated by a pelvic abscess for which she was rehospitalized in late 
__label__Other October and during that hospitalization had an episode of atrial fibrillation 
__label__Other which reverted spontaneously to sinus rhythm.
__label__Other The episode was accompanied by 
__label__Other some substernal chest heaviness but no other symptoms and she was not aware of 
__label__Other any palpitations.
__label__medication.calcium_channel_blocker..before_dct She was placed on verapamil 240 mg daily and has not had 
__label__Other any symptomatic recurrences.
__label__Other Her abdominal incision is open but healing and 
__label__Other she has been recovering well.
__label__Other She has no prior cardiac history.
__label__Other She 
"__label__Other specifically denies any exertional chest pain, palpitations, or transient "
__label__Other neurologic symptoms.
__label__Other She can climb a flight of stairs at her own pace but is 
__label__Other mildly dyspneic at the top of the stairs.
__label__Other She feels that her exertional 
__label__Other capacity has increased somewhat over the past year and a half since she 
__label__smoker.past stopped smoking.
"__label__Other She does not have a known history of hypertension, however "
__label__hypertension.high_bp.before_dct VNA has been documenting blood pressures in the range of 130 to 190 mm Hg 
__label__Other systolic with diastolic pressures ranging from 72 to 110 mm Hg despite therapy 
__label__medication.calcium_channel_blocker..before_dct with verapamil.
__label__Other There is no prior history of syncope.
__label__Other Page Two
__label__medication.calcium_channel_blocker..before_dct Her current medications are verapamil 240 mg daily as above and Premarin.
__label__Other has GI intolerance to several analgesic medications.
__label__Other She previously smoked 
__label__Other two packs per day but quit a year and a half ago of her own volition without 
__label__Other any particular change in her health precipitating this.
__label__Other She rarely drinks 
__label__Other ethanol.
__label__Other She has not had any prior surgeries.
__label__Other Family history is negative for premature coronary artery disease.
__label__Other Review of 
__label__Other systems is negative for thyroid disease and a TSH was normal during her last 
__label__Other admission.
__label__obese.mention.during_dct Physical examination reveals a healthy-appearing obese woman sitting 
"__label__hypertension.high_bp.during_dct comfortably with a blood pressure of 140/90, heart rate 73 and regular."
__label__Other HEENT 
__label__Other is externally unremarkable.
__label__Other There is no lid lag and no thyromegaly.
__label__Other Carotids 
__label__Other are palpable bilaterally.
__label__Other Lungs are clear to auscultation.
__label__Other Cardiac exam 
__label__Other reveals somewhat distant heart tones and I am not able to palpate the apical 
__label__Other impulse.
__label__Other There is a soft systolic murmur at the left sternal border.
__label__Other Abdomen 
__label__Other is soft and nontender.
__label__Other There is a healing surgical incision in the lower 
__label__Other abdomen.
__label__Other Extremities are without edema.
__label__Other Dorsalis pedis pulses are easily 
__label__Other palpable.
__label__Other The 12-lead electrocardiogram shows sinus rhythm at 73 bpm with a PR interval 
"__label__Other of .18, QRS .08."
__label__Other There are low amplitude T waves in the lateral precordium 
__label__Other and inverted T waves in I and aVL with slightly leftward axis.
__label__Other An 
"__label__Other echocardiogram performed during her last hospitalization was normal, although "
__label__Other with some mild evidence of ventricular hypertrophy.
__label__Other My impression is that Ms. Yarbrough has had one episode of atrial fibrillation in 
__label__Other the perioperative period.
__label__hypertension.mention.after_dct She probably has mild labile hypertension which has 
__label__Other not been previously treated.
__label__Other This would explain her electrocardiographic 
__label__Other changes and the echocardiogram as well as the possible predisposition to 
__label__Other atrial fibrillation.
__label__medication.calcium_channel_blocker..before_dct I took the liberty of switching her from verapamil 240 
__label__medication.beta_blocker..after_dct mg daily to atenolol 50 mg daily.
__label__Other Once her incision is further healed we will 
__label__Other arrange for her to have an exercise tolerance test to get some reassurance 
__label__Other regarding the possible co-existence of coronary artery disease in view of her 
__label__Other mild electrocardiographic abnormalities in atrial fibrillation.
__label__Other Page Three
__label__Other will see her again in six weeks at which time she will have the exercise 
__label__Other tolerance test.
__label__Other We cautioned her to take her pulse on a daily basis and 
__label__Other report to us if it becomes irregular and rapid.
__label__Other We also gave her a 
__label__medication.nitrate..after_dct prescription for nitroglycerin 0.4 mg and instructions on how to take this 
__label__Other medication in the event of a recurrence of the substernal chest discomfort 
__label__Other which accompanied her transient atrial fibrillation.
__label__Other Thank you very much for allowing me to participate in her care.
"__label__Other Sincerely,"

__label__Other CLINIC NOTE 
__label__Other Victor Lujan
__label__Other SMH#:  018-92-33
"__label__Other March 25, 2073"
__label__Other DIAGNOSIS:
"__label__Other Bilateral hand numbness and pain, recurrent carpal tunnel syndrome."
__label__Other SUBJECTIVE:
"__label__diabetes.mention.after_dct The patient is a 54-year-old right-hand dominant male with multiple medical problems including diabetes mellitus and renal failure requiring hemodialysis, who was has had bilateral hand numbness for several years, but getting worse within the last year or so."
__label__Other The patient states that he has had past carpal tunnel release and trigger finger release of the bilateral hand and the symptoms that he is feeling now is somewhat similar 2-10 years ago appearance of symptoms.
__label__Other PAST MEDICAL HISTORY:
"__label__diabetes.mention.after_dct Hypertension, diabetes mellitus, and chronic renal failure."
__label__Other PAST SURGICAL HISTORY:
"__label__Other Bilateral eye surgeries, right shoulder surgeries, and bilateral carpal tunnel surgery as mentioned above."
__label__Other CURRENT MEDICATIONS:
"__label__medication.insulin..before_dct Multiple antibiotics including isoniazid, doxycycline, insulin, Cardura, Glucophage, Elavil, and Biaxin."
__label__Other Please note that the patient is hepatitis C positive and hepatitis B positive.
__label__Other PHYSICAL EXAMINATION:
"__label__Other On today s examination, the patient was noted to have a fairly long carpal tunnel scar on bilateral hands extending all the way to the volar wrist level."
"__label__Other Long finger and right index finger scar at the base at the MP joint level is noted, the fourth trigger release, which was performed in 2062 as well."
__label__Other The patient has rather stiff fingers overall with inability to fully flex the fingers all the way to the thumb space.
"__label__Other There is no locking or triggering, but fairly extensive stiffness involving the flexor tendon was noted."
__label__Other Durkan s test was positive and Phalen s test was positive as well.
"__label__Other However, abductor pollicis brevis function is intact."
"__label__Other Other examination demonstrated some noticeable decrease in size of the muscle with some prominence of the vasculature on the radial side of the left hand, but otherwise normal examination."
__label__Other IMPRESSION:
__label__Other As above.
__label__Other PLAN:
__label__Other My recommendation is that patient undergo very vigorous assessment for the median nerve function.
"__label__Other In addition to this, I would like to actually consider providing him with the stretching exercises and flexion exercises as well as passive range of motion of the fingers."
__label__Other It may be a little to early to consider this option until he returns with the result of EMG nerve conduction study.
"__label__Other Vance-Ernest Yamasaki, M.D."

"__label__Other We had the pleasure of caring for your patient, Mr. Yul Tanner, during his admission to the Floyd County Hospital from 12/19/2092 through 12/20/2092 for diagnostic catheterization."
"__label__obese.mention.before_dct As you recall, he is a 57-year-old man with a history of diabetes, hypertension, dyslipidemia, and obesity, who initially presented with chest discomfort on 12/09/2092."
"__label__cad.test.before_dct Mr. Tanner ruled out for myocardial infarction at that time and underwent stress testing, which was positive."
__label__Other He returns today for diagnostic catheterization.
__label__cad.mention.before_dct Cardiac catheterization revealed noncritical coronary artery disease with an approximately 50% ostial right coronary artery lesion in a left dominant system.
__label__Other The right femoral arteriotomy site was manually compressed without complication.
__label__Other Mr. Tanner was admitted to the Cardiovascular Unit overnight for observation.
"__label__Other Overnight he did well, specifically, he denied any chest pain, shortness of breath, groin, or flank pain."
"__label__Other He remained hemodynamically stable, and was ambulating, eating, and voiding without difficulty."
"__label__Other On examination, his cardiac exam revealed a regular rate and rhythm with normal S1 and S2."
__label__Other Lungs were clear to auscultation throughout all lung fields.
__label__Other His groin was soft and mildly tender with no hematoma and no bruit noted.
__label__Other His lower extremities were warm and well perfused with intact distal pulses.
"__label__Other His morning labs were significant for sodium of 142, potassium of 4.1, BUN of 18, creatinine of 1."
"__label__Other A CBC revealed a white blood cell count of 4.74, hematocrit of 31.6, and platelets of 304,000."
"__label__Other A fasting lipid panel revealed total cholesterol of 107, triglycerides of 130, HDL of 30, and LDL of 51."
"__label__medication.insulin..during_dct We are planning on discharging Mr. Tanner on the following medications, aspirin 81 mg daily, Lipitor 10 mg daily, diltiazem extended release 360 mg daily, Levoxyl 250 mcg daily, lisinopril 40 mg daily, NPH insulin 80 units subcutaneous daily, Avandia 4 mg daily, and metformin 850 mg twice daily to start on 12/21/2092."

__label__Other Dear Bethany: 
"__label__Other I saw your patient, Fay Foust, in my office today."
"__label__Other Mrs. Foust is a 65-year-old woman who is feeling significantly improved, but who complains of dizziness after she takes her medications."
"__label__diabetes.mention.before_dct Her history of severe hypertension, without definite secondary causes, only a mild left renal artery stenosis, a recent admission for chest discomfort and hypertension, with a CTA that disclosed only modest plaques in her 3 major coronary arteries, treated dyslipidemia, type II diabetes, and vigorous left ventricular systolic function and significant left ventricular hypertrophy, is detailed above."
__label__Other Ms. Foust feels that her life has been brought back to her.
"__label__medication.ace_inhibitor..after_dct She takes her amlodipine, lisinopril, and carvedilol at 8:30 a.m.  Thirty minutes later, she states that she feels lightheaded and her blood pressure can be in the 100/70 mmHg range to 120/80 mmHg range."
__label__Other She believes that her heart rate is approximately 60 beats per minute at those times.
"__label__Other After 1-2 hours, she starts to feel improved."
"__label__medication.ace_inhibitor..after_dct At 8:30 p.m., when she takes only her carvedilol and amlodipine, again, she has similar symptoms."
"__label__Other When she has the symptoms, she sometimes also notices a discomfort in her low back."
__label__Other She has not had dyspnea and she has only rare episodes of mild chest heaviness.
__label__Other She has not had palpitations.
"__label__medication.metformin..before_dct She has not had actual lower extremity swelling, though she feels that after her metformin, her legs can feel heavy."
__label__Other She is not having an alteration in gastrointestinal or genitourinary habits.
"__label__Other She has not had musculoskeletal achiness, aside from the low back discomfort described."
__label__Other She has not had any peripheral numbness.
__label__Other The rest of the review of systems is unremarkable.
"__label__medication.ace_inhibitor..after_dct The present medications are ASA 81 mg a.m., lisinopril 40 mg a.m., amlodipine one-half of a 10 mg tablet a.m., carvedilol 25 mg a.m. and 25 mg evening, simvastatin 40 mg before bedtime, and metformin 500 mg before dinner."
"__label__Other On examination, the weight is 110 pounds, decreased 3 pounds compared to 01/96."
"__label__Other The blood pressure was initially 136/60 mmHg with a heart rate of 60 beats per minute, respiratory rate 12, and she was complaining of low back discomfort, and she was very slightly lightheaded."
"__label__hypertension.mention.before_dct Later, the blood pressure was 160/70 mmHg and she stated that her blood pressure has not been so high for the last several weeks."
__label__Other She was still complaining of slightly dizziness and low back discomfort.
__label__Other The skin is warm and dry and she looks quite calm.
__label__Other She is fully alert.
__label__Other The neck veins are not elevated.
__label__Other The carotid upstrokes are brisk and the volumes are normal.
__label__Other There are no carotid bruits though there was a transmitted murmur.
__label__Other The lungs are clear.
__label__Other The PMI is not displaced.
"__label__Other There is a normal-sounding S1 and a physiologically split S2, with a soft, 2/6 early-peaking systolic murmur across the aortic valve that decreases with Valsalva."
__label__Other The abdomen is benign.
__label__Other There is no renal artery bruit.
__label__Other The distal pulses remain excellent and there is no pedal edema.
__label__Other There is no tenderness of her skin.
"__label__Other The resting electrocardiogram shows a sinus bradycardia at a rate of 56 beats per minute, intervals of 0.20/0.08/0.40, 45-degree axis, very slight inferolateral ST segment flattening."
__label__Other Impression:  Mrs. Foust is feeling much-improved.
"__label__Other The dizziness and low back discomfort that she describes could possibly be associated with a drop in blood pressure to 170 mmHg, with mild hypoperfusion of her spinal arteries, as well as her head."
"__label__Other However, today she had dizziness even with a blood pressure of 160 mmHg."
"__label__medication.ace_inhibitor..after_dct Though we could be tempted to juggle with her regimen and reduce her amlodipine slightly, or change the times when she takes the medications, I think that we are facing some difficulties only related to the poor autoregulation of her cerebral and peripheral vessels."
__label__Other I think that we should continue her on her present regimen.
"__label__Other Gradually, we would expect her symptoms, related to changes in blood pressure, to improve as her vessel elasticity improves."
__label__Other I think that we can be satisfied that she is not becoming too bradycardic.
__label__Other We are pleased with the present regimen.
"__label__Other We have never been absolutely certain that there has been no tiny penetrating aortic ulcer for her discomforts or so dramatic, but the treatment would be precisely as it is now."
"__label__Other We were not surprised by her CTA and her treatment, naturally, remains unchanged."
"__label__medication.metformin..before_dct I think that we want her to continue her metformin, and we may have to consider increasing it to at least twice daily, depending on followup A1c values."
__label__Other Thank you for allowing me to assist in Mrs. Foust's care.
__label__Other I know that you will continue to follow her closely.
__label__Other I told her that I would see her again in nine months.

"__label__Other It is possible that the patient has been dehydrated, considering the last couple days have been very humid, and he hasn't changed his fluid intake."

__label__Other Ischemic event is less likely in this man.

__label__Other   	Neurologic: unlikely with no focal neuro symptoms both witnessed at the time and currently.

"__label__Other Pt: Crawford, Patrick (Mary 3562Z)"
__label__Other MR#: 	902-15-55

"__label__Other Attending: 	Yancey, Ursula"

__label__Other Code status: Full
__label__Other CC:  Generalized weakness + diaphoresis
"__label__hypertension.mention.before_dct HPI:  Pt is an 82 yo man with a history of diet-controlled DM2, HTN, and a syncopal episode 1mo ago who presents with an episode of profuse diaphoresis and generalized weakness while cooking in his home at 10am this morning."
"__label__Other He had recently returned home from grocery shopping, carrying 6 bags of groceries up 1 flight to his apartment, and was moving about his kitchen cooking when he felt suddenly drenched in sweat."
"__label__Other He immediately felt lightheaded, disoriented, nauseous, generally weak, and as though he was about to faint."
"__label__Other He was able to walk a few steps, sit down, and rest for 15-20min before he realized his symptoms weren't resolving, called his sister, and put his head on the table and felt he could not really move because he was so weak."
"__label__Other He denied any CP, SOB, palpitations, flushes, fever/chills, HA, visual changes, vomiting, and focal weakness associated with the episode."
"__label__Other He felt he had been drinking adequate fluids, had no recent infections/cough/rhinorrhea, had no weight loss, and no exposures."
"__label__Other When his sister arrived he told her to call 911, and soon he was brought to the SOH ED."
"__label__Other One month PTA, Mr. Crawford had been in his usual state of health when he had his first ever feeling of lightheadedness and diaphoresis while grocery shopping."
"__label__Other Five minutes later while getting into his car, he had increasing lightheadedness and lost consciousness, falling to the ground with no head trauma."
"__label__Other As with today's episode, he denied prior CP, SOB, palpitations and other symptoms previously listed."
"__label__Other According to his sisters who were present at the time, he regained consciousness 2 minutes later, and he recalls knowing exactly where he was but not what had happened to him."
__label__Other He did not lose continence of bladder or bowel.
"__label__Other He was brought to the ED, where his vitals were stable with a BP of 126/61 and HR 66, and was admitted for observation and workup."
"__label__Other Head CT was negative for an acute process, CXR was clear, EKG showed some LA enlargement and mild ST / Twave changes consistent with an EKG of 2yrs ago, negative cardiac enzymes, and a cardiac echo showing mild MR, an elongated LA, and an EF of 68%."
__label__Other At the time of discharge he was instructed to stop taking Prazosin for his BPH and instead take Flomax.
"__label__Other In the past month, Mr. Crawford has had no repeat syncopal episodes, but many episodes of diaphoresis with very mild lightheadedness."
"__label__Other He reports that at least every few days he either has a brief diaphoresis episode during his daily activities, or sometimes a profuse diaphoresis that can occur while lying in bed and causing him to change his clothes and bedsheets."
__label__Other He has had no other symptoms.
"__label__Other Of note, this morning he had run out of Flomax due to an insurance issue, and resumed taking 4mg of leftover Prazosin for his BPH around 6am."
__label__Other He disliked the Flomax because it seemed to cause polyuria and generally made him feel 'off' in an unidentifiable way.
"__label__Other Currently the pt feels slightly lightheaded/'woozy', sometimes worse with positional changes, and still generally weak, with no other symptoms."
"__label__diabetes.mention.before_dct PMH: 	- DM2: diagnosed 2080, initially took an oral hypoglycemic agent for 6mo, but since has been managed by diet and exercise only."
__label__Other HbA1c checked q3mo; most recent was around 5.0 per pt.

__label__Other _____________________________________________________________________________________
"__label__hypertension.mention.before_dct Impression:  Pt is an 82 yo man with a h/o DM2, HTN, and a syncopal episode 1mo ago p/w diaphoresis and generalized weakness 15min after moderate activity."
"__label__Other Episode occurred in setting of frequent diaphoresis episodes in the past 1mo, and with medication change from Flomax to Prazosin this morning 4hrs prior to current episode."
"__label__Other No LOC, CP, SOB, or seizure-like activity."
__label__Other No focal deficits and non-orthostatic on exam with strength intact.
__label__Other Stable Hct.
__label__Other Likely etiologies include:
__label__Other 1.
"__label__Other Arrhythmia, including sick sinus."
"__label__Other EKGs demonstrate mild LA enlargement, old V1/V2 Q waves."
__label__Other Could predispose to atrial fib or conduction abnormalities.
"__label__Other Sick sinus not seen on EKG, but common cause of pre-syncope."
__label__Other 2.
__label__Other Vertebrobasilar/Carotid stenosis.
"__label__Other Basilar territory could lead to dizziness; would expect more focal findings if carotid etiology, unless bilateral blockage."
__label__Other 3.
__label__Other Prazosin-induced hypotension.
"__label__Other In light of very recent change back to Prazosin, which has more vascular/peripheral alpha-1 antagonism than does the more prostate-specific Flomax, could result in cerebral hypoperfusion."
__label__Other 4.
__label__Other Neurocardiogenic/Carotid hypersensitivity.
__label__Other Plan:
__label__Other Pre-syncope:	- ROMI with 2nd and 3rd set of cardiac markers
__label__Other 		- Telemetry
__label__Other 		- 24 hr Holter monitor
__label__Other 		- Carotid Doppler and Posterior Transcranial Doppler
"__label__Other 		- Check lytes, CBC + diff in a.m."
__label__Other 		- IVF: NS 500cc at 75cc/hr
"__label__medication.diuretic..after_dct 		- Continue Lisinopril, HCTZ but discontinue Prazosin as inpatient"
"__label__medication.aspirin..during_dct 		- ASA qod as at home, consider    qd"
__label__diabetes.mention.before_dct DM2:		- Check glucose in a.m.
__label__Other 		- No insulin requirement; order diabetic diet
__label__Other OA:		- Motrin 400mg bid; check BUN/Cr and U/A for evidence of AIN or ATN
__label__Other Gout:		- Continue Allopurinol
"__label__Other Optho:		- Continue home regimen of Truopt, Artificial tears, etc."

__label__Other Assessment & Plan
"__label__hypertension.mention.before_dct 83 y/o man with known CAD, diabetes, hypertension, hyperlipidemia who presents with near syncope, as well as vomiting."
"__label__cad.mention.before_dct Certainly in someone with known CAD, cardiogenic near-syncope is most concerning, namely, MI, with atypical features."
"__label__Other However, his EKG is unchanged, his troponins are negative, and he never had chest pain."
"__label__Other Perhaps his light-headedness is secondary to bradycardia, as his heart rate has been in the 50s and 60s."
"__label__Other However, I think the most likely explanation is that he has a bit of gastroenteritis, was dehydrated, and had a vasovagal response in the setting of exertion."
__label__Other It is worth checking orthostatics given his rigorous blood pressure regimen.
__label__Other There is nothing to suggest seizure or other neurologic etiologies given his story.
"__label__Other Syncope: Stable, no longer feeling dizzy or nauseated"
__label__Other Admit to telemetry and monitor overnight
__label__Other Has completed MI r/o
"__label__medication.beta_blocker..after_dct Continue ASA, beta blocker, (w/ hold parameters), statin, ACE"
"__label__Other Has close follow up w/ Dr. Youmans (next week), and likely does not need repeat stress test while in house"
"__label__cad.mention.after_dct CAD: As above, will d/c on 50 PO Toprol BID per Dr. Youmans    recommendations"

__label__Other RISS while in house with BID fingersticks to assess glucose control
__label__Other Elevated WBC: Likely 2/2 gastroenteritis.

__label__Other exercise tolerance test recently and was seen by Cardiology who felt 
__label__Other that he should undergo cardiac catheterization.

__label__Other overweight and the decision was made for him to reduce his weight by 
__label__Other approximately 50 lb.
__label__Other at which time he would be suitable for cardiac 
__label__Other catheterization on the Pontiac equipment.
__label__Other Patient was seen last night 
__label__Other in the Pontiac Emergency Room with a several day history of back pain 
__label__Other which began in the middle of his back and has subsequently become right 
__label__Other flank pain which is persistent and colicky in nature.
__label__Other On exam in the Emergency Room he was noted to be afebrile.
__label__Other His exam was 
__label__Other notable for CVA tenderness and an exam highly suspicious of renal colic.
__label__Other His EKG was unremarkable and his laboratory exam was unremarkable as 
__label__Other well.

__label__Other did have 3+ uric acid crystals with a normal uric acid blood level.
__label__Other An 
__label__Other abdominal ultrasound was ordered which was unremarkable except for the 
__label__Other presence of his slight abnormality in the right pole of a kidney.
__label__Other IVP 
__label__Other was recommended by the radiologist for follow-up.

__label__Other in the Emergency Room with minimal improvement and sent home with some 
__label__Other Motrin with the follow-up to be by me in Internal Medicine Clinic.
__label__Other I was called by 
__label__Other the patient this morning complaining of worsening pain in his right 
__label__Other flank.
"__label__Other On it, patient states he is unable to get out of bed and was "
__label__Other brought to the Pontiac State Hospital to my Internal Medicine Clinic.
__label__Other On exam 
__label__Other he was afebrile and his exam was notable for a right CVA tenderness with 
__label__Other pain radiating around to his abdomen and exacerbated by pushing on his 
__label__Other abdomen.
__label__Other Patient has good bowel sounds throughout and there are no 
__label__Other peritoneal signs.
