__label__Other pathology I believe that there is a significant chance that this may be 
"__label__Other musculoskeletal in nature, however, due to his other medical problems I "
__label__Other feel that an intravenous pyelogram is definitely indicated and he will 
__label__Other undergo this study this afternoon.
__label__Other I have also sent off a repeat CBC 
"__label__Other with differential, a repeat urinalysis and amylase and lipase levels to "
__label__Other rule out pancreatitis.

__label__Other status post cholecystectomy.

__label__Other further therapeutic interventions at that time.

__label__Other I did see Irene Upshur for a followup today.
"__label__Other As you know, I did see her back in September where she was diagnosed with possible right-sided eustachian tube dysfunction."
"__label__diabetes.glucose.before_dct Her blood sugars have been under reasonably good control, 88 and then 300."
__label__Other She reports that her hearing has continued to fluctuate.
"__label__Other When questioned, she reports that she only used the nose spray twice since I did prescribe it."
"__label__Other On examination today, she otherwise appears well."
__label__Other Ears are unremarkable.
__label__Other Her eardrums are intact.
__label__Other She has no tympanosclerosis or cholesteatoma.
__label__Other Her gait is normal.
__label__Other There is no nystagmus.
"__label__Other An audiogram done today does show a sloping high frequency sensorineural hearing loss, which is symmetric."
__label__Other Her discrimination scores are 100% in the right ear and 100% in the left ear.
__label__Other Assessment:  Mild ear fullness with dysequilibrium and blockage.
__label__Other Plan:  She does take multiple medications.
__label__Other It continues to be very unclear to me what her underlying causality is.
__label__Other I would like her to use the nasal spray more consistently.
"__label__Other If she does fail this and this is not eustachian tube dysfunction, I would consider her to have endolymphatic hydrops."
__label__Other This would respond hopefully to a diuretic and potassium supplementation.
"__label__medication.arb..after_dct However, she has taken multiple medications currently for both blood pressure including atenolol, Cozaar, Lasix, and verapamil."

__label__Other Record date: 2095-05-05
"__label__Other May 03, 2095 "
"__label__Other Carlos Pacheco, M.D."
__label__Other New Milford Hospital 
__label__Other Department of Medicine 
"__label__Other RE: Emery, Donn "
__label__Other NMH#: 059-57-26 
__label__Other Dear Dr. Pacheco:  
"__label__Other I had the pleasure of seeing your patient, Donn Emery, in the Internal Medicine recently."
__label__Other Thank you for your kind referral.
__label__Other I will summarize his history and physical examination for my own records.
__label__Other Mr. Emery is a 86-year-old right-handed gentleman who is referred with complaint and electrophysiologic findings consistent with a generalized sensory motor polyneuropathy.
__label__Other His symptoms began a number of years ago when he noticed bilateral loss of sensation at the tips of his fingers in the hands.
__label__Other This had extended over several months to include his feet as well.
"__label__Other Over many months to years he has noticed a weakness of his grip bilaterally, which over the more recent period of time encompassing the last year has been worse on the left."
__label__Other At one time that grip weakness was ascribed to possible carpal tunnel syndrome and he underwent a right carpal tunnel release on the right approximately four years ago.
__label__Other Three weeks ago he underwent a left carpal tunnel release for these same symptoms.
"__label__Other He has had no falls, but does note some unsteadiness on his feet."
__label__Other He has had no sensations of tingling or loss of sensory stimulus around his face.
"__label__Other He has had no diplopia, dysarthria, dysphagia, or bowel or bladder complaints that might be related to  neurologic problems."
__label__Other He has occasional shortness of breath on exertion.
"__label__Other Otherwise, the remainder of his medical and neurologic review of systems is unremarkable."
"__label__Other Past medical history is significant for a past episode of urethral stones, history of lymphoma of unclear type by the medical record but would appear to be non-Hodgkins."
__label__Other He is undergoing extensive surveillance on a yearly basis for recurrence.
"__label__diabetes.mention.before_dct He has a history of prostate hypertrophy, hypertension, and longstanding history of noninsulin-dependent diabetes since the age of 50."
__label__Other His glucose control by his history has been very good.
"__label__Other He has lumbar back pain, a history of a heart murmur."
"__label__medication.aspirin..after_dct Current medications include aspirin, Cozaar, clopamide, Triamterene, Tenormin, and Glucophage."
__label__Other He has no known drug allergies.
"__label__smoker.never He does not smoke, uses alcohol socially, lives in Juneau South, has no obvious toxin exposure to heavy metals."
__label__Other His family history is negative for obvious neuromuscular disease.
__label__Other He had a brother who died in his 50s of some sort of brain infection.
"__label__Other He has several children, all in good health."
"__label__Other On my examination today, he is alert and well appearing, with good concentration, memory, and language function."
__label__Other No carotid bruits could be appreciated.
__label__Other The peripheral vascular examination revealed weak pulses in all four limbs.
"__label__Other He had full extraocular motility, with normal visual fields bilaterally."
__label__Other Funduscopy was normal bilaterally.
__label__Other Pupillary reflexes were intact to both light and near stimulation.
"__label__Other The muscles of facial expression, mastication, and the lower bulbar musculature were intact bilaterally."
__label__Other Facial sensation was intact bilaterally to light touch.
"__label__Other On motor examination, occasional fasciculations were seen throughout."
"__label__Other There was clear wasting of the intrinsic muscles of the hands bilaterally, and trace weakness at IV+/V by MRC criteria in a symmetric distribution of the hands bilaterally."
"__label__Other Otherwise, muscles of the proximal shoulder girdle, forearm, and upper arm were V/V bilaterally."
"__label__Other In the lower extremities, again, distal muscle wasting was noted, although power in all muscle groups was full."
__label__Other Sensation testing revealed a moderate-to-severe deficit in vibratory and joint position sense distally in the lower extremities.
"__label__Other Temperature, pinprick and light touch sensation appeared to be intact."
"__label__Other There was no dysmetria on finger-nose-finger testing, and gait was not ataxic."
__label__Other Romberg was slightly positive with sway but no fall.
__label__Other Deep tendon reflexes were hyporeflexic throughout.
"__label__Other Specifically I+ reflexes were elicited in the patellar tendons in a symmetric distribution, trace ankle jerks were elicited, and I+ reflexes were elicited in the biceps, triceps, and brachioradialis."
__label__Other There was no jaw jerk.
__label__Other Toes were downgoing bilaterally.
__label__Other Mr. Emery has already undergone EMG nerve conduction study recently at this institution.
__label__Other Those results were available for me today.
"__label__Other They are consistent with a generalized axonal sensory motor polyneuropathy, which is moderate in distal extremities."
__label__Other Both active and chronic denervation changes are seen on the EMG.
"__label__Other There is no evidence for demyelinating phenotype, and nerve conduction does reveal a conduction block at common sites of compression of the median nerve in the wrist, consistent with carpal tunnel syndrome."
"__label__diabetes.mention.after_dct Given the apparent chronic nature of Mr. Emery's complaints, an axonal sensory motor neuropathy most likely idiopathic in origin, or more probably related to the diabetes is the likely diagnosis."
"__label__Other With respect to the weakness in the hands, which appears to encompass more muscle groups than would be accounted for by a median nerve compression at the wrist, this is likely the consequence of this longstanding axonal degeneration."
"__label__Other There is no abnormality on the history, examination, or current electrophysiology that would lead me to suspect this is anything more unusual."
"__label__diabetes.mention.after_dct In addition to the diabetes, of course the primary concern would be lymphoma-related neuropathy, either related to direct lymphomatous invasion of the perineurium, or more  often as a perineoplastic phenomenon."
"__label__Other The very chronic nature of his symptoms would argue against this as a likely etiology, and he is, of course, undergoing extensive surveillance for such a recurrence."
__label__Other I would not think that his current symptomatology would be any cause for greater concern regarding new recurrence of  his illness.
"__label__Other Unfortunately, as you know, we are not able to offer anything in the way of therapy for this at this time."
"__label__Other We can certainly treat any positive symptoms of painful dysesthesias fairly effectively with antineuropathic pain medications such as Amitriptyline, Gabapentin, or sodium channel agents such as phenytoin or _____."
"__label__Other However, this is not a prominent complaint of Mr. Emery's and this is not likely to be helpful for him."
"__label__Other Nevertheless, there may be other therapies in the near future that might be available for this type of problem."
"__label__Other I will be happy to continue to see Mr.  Emery on a roughly yearly basis, so that he can keep in touch and be made aware of any therapy that might be helpful and available for him in the future."
__label__Other If you have any questions please do not hesitate to call me.
"__label__Other Once again, thank you for your kind referral."
"__label__Other Sincerely, "
"__label__Other Igor Velazquez, M.D., Ph.D.  "

__label__Other Left and right common and external iliac arteries patent.
__label__Other Stent at the origin of the right ext iliac had a 30% diffuse narrowing.
__label__Other Bilateral internal iliac arteries have moderately severe stenoses in the distal aspect of main branches.
"__label__Other The left SFA has two areas of tapered stenosis up to 70% one is proximal and the other is midvessel; main popliteal is patent, but focal 75% stenosis present at distal portion prior to trifurcation."
__label__Other Anterior and posterial tibial vessels occluded and reconstitute at the ankle by collaterals from the peroneal.
__label__Other The peroneal has calcified 60% diffuse disease in the proximal segment.

__label__Other Dear Kenneth: 
"__label__cad.event.before_dct Mr. Lara returned today after a 1-year hiatus because of coronary disease, status post percutaneous intervention."
"__label__Other He states that his general health has been stable over the past year but over the past several months he has noted, particularly in the hot weather, a sense of dyspnea after walking about 170 feet to his mailbox, or across a large parking lot, such as Grand Union."
"__label__Other At the end of activity he tends to note a sense of regular fluttering in his chest that persists for a minute or two, and he has also noted the latter almost every night when first lying in bed."
__label__medication.beta_blocker..before_dct He has not had any recurrent orthostatic symptoms since his Toprol dose was reduced last year.
__label__Other He has not had any exertionally related chest discomfort or symptoms similar to those prior to his percutaneous interventions.
__label__Other MEDICATIONS:
__label__Other 1.
__label__medication.aspirin..after_dct Aspirin 325 mg daily.
__label__Other 2.
__label__medication.thienopyridine..during_dct Clopidogrel 75 mg daily.
__label__Other 3.
__label__medication.statin..before_dct Atorvastatin 40 mg daily.
__label__Other 4.
__label__medication.fibrate..after_dct Lopid 600 mg b.i.d.
__label__Other 5.
__label__medication.beta_blocker..before_dct Toprol XL 12.5 mg daily.
__label__Other 6.
"__label__Other Xanax, Benadryl at bedtime, multivitamin."
__label__Other INTOLERANCE TO MEDICATIONS:
__label__Other Higher-dose beta blocker - orthostasis.
__label__Other Lisinopril - questionable contribution to orthostasis.
"__label__Other On examination, he is comfortable at rest."
"__label__hypertension.high_bp.during_dct The blood pressure is 170/100 checked twice, supine, standing it is 160/96, heart rate 82 and regular, weight 204 pounds, oxygen saturation 98%."
__label__Other The jugular venous pressure is 5.
__label__Other The carotid upstrokes are symmetric and not delayed.
__label__Other The chest is clear.
__label__Other Cardiac exam shows a grade II/VI holosystolic murmur localized to the apex.
"__label__Other The abdominal exam shows no organomegaly, pulsatile masses or bruits."
__label__Other There is no peripheral pitting edema.
"__label__Other The electrocardiogram shows sinus rhythm with left atrial abnormality and no new ST-T wave abnormalities compared to October 30, 2093."
"__label__Other In summary, Mr. Lara has:"
"__label__cad.event.before_dct History of CAD, status placement of a drug-eluting stent in the LAD, 7/92, without recurrent angina or signs of left ventricular dysfunction."
"__label__Other Repeat cardiac catheterization, 12/92, because of chest discomfort showed no evidence of restenosis."
"__label__hypertension.mention.before_dct Hypertension, not controlled."
__label__Other His elevated blood pressure may well be contributing to his sense of exertional dyspnea.
__label__Other We spoke about the options.
"__label__medication.ace_inhibitor..before_dct As he had developed orthostatic symptoms previously on higher-dose beta blocker and possibly lisinopril, will use smaller doses of alternate agents in an attempt to lower his pressure."
__label__medication.calcium_channel_blocker..after_dct He will add hydrochlorothiazide 25 mg daily plus amlodipine 2.5 mg daily starting today and already has a follow up appointment with you next week.
"__label__Other To investigate potential contributions to the elevated pressure and sense of tachycardia, blood studies today will include electrolytes, plasma metanephrine level and TSH."
"__label__Other A Holter monitor will also be placed in an attempt to determine what he is experiencing with the sense of ""fluttering"" which occurs at least nightly."
"__label__Other Once his blood pressure is controlled, an exercise test will follow."
__label__Other [Addendum: Holter shows single VPBs/bigeminy at time of his symptoms.
__label__Other Blood studies show normal plasma metanephrines.
"__label__Other He reports feeling better with systolic BP in the 120's on September 18, no further palpitations."
__label__Other He will continue to monitor BP and will call in to schedule ETT]
"__label__medication.fibrate..during_dct Dyslipidemia, on combined statin plus gemfibrozil therapy."
"__label__medication.statin..during_dct When it is time to renew his Lopid, it would be reasonable to switch to TriCor to reduce the potential interaction with statins with respect to myopathy."
__label__Other A serum CK will be included in today's blood studies.
__label__Other Mild mitral regurgitation.
__label__Other It was a pleasure to see Mr. Lara today and I will report back to you following his Holter.
"__label__Other With kind regards, sincerely yours,"

__label__Other Dear Dr. Calhoun;
__label__Other We had the pleasure of seeing your patient Quinten Heath today in Internal Medicine in followup for osteoporosis and hypogonadism.
"__label__Other As you know Mr. Heat is a pleasant 76-year-old man with a history of esophageal cancer status post surgery in 2169, chemotherapy and radiation who had back pain prompting imaging that revealed several vertebral compression fractures and his BMD was consistent with osteoporosis with a T score of minus 4.2 in the lumbar spine and minus 2.3 in the femoral neck."
__label__Other We.
__label__Other started zoledronic acid IV in 05/2171 that he tolerated fine.
"__label__Other In addition, we discovered primary hypogonadism with testosterone levels around 45 mg/dL and elevated FSH and LH levels."
__label__Other We started AndroGel therapy for testosterone replacement and appeared that he is taking every day.
__label__Other He does not really feel any better or stronger with this medication.

__label__Other 1.

"__label__Other HEATH, QUINTEN M. 805-94-75"
"__label__Other REFERRING PHYSICIAN: Fred Quebedeaux, M.D."
__label__Other DATE OF VISIT: 2/4/2173
"__label__Other REASON FOR VISIT: Reassessment of progress, s/p postoperative adjuvant radiation therapy in combination with concurrent chemotherapy for esophageal adenocarcinoma, T2N1 stage IIB, s/p left thoracoabdominal esophagectomy (12/01/69) with pathologic tumor stage T2N1M0 (3/23 involved lymph nodes)."
"__label__Other POSTOPERATIVE RADIATION THERAPY:  For the presence of metastatic disease in regional lymph nodes, he was judged a candidate for postoperative adjuvant chemo-radiation therapy."
"__label__Other He was treated with a total dose of 45 Gy in 25 fractions to the tumor bed region using IMRT, planned with 4D CT simulation."
"__label__Other This treatment was administered in combination with chemotherapy between March 29, 2170, and Apr 30, 2170."
"__label__hypertension.mention.before_dct HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS: Mr. Quinten Heath is a 77 year-old gentleman with a history of smoking, chronic GERD, HTN, CAD s/p PCI, partially blocked L carotid artery and AAA repair x 2."
__label__Other He was in his USOH until 8/69 when he began to have difficulty swallowing.
__label__Other While eating a hamburger he felt it lodge in his chest with accompanying retrosternal discomfort and increased salivation.
"__label__Other He has had about a dozen similar episodes since then, which have generally resolved within 10-15 minutes without regurgitation."
"__label__Other In 9/69 his PCP prescribed a PPI, which helped somewhat, but he continued to have dysphagia."
"__label__Other On 10/16/69 EGD at Griffin Hospital demonstrated a partially-obstructing distal esophageal mass 34-39 cm from the incisors, associated with Barrett&#8217;s esophagus, with pathology significant for well differentiated invasive adenocarcinoma."
__label__Other On 10/17/69 CT of the chest and abdomen showed prominent thickening of the distal esophagus.
__label__Other On 10/21/69 repeat CT of the chest showed an 8 mm LLL nodule and R-sided pleural thickening.
"__label__Other Upper EUS showed a partially obstructing esophageal mass extending from 35-40 cm with 9 mm thickness, suggestive of invasion to the muscularis propria, one suspicious mediastinal LN, and porta hepatis adenopathy."
__label__Other On 10/22 FNA of a porta hepatis LN was negative.
__label__Other He underwent a left thoracoabdominal esophagectomy on 12/1/69.
"__label__Other Pathology showed an ulcerated tumor measuring 4.0x3.5x0.8 cm, invading into muscularis propria (pT2) and metastasis to 3 of 27 LN (N1)."
__label__Other INTERVAL HISTORY/REVIEW OF SYSTEMS: 
__label__Other He has been doing well without significant GI or respiratory symptoms.
__label__Other He has maintained steady energy and appetite.
__label__Other He has had mild dysphagia for solid and meat.
"__label__Other Otherwise, he has been doing well."

__label__Other HISTORY OF THE PRESENT ILLNESS
"__label__cad.mention.before_dct Mr. Xayavong is a 62 year old man with a history of CAD (s/p STEMI and multiple stents), CHF (s/p BiV ICD, class D and stage III), DM, and CRI who was admitted for tailored therapy after a routine RHC demonstrated elevated filling pressures."
__label__Other Mr. Xayavong has a primary cardiologist (Dr. Marshall) in Gloucester and has received much medical care at Oregon City Hospital.
__label__Other He has been followed by Dr. Ashlei Tyson for the possibility of cardiac transplantation and has intermittently been admitted to GNC.
"__label__Other He was admitted to GNC from 6/13/82 to 6/19/82 after being found to be in atrial fibrillation with hypotension, fatigue, and nausea; this was 2 weeks after the placement of his BiV ICD."
"__label__Other He converted to sinus rhythm after amiodarone was administered, but developed a marked transaminitis."
"__label__Other Due to elevated filling pressures (PCWP 23), he required IV Lasix for diuresis."
"__label__Other He was felt to be a poor candidate for CABG given the degree of heart failure, so transplantation was instead pursued."
__label__Other He was also admitted to GNC from 11/10/82 through 11/13/82 after again being found with elevated filling pressures after complaining of fatigue (PCWP 37); he received a PA line and required a Lasix drip and IV nitroprusside.
"__label__Other At the time of discharge, his reported dry weight was 206 lbs."
__label__Other He came for a scheduled right-sided heart catheterization today as he has had increasing complaint of fatigue.
"__label__Other He reports that he has been feeling &#8220;lousy,&#8221; that his appetite has been &#8220;crummy,&#8221; and that he is &#8220;feeling real tired.&#8221;  He feels that these symptoms have been relatively severe but unchanged for the past 2 years."
"__label__Other He denies overt shortness of breath, but essentially fatigues very easily with physical exertion, and has been requiring multiple naps a day."
"__label__Other He states that he has been careful with his diet (both fluid and salt intake) without any changes, and that he has been entirely compliant with his medications."
"__label__medication.beta_blocker..before_dct Of note, his cardiologist attempted to change him from Toprol XL to Coreg several months ago, and that seems to have made him feel worse."
__label__Other He continues to urinate to his home Lasix dosing.
"__label__Other He denies any sensation of chest pain or chest pressure, and denies chest palpitations or sensation of fluttering; he states clearly that he could tell when his heart was in an abnormal rhythm in 6/72."

__label__Other We discussed atrial fibrillation with Mr. Dejesus and his family today.
__label__Other We explained that the brief period of normal sinus rhythm associated with symptomatic improvement may be a reason to proceed with catheter ablation.
"__label__Other However, given his comorbidities and the presence of persistent arrhythmia we warned that a single catheter ablation procedure may not be entirely successful and that waiting period of approximately 3-4 month post-ablation may be required to adjudicate success."
"__label__Other Given the length of the procedure as well as his comorbidities, we feel reasonable to consult with our anesthesia colleagues for possible consideration of performing the procedure under general anesthesia versus with MAC and had procedural sedation."
__label__Other We will leave this decision to them.

__label__Other for his arrhythmia issues.

__label__Other Assessment and Plan:
__label__Other Cardiovascular.
__label__cad.mention.before_dct Patient clearly has coronary artery disease given 
__label__cad.event.before_dct      his past history of angioplasty and his recent complaint of chest 
__label__Other      pain at rest is worrisome for unstable angina.
__label__Other Given that he is on 
"__label__medication.aspirin..after_dct      no current cardiac medication except for aspirin, I will decide to "
__label__medication.calcium_channel_blocker..during_dct      initiate therapy with diltiazem CD 120mg PO q.d.
__label__Other in an attempt to 
__label__Other      control his blood pressure and heart rate.
__label__Other I also encouraged him to 
__label__medication.aspirin..after_dct      continue his aspirin daily and gave him a fresh bottle of 
__label__medication.nitrate..before_dct      nitroglycerin tablets for use with any chest pain in the near future.
__label__medication.calcium_channel_blocker..during_dct The plan will be to get the patient on stable dose of diltiazem and 
__label__Other      maximize the dose for his heart and blood pressure control.
__label__Other After he 
"__label__Other      has been on a stable dose for several days, we will perform an "
__label__Other      outpatient stress test to evaluate whether the patient has any 
__label__Other      evidence of ischemia at this time.
"__label__Other If he does, we will recommend a "
__label__Other      cardiac catheterization to treat any potential lesions which may be 
__label__Other      causing syms of rest angina.
__label__Other The case was discussed with any 
__label__Other      cardiacs that are on call.
__label__cad.mention.before_dct Given the patient's history of coronary artery disease I sent an 
__label__hyperlipidemia.mention.before_dct      SMA-20 level off to assess for hypercholesterolemia which he does 
__label__hyperlipidemia.high_chol..during_dct      have with a cholesterol of 291 and hypertriglyceridemia which he also 
__label__Other      has at a level of 336.

"__label__Other      the past; however, he has not been taking it for the last year."

__label__Other      instructed him to decrease the amount of cholesterol and fats in his 
__label__Other      diet and explained which food contain those products.

__label__Other      initiate treatment with a HMG CoA inhibitor which should decrease 
__label__Other      both his cholesterol as well as the triglycerides.

__label__Other Dear Dr. Kirk:  
"__label__Other I had the pleasure of seeing your patient, Christopher Parrish, in follow up today."
"__label__Other He is a 71-year-old, right-handed man who was admitted to the Sutton Family Care on December 29, 2088 with left arm weakness, ataxia and dysarthria."
__label__Other The impression at that time was for lacunar stroke.
__label__Other An MRI showed a larger area of infarct in the right corona radiata.
"__label__Other The patient had worsening weakness on the night of admission, despite being heparinized."
"__label__Other The following day, he had a flaccid hemiparesis of the left side."
__label__Other Further workup included a magnetic resonance angiogram that showed irregularity of the proximal middle cerebral arteries bilaterally.
__label__Other There was no critical carotid stenosis.
"__label__Other He had an embolic workup which consisted of an echocardiogram showing a preserved ejection fraction, dilated left atrium, very mild inferior hypokinesis, and no patent foramen ovale."
__label__Other He had a Holter monitor which did not reveal any dysrhythmias.
__label__Other His cholesterol level was 152 with an HDL of 23.
"__label__Other It was felt that his stroke was most likely due to atherosclerosis of the middle cerebral artery, involving either one or possibly several lenticulostriate arteries."
__label__Other He did not have any evidence of a flow limiting MCA stenosis.
"__label__medication.aspirin..before_dct He had been on aspirin prior, Plavix was added to his regimen."
"__label__Other Since his discharge from the hospital, he has been in rehabilitation for the last two months."
"__label__Other He has had no further episodes of weakness, numbness, tingling, ataxia, dysarthria, or dysphagia."
__label__Other He has no symptoms of aphasia.
"__label__Other He has been left with some dysarthria from his initial event, which he feels has improved."
__label__Other I would agree with him.
"__label__Other He also has regained some strength in the left leg, and is currently working on using a walker with assistance."
"__label__Other Unfortunately, he has not regained any use of the left arm."
__label__Other He has not had any problems with spasms.
__label__diabetes.mention.before_dct His past medical history is significant for hypertension and type II diabetes mellitus.

__label__cad.event.before_dct He had a quadruple bypass in 2083.

__label__Other There was full range of motion of the joints.
"__label__Other The patient had 2/5 left iliopsoas, 4+/5 hip extensors, 3/5 left quadriceps, 3/5 left ankle dorsiflexors, and 3/5 ankle plantar flexors."

__label__Other I could not find any evidence to pinprick of his neuropathy.
__label__Other Vibration sense was very mildly reduced at the toes.

__label__Other Mr. Parrish's recovery is progressing.
__label__Other He has regained some strength in his left leg and his goal is to be able to walk on his own with either a cane or walker.
__label__Other I hope that this will be the case.
"__label__Other Unfortunately, his left arm has remained flaccid and he has no movement."
__label__Other I told him that his left arm will most likely remain with severe weakness.
__label__Other His stroke was most likely related to atheroma of the middle cerebral artery and lenticulostriate arteries.
"__label__Other I would encourage his blood pressure to be controlled, as has been done, and to continue an anticholesterol agent."
__label__medication.fibrate..after_dct I believe he has been on Gemfibrozil for a while.
__label__Other The literature suggests benefit for the statin drugs in primary prevention of stroke in patients with elevated cholesterol.
__label__medication.fibrate..during_dct I do not think that gemfibrozil has been studied in the same way.
"__label__Other However, since he has been on this medicine so long, it may be worthwhile to continue using it if it is controlling his total cholesterol well."
__label__medication.aspirin..before_dct He should continue on an aspirin a day.
__label__medication.thienopyridine..during_dct He states that he is having difficulty obtaining Plavix due to the cost.
"__label__medication.thienopyridine..during_dct I recommended to him that, in the experience of the Stroke Service at Sutton Family Care, patients in his situation do benefit from being on Plavix for a period of time after a stroke of this type."
__label__medication.thienopyridine..during_dct We recommended to him that he continue on Plavix for another six months because of this.
__label__Other This should give adequate time for any ulcerated or unstable plaque in his middle cerebral artery to heal.
"__label__medication.aspirin..before_dct After six months, if he has had no further clinical events, it would be reasonable to assume that his atheroma is stable and that he could be adequately treated with aspirin."
__label__Other I will see him again in clinic in approximately six months.
__label__Other I will arrange for carotid noninvasives and anterior transcranial Dopplers to evaluate his carotid and middle cerebral artery in approximately one year's time.

"__label__hypertension.mention.before_dct 56 yo M h/o CAD s/p BMS x2 to RCA, HTN, HLD, diet-controlled DM, smoking, p/w chest pain at rest"
"__label__medication.nitrate..after_dct #) Chest Pain: Certain aspects of the history (similar to previous e/o angina, sudden onset, relief with NTG) are concerning for cardiac cause."
__label__Other The subtle but real changes in the ECG and the non-zero troponin are also concerning.
"__label__Other Other etiologies include anxiety (pt described a sense of doom), pulmonary causes (less likely given nl exam and lack of hypoxia), musculoskeletal (pt denies trauma), PE (pt is not tachycardic or hypoxemic)."
__label__Other -Telemetry
"__label__Other -f/u repeat troponin, CK-MB"
__label__Other -If positive will start heparin gtt
__label__Other -If negative will continue to cycle enzymes
__label__Other -Treadmill stress w/imaging in AM
"__label__medication.aspirin..after_dct -Continue ASA 325mg, Plavix"
__label__Other -f/u LFTs given CK elevation but continue home statin (no increase in dose given c/f statin myopathy)
__label__Other #) Thrombocytopenia: appears to be longstanding and stable by labs.
__label__Other The most likely etiology is HCV given the strong association of HCV with thrombocytopenia and his longstanding disease.
"__label__medication.thienopyridine..after_dct Other possibilities include Plavix effect (although thrombocytopenia predates starting plavix), alcohol (although pt claims abstinence), or ITP."
__label__Other Hypoproductive etiologies are less likely given nl WBC and Hct.
__label__Other -f/u smear
__label__Other -monitor CBC
__label__hypertension.mention.before_dct #) HTN: Well controlled on arrival

__label__Other Re:	Russell Urban	
__label__Other WRH#	4722064	
__label__Other Dear Dr. Ussery:
__label__Other I had the pleasure of seeing Mr. Russell Urban in Cardiology Clinic today.
"__label__Other As you know, Mr. Urban is a very pleasant 50-year-old gentleman who on July 09, 2093, while sitting at a concert in Central Park had the sudden onset of feeling    unwell   , epigastric discomfort, and profound diaphoresis."
__label__Other He came to the Worthington Regional Hospital Emergency Room at that time.
"__label__Other By the time he arrived, his symptoms had abated."
"__label__cad.event.before_dct He had an unremarkable electrocardiogram initially and negative cardiac markers, and was admitted to the medicine service to rule-out a myocardial infarction."
"__label__Other That evening, he had recurrent symptoms and was noted to have sustained wide complex tachycardia, which appears to be ventricular tachycardia."
__label__Other He was transferred to the Cardiac Care Unit for further management.
"__label__Other The next morning, he underwent cardiac ultrasound, which revealed an ejection fraction of 28% and a diffusely hypokinetic left ventricle with an akinetic inferior wall."
__label__cad.test.before_dct Additionally his next set of cardiac markers returned positive.
__label__cad.test.before_dct He therefore went cardiac catheterization revealing a total occlusion of his right coronary artery and minimal non-obstructive disease of the left system.
"__label__cad.event.before_dct This artery was stented with total of three stents (two Express stents 2.5 x 24 mm and one Pixel stent 2.5 x 28 mm), encompassing the entire length of the right coronary artery."
__label__Other A left ventriculogram was performed and demonstrated an ejection fraction of 30% with a diffusely hypokinetic ventricle and and akinetic inferior wall.
__label__cad.event.before_dct He ruled in for myocardial infarction with a peak CK of 1490 and a peak troponin of 2.0.
"__label__Other A follow-up echocardiogram was performed on July 15, 2093."
__label__Other This study showed his ejection fraction had improved to 36%; the left ventricle was diffusely hypokinetic and the inferior wall appeared severely hypokinetic.
__label__cad.mention.before_dct His reduced ejection fraction was out of proportion to his degree of coronary disease.
"__label__Other Because of this, a series of laboratory tests were performed which revealed normal iron studies, normal thyroid function, and a normal serum protein electrophoresis pattern."
__label__Other He was discharged in stable condition to follow up with me as an outpatient.
"__label__cad.event.before_dct Since his myocardial infarction, Mr. Urban has been feeling quite well."
__label__Other He has returned to work in the factory where his employed as a manufacturing manager.
"__label__Other He has had no symptoms of angina, dyspnea, nausea, or diaphoresis."
__label__Other He has felt very well.
"__label__Other He continues to take his medications without difficulty, and denies any symptomatology whatsoever."
__label__Other His past medical history prior to this hospitalization is largely unremarkable because he had not sought medical care.
"__label__Other Of note, he reports to me that about 8 or 9 years ago while living in Georgia, he presented to an emergency room with some chest discomfort."
__label__Other He was evaluated and released.
__label__Other He never had any further testing.
"__label__Other He did not have a stress test, cardiac ultrasound or catheterization."
"__label__hyperlipidemia.mention.during_dct Prior to his admission, he did not have any known hypertension or hyperlipidemia, but has been diagnosed with these conditions while in the hospital."
"__label__medication.ace_inhibitor..after_dct His medications include aspirin 325 mg daily, Plavix 75 mg daily, Lipitor 20 mg daily, lisinopril 10 mg daily, and carvedilol 6.25 mg twice each day."
__label__Other He has no known drug allergies.
"__label__Other Ms. Urban is originally from Nicaragua but after working for Imports, Inc, he moved to Georgia where he lived for 24 years working as a Registered Nurse and in various other positions."
__label__Other He immigrated to America about a year or so ago.
__label__Other He has been working in Borders.
"__label__Other He currently lives in Toledo, Montana, with his wife."
__label__Other He has no children.
"__label__smoker.past He smoked 1 to 1-1/2 packs per day for about 30 years, but has not smoked since his hospitalization."
__label__Other He drinks only socially and denies illicit drug use.
__label__cad.mention.before_dct He has a family history of coronary artery disease in that his father had 3 myocardial infarctions and died at a young age of heart disease.
"__label__Other On physical exam, his blood pressure was 130/82 mmHg in his right arm and 126/80 mmHg in his left arm."
__label__Other His heart rate is 60 and regular.
"__label__Other In general, he is in no apparent distress."
__label__Other His jugular venous pressure is 6 cm of water.
"__label__Other His chest is clear to auscultation without rales, wheezes, or rhonchi."
__label__Other His heart is regular in rhythm and rate with a normal S1 and S2.
"__label__Other He has no murmurs, rubs, or gallops."
__label__Other His abdomen is benign.
"__label__Other His extremities are warm and well perfused and without clubbing, cyanosis, or edema."
"__label__Other On vascular exam his carotid pulses are 2+, brisk and without bruits."
"__label__Other His femoral pulses are 2+, brisk and without bruits."
__label__Other His right femoral artery was entered for cardiac catheterization.
__label__Other The site looks clean and intact with no hematoma and no bruit and a strong pulse.
__label__Other His distal pulses are 2+ and symmetric throughout.
"__label__hyperlipidemia.high_chol..before_dct His lipid panel from his hospitalization reveals total cholesterol of 210 mg/dl, LDL of 153 mg/dl, and HDL of 45mg/dl."
__label__Other His electrocardiogram revealed normal sinus rhythm.
"__label__Other He has T wave inversions in III and aVF, and he has a greater than 15 degree disparity between his R and T wave axis."
__label__Other Mr. Urban underwent a exercise treadmill test with sestamibi imaging yesterday.
"__label__Other He exercised for 10 minutes 43 seconds achieving a maximum workload of 12 METS, and a peak double product of 21,600."
__label__Other His electrocardiogram was negative for ischemia.
__label__cad.event.before_dct His nuclear images revealed a mild reduction in tracer activity in the inferior wall which persisted after reinjection consistent with his inferior myocardial infarction.
__label__Other There was no evidence of ischemia elsewhere.
__label__Other His left ventricular ejection fraction was measured at 51%.
"__label__cad.mention.before_dct In short, Mr. Urban is a 51-year-old who had an inferior myocardial infarction, but interestingly during his hospitalization had systolic dysfunction well out of proportion to his coronary disease."
"__label__Other Also, his systolic function has improved over time."
__label__Other I think there are two processes going on.
__label__cad.mention.before_dct One is coronary artery disease.
"__label__cad.event.before_dct Clearly this has manifested itself as an inferior myocardial infarction due to an occluded right coronary artery, which was treated during his hospitalization with stenting."
__label__cad.mention.before_dct The other issue is his transient systolic dysfunction that is out of proportion to his coronary artery disease.
"__label__Other Given the rapid improvement in his ejection fraction, I can only speculate as to the etiology of this."
"__label__Other He does not appear to have a persistent cardiomyopathy, but a transient one."
__label__Other I suspect that this is myocarditis.
"__label__Other Unfortunatley, I have no way of proving this for certain but clinically it seems to fit."
__label__Other It is possible that whatever led to his myocarditis also triggered his acute coronary syndrome.
"__label__medication.aspirin..after_dct From the aspect of his coronary artery disease, he will continue on aspirin for life."
"__label__medication.thienopyridine..after_dct He received quite a substantial amount of stenting to his right coronary artery, and I would opt to continue his Plavix for at least 12 months."
"__label__hyperlipidemia.mention.during_dct For his hyperlipidemia, I agree with Lipitor, and we will recheck his lipid profile to see if the dose of Lipitor is adequate."
__label__Other His LDL goal will be less than 100.
"__label__medication.beta_blocker..before_dct He is well beta-blocked on his carvedilol, and we will continue with the current dose of 6.25 mg twice daily."
__label__medication.ace_inhibitor..after_dct His blood pressure allows us to increase his lisinopril from 10 to 15 mg daily.
__label__Other I will see Mr. Urban again in three months for followup.
__label__Other I will repeat his echocardiogram in six months' time to see where his ejection fraction has settled out.
__label__Other Thank you for allowing me to participate in the care of this very interesting and pleasant gentleman.
"__label__Other The patient was seen and examined, and the case was discussed with Dr. Orville Ness."
"__label__Other Sincerely,"
"__label__Other Jimmy Orozco, M.D."

__label__Other Dear Dr. Ussery:
__label__Other I saw Mr. Urban in follow-up in the office today.
"__label__Other Since his last visit in November, he has been feeling well."
"__label__Other He has had no angina, no exertional dyspnea, no shortness of breath, no orthopnea, no paroxysmal nocturnal dyspnea, no palpitations, and no other symptoms of note."
"__label__Other Since his last visit with me, he has participated in and completed outpatient cardiac rehabilitation."
__label__Other He found this program to be very helpful; he sis very well with the program.
__label__Other He is currently exercising on a regular basis and has no chest discomfort of dyspnea with exercise.
__label__smoker.past He has stopped smoking.
__label__Other There have been no difficulties with his medications.
"__label__Other On 03/16/2094, he had a follow-up echocardiogram done; this study shows an LV ejection fraction of 37% with septal hypokinesis and inferoposterior akinesis; there is trace mitral regurgitation; and aortic sclerosis, but no stenosis."
"__label__Other Notably, he has a right ventricular systolic pressure estimated to be 46 mmHg with a right ventricle that is mildly dilated and mildly-to-moderately hypokinetic."
__label__Other He has been feeling quite well and has no other symptoms.
__label__Other His review of systems is as above and is otherwise negative in detail.
__label__Other Medications:
__label__medication.aspirin..after_dct Aspirin 325 mg daily
__label__medication.thienopyridine..during_dct Plavix 75 mg daily 
__label__medication.statin..before_dct Lipitor 40 mg daily
__label__medication.ace_inhibitor..after_dct lisinopril 10 mg daily
__label__medication.beta_blocker..before_dct Coreg 6.25 mg daily.
__label__Other Physical examination:
__label__Other He appears quite well and is in no apparent distress.
__label__Other His blood pressure is 112/60 mmHg and his pulse rate is 50 beats per minutes and regular.
__label__Other His JVP is 7 cm of water with no Kussmaul's sign.
__label__Other His chest is clear to auscultation bilaterally.
__label__Other His heart is regular in rhythm and rate with a normal S1 and S2.
__label__Other He has no S3 or S4 gallop and no audible murmurs.
__label__Other His abdomen is soft.
__label__Other It is neither tender nor distended.
__label__Other He has normal bowel sounds.
__label__Other His extremities are warm and well perfused.
__label__Other He has no edema.
__label__cad.event.before_dct Impression:  This is a 50 year-old man with coronary disease who suffered an inferoposterior myocardial infarction in July 2093.
"__label__cad.event.before_dct Additionally, he was also found to have cardiomyopathy with an LV ejection fraction of 37 percent."
__label__cad.mention.before_dct He is currently asymptomatic from his coronary disease and his LV dysfunction.
"__label__Other Notably, his last echocardiogram shows that he has increased RV systolic pressure and some early right ventricular dysfunction."
__label__Other The etiology of this right ventricular dysfunction is not clear.
__label__Other There is likely a component of left heart failure.
"__label__Other In addition, he may have right heart failure out-of-proportion to left heart failure: he has a longstanding smoking history and may have a degree of COPD and, lastly, he may have obstructive sleep apnea."
"__label__Other He reports to me that he does snore at night, and his first wife in Georgia had told him for many years that during the night he had periods were he would stop breathing."
__label__Other This raises obstructive sleep apnea as a consideration.
"__label__Other Recommendations: Initially, I am going to start him on Lasix 20 mg daily to lower his preload to help with any component of LV failure that is leading to this."
"__label__Other The rest of his regimen is quite good, and I intend to continue them."
"__label__Other To help to see if there is any component of cor pulmonale that may be contributing to this, I am going to obtain first a chest x-ray, secondly a pulmonary function testing, and lastly a sleep study."
"__label__Other If indeed we find components of obstructive lung disease or obstructive sleep apnea, we will have him see a pulmonologist and treat these accordingly."
__label__Other I will see him again in six months' time.
__label__Other Thank you for allowing me to participate in the care of this pleasant gentleman.

__label__Other Is he ischemic with CHF (ECG changes)?
__label__Other ACS?
__label__Other Let's rule out for infarction.
__label__Other Alert William Lewis (cards).
__label__Other Start levoflox 250 QD.
__label__Other Full code.

__label__Other Dear Gray:
__label__Other I had the pleasure of seeing your patient Mr. Henry Oswaldo in clinic today.
"__label__cad.mention.after_dct As you know, he is a 78-year-old gentleman with diabetes who was hospitalized at 06/28/2096 in Quito with any acute coronary syndrome with anterior myocardial infarction."
__label__Other I am seeing him on your request to evaluate him for possible coronary artery bypass surgery.
__label__Other I have reviewed his records and I have summarized the findings.
__label__Other The patient denies having had symptoms of angina until his recent visit to Quiti.
__label__Other At that time in June he had several days of very sharp chest tightness and diaphoresis that were prolonged.
__label__Other He then presented to the Merlin Clinic in Quuto.
"__label__cad.test.before_dct He was found to have an anterior myocardial infarction and underwent catheterization there that showed a critical stenosis of the LAD ( sequential lesions 95 and 99%), first OM(90%) and his right ( dominant vessel with an 80% proximal and then 90%  distal)."
__label__Other An LV gram showed an EF of 55% with just mild mitral regurgitation.
__label__Other An echo performed here at the Wyandot was consistent.

__label__Other Dear Matt:
__label__Other I had the pleasure of seeing Mr. Potts in follow up today.
__label__Other As you
"__label__Other know, he recently had a complicated hospital course."
__label__Other He underwent
"__label__Other cardiac catheterization, which revealed serial stenoses of the LAD"
__label__cad.test.before_dct including 70% and 90% stenoses.
__label__Other The first marginal branch had a
__label__Other 60% ostial stenosis.
__label__Other The right coronary artery had 60 and 80%
"__label__Other stenoses, respectively."
__label__Other The PDA had a 70% narrowing.
__label__Other Given his
"__label__Other very significant wish not to have bypass surgery, it was decided to"
__label__Other proceed with angioplasty of the right coronary artery as well as
__label__Other the obtuse marginal.
"__label__Other It was felt that the LAD was a small vessel,"
__label__Other and not worth going after at this time.
__label__Other The RCA was successfully
"__label__cad.event.before_dct stented, but was complicated by occlusion of the posterior left"
__label__Other ventricular branch.
"__label__Other By the end of the procedure, flow had been"
"__label__Other restored to some degree to the posterior left ventricular branch,"
__label__Other but Mr. Potts rule in for a small subendocardial myocardial
__label__Other infarction.
__label__Other Due to the closure of the left posterior ventricular
"__label__Other branch, the obtuse marginal branch was not dilated."
__label__Other Mr. Potts underwent two exercise tests post procedure.
__label__Other The second
__label__Other exercise test was performed with MIBI imaging.
__label__Other He exercised for
"__label__Other nine minutes on a submaximal Bruce protocol, and experienced chest"
__label__Other pain.
__label__Other He had a maximal blood pressure of 148/72 and a heart rate
__label__Other of 121.
__label__Other MIBI images revealed a small nontransmural myocardial
__label__Other infarction of the basal 1/3 of the inferior wall.
__label__Other There was
__label__Other moderate to severe ischemia of the inferolateral territory in the
__label__Other territory of the RCA.
"__label__Other Given these findings, it was highly recommended that Mr. Potts"
__label__Other undergo bypass surgery.
"__label__medication.aspirin..before_dct Mr. Potts was discharged on aspirin, Ticlid 250 mg b.i.d.,"
"__label__medication.statin..before_dct Atorvastatin 20 mg q.h.s., Atenolol 50 mg b.i.d., Imdur 60 mg q.d."
__label__Other He also takes vitamin E and a multivitamin.
__label__Other Of note is that Mr. Potts has been under quite a bit of stress
__label__Other recently.
__label__Other His 89-year-old mother has been at Whitehead recovering
__label__Other William Potts
"__label__Other MR#  109-16-75-8              -2-       January 5, 2070"
__label__Other from a hip fracture.
__label__Other He is having difficulty arranging the
__label__Other appropriate insurance to cover her medications.

__label__Other This
"__label__Other occurs with increased activity, and is relief with either rest"
__label__medication.nitrate..before_dct and/or 1 nitroglycerin.
__label__Other He has decreased his work level
"__label__Other considerably, and is relatively sedentary."
"__label__Other On physical exam, he was well appearing and in no distress."

"__label__Other a blood pressure of 112/70, with a heart rate of 60."
__label__Other His weight
__label__Other was 203 pounds.
__label__Other Chest was clear to auscultation and percussion.

"__label__Other with a normal S1 and S2, without murmurs, rubs, or gallops."
__label__Other Carotids are 2+ bilaterally without bruits.

__label__Other nontender.

__label__Other flipped T-waves in III and AVF.

__label__Other surgery.

__label__Other Culture pending.

"__label__Other REFERRING PHYSICIAN:  Armando Newton, M.D."
__label__cad.event.during_dct Mrs. Francesca Sergio-Steven is a 72-year-old Hispanic female who presents with a new-onset acute MI.
"__label__medication.insulin..during_dct She has no known prior manifestations of coronary disease, but has a long history of insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus and hypertension."
"__label__Other She had been in her usual state of health until about 2 weeks ago, when she began to have episodes of chest discomfort."
"__label__Other She has only had two such episodes until the morning of admission, when she developed severe episode of chest pain at rest associated with shortness of breath."
__label__Other She presented to the emergency room here where she was found to have new-onset ST-segment elevation in the inferior leads with a coving morphology involving the lateral leads as well.
__label__Other There was also poor R-wave progression V1 through V3.
"__label__Other She was taken urgently to the cardiac catheterization laboratory, where she was found to have a markedly elevated wedge pressure at 30 mmHg with a normal cardiac index and blood pressure."
__label__Other She had mid inferior wall and lateral wall akinesis initially with 3+ mitral regurgitation.
__label__cad.mention.before_dct There was severe diffuse coronary disease with diffuse LAD disease and total occlusion of the proximal circumflex.
__label__Other The right coronary artery was small with a 70% proximal stenosis.
__label__cad.event.during_dct The occluded circumflex was crossed with a wire and was stented with a Cypher drug-eluting stent.
__label__Other She had an excellent result with the wedge also decreasing to 20 mmHg.
__label__Other She had an estimated 70% ejection fraction despite the inferior and lateral akinesis.
__label__Other Cardiac index was 2.5 with SVR of 1739.
__label__Other She was then brought to the coronary care unit for further evaluation.
__label__medication.ace_inhibitor..after_dct Her past medical history is notable for hypertension for which she takes lisinopril 40 mg q.d.
__label__medication.beta_blocker..during_dct and atenolol 50 mg q.d.
__label__medication.insulin..during_dct She also has insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus and takes insulin.
__label__Other Past medical history is also notable for a hysterectomy.
__label__smoker.never Social history is notable for no cigarette or alcohol use.
__label__Other She is from Paraguay and has recently arrived in this country.
"__label__Other Review of systems show no fever, chills, nausea, or vomiting."
"__label__hypertension.high_bp.during_dct On exam, she is comfortable with a blood pressure initially 160/80 with a heart rate of 70 and regular."
__label__Other Followup pressure 125/80 with a heart rate of 72 beats per minute.
__label__Other Head and neck were unremarkable.
__label__Other Chest is clear.
__label__cad.event.during_dct Cardiac exam shows no jugular venous distention at 30 degrees.
__label__cad.event.during_dct PMI is normal.
__label__Other S1 and S2 were normal with a physiological split.
__label__Other There is an S4 and a 1/6 systolic ejection murmur as well as a 1 to 2/6 holosystolic murmur and mitral regurgitation at the left lower sternal border.
__label__Other There is no S3.
__label__Other Abdominal exam was unremarkable without organomegaly.
__label__Other Bowel sounds are normal.
__label__Other Extremities showed no edema or cyanosis.
__label__Other Calf site is clean without bruits.
__label__Other Distal pulse is decreased but palpable.
__label__cad.event.during_dct Her resting 12-lead electrocardiogram shows evidence of her evolving inferolateral MI.
"__label__Other Other lab values included creatinine 1.0 with normal electrolytes, hematocrit is 44.4%, white blood cell count 3.8 with platelets 322,000."
__label__Other Liver function tests are normal.
__label__Other A portable chest x-ray shows pulmonary edema.
__label__cad.event.during_dct Mrs. Sergio-Steven clearly has evidence of an inferoposterior MI initially with a very high filling pressure and pulmonary edema and mitral regurgitation.
"__label__cad.event.during_dct She has had her circumflex, which is a very large vessel, well treated now with a drug-eluting stent, and her wedge has come down, and her mitral regurgitation is substantially improved."
"__label__medication.nitrate..during_dct At this point, we will bring her to the coronary care unit for careful management with aspirin, Plavix, heparin, continue the Integrilin, as well as Lasix and nitrates."
"__label__Other We will plan to initiate afterload reduction as soon as tolerated, and also plan beta-blockade to limit her myocardial oxygen demands."
__label__cad.mention.before_dct She certainly has co-existent quite substantial coronary disease including primarily the right coronary artery degree and to some degree the LAD.
"__label__Other At this point, if she were to have developed recurrent ischemia, we would proceed to consideration of bypass surgery."

__label__Other Dear Vester:
__label__Other Mrs. Vance presents to the office today for general cardiac
__label__Other evaluation.
"__label__Other As her history is well known to you, I will repeat it"
__label__Other briefly for our records.
__label__Other Mrs. Vance is a 47-year-old woman with
"__label__diabetes.mention.during_dct a history of variegata porphyria, insulin dependent diabetes and"
__label__cad.mention.during_dct significant coronary artery disease.
"__label__Other In 2061, after a four to five"
"__label__Other day history of retrosternal chest discomfort, she was admitted to"
__label__Other the Barton Memorial Hospital where coronary angiography
__label__Other revealed a 95% proximal left anterior descending artery stenosis.
__label__cad.event.during_dct She underwent balloon angioplasty of her LAD times two with
__label__Other inadequate results.
__label__Other She therefore was taken electively for
__label__cad.event.during_dct coronary artery bypass graft surgery with placement of a left
__label__Other internal mammary artery to her LAD.
__label__Other She subsequently continued to
__label__Other have chest discomfort and underwent repeat cardiac catheterization
__label__Other in May of 2063 at which time coronary angiography revealed a 60%
__label__Other stenosis in the proximal left anterior descending artery and a 50%
__label__Other stenosis in the mid right coronary artery.
__label__Other The catheterization
__label__Other report does not indicate the status of her left internal mammary
__label__Other artery graft.
"__label__Other Since then, she has continued to have episodes of"
__label__Other intermittent abdominal discomfort.
__label__Other She recently has undergone an
__label__Other extensive evaluation by the gastroenterology service for her
__label__Other abdominal pain without specific pathology being discovered.
__label__Other Trials
__label__Other of H2 blockers and proton pump inhibitors have been ineffective.
"__label__Other In November of 2068, she underwent a Bruce protocol stress test"
"__label__Other exercising for eight minutes to a peak heart rate of 131, peak"
__label__Other blood pressure of 188/82 stopping because of fatigue.
__label__Other She had no
__label__Other ischemic changes on electrocardiogram.
__label__Other Over the past two weeks
"__label__Other however, she has noticed that her chronic abdominal pain syndrome"
__label__Other (which she often describes as feeling like indigestion) now
__label__Other includes radiation to her left shoulder.
__label__Other The pain is not
"__label__Other exacerbated by position, time of day or any particular activity."
__label__Other The pain does not awaken her from sleep nor does it occur at rest.
"__label__Other Of note, her lipid profile from October 2068 indicates a"
"__label__hyperlipidemia.high_ldl.before_dct cholesterol of 229, triglyceride of 68, HDL 51, LDL of 164."
"__label__Other Vance, Jennifer"
"__label__Other MR #542-66-00-3                    -2-            July 18, 2069"
"__label__medication.insulin..after_dct Past medical history is notable for variegata porphyria, insulin"

__label__hypertension.mention.after_dct contracture and tendinitis and hypertension.

__label__Other greater than left bruits.

"__label__Other normal S1, physiologically split S2 and a I/VI systolic ejection"

__label__Other diastolic murmur.

__label__Other appreciable edema.

__label__Other PR interval
"__label__Other of .12, QRS .06, QT .36, axis 85 degrees."
__label__Other There are minor
__label__Other nonspecific ST-T wave changes.

"__label__hypertension.mention.after_dct variegata porphyria, insulin dependent diabetes, hypertension and"
__label__cad.mention.during_dct dyslipidemia with known coronary artery disease.
__label__Other She has had a
__label__Other retrosternal chest pain syndrome for the past several years and her
__label__Other most recent stress test approximately one year ago did not show
__label__Other significant provokable ischemia.
"__label__Other Nonetheless, I am concerned that"
__label__Other her clinical presentation may still represent recurrent ischemia.
__label__Other I therefore have scheduled her for an exercise MIBI stress test and
__label__Other I will obtain both an echocardiogram and carotid noninvasive
__label__Other studies.
__label__hyperlipidemia.mention.before_dct In light of her significant dyslipidemia and insulin
"__label__diabetes.mention.after_dct dependent diabetes, I strongly recommend beginning aggressive"
__label__Other antilipemic pharmacologic therapy.
__label__Other Unless her variegata porphyria
"__label__Other precludes the use of atorvastatin, I would begin this at 10 mg po"
__label__Other q.d.
__label__Other I would target her LDL cholesterol to less than 90.

"__label__Other addition, I have started her on atenolol at 25 mg po q.d."

__label__Other I would consider beginning an ACE inhibitor again if her
__label__Other porphyria does not 
"__label__Other MR #542-66-00-3                    -3-            July 18, 2069"
__label__Other preclude this.

__label__Other significant provokable ischemia that I would strongly encourage her
__label__Other to undergo repeat coronary angiography.

__label__Other allowing me to assist in her care.

__label__Other Dear Wanda:
__label__Other Mr. Vance returns for followup.
"__label__Other Since last seen, she apparently was recently seen in the walk-in clinic in your office complaining of profound fatigue and depression."
__label__Other She wonders if she was having a flare of her porphyria.
"__label__Other Apparently, her examination at that time was relatively benign, and no specific new findings were noted."
"__label__Other After talking with Dr. Vogt at that office visit, she felt modestly improved, and over the past few weeks feels that her energy level has returned to its baseline."
"__label__Other Lab studies obtained at that time revealed creatinine 0.9, glucose elevated at 236, hematocrit of 43, with a white count 10."
"__label__Other As no specific pathology was noted, she was sent home without any change in her medical regimen."
"__label__medication.insulin..after_dct Currently, she continues on Lantus insulin 20 units subcutaneous."
"__label__Other q.p.m., Celexa 40 mg p.o."
"__label__medication.aspirin..after_dct q.d., enteric-coated aspirin 81 mg p.o."
"__label__Other q.d., Flonase 1-2 puffs p.o."
"__label__medication.nitrate..during_dct q.d., isosorbide mononitrate 60 mg p.o."
"__label__Other q.d., Neurontin 600 mg p.o."
"__label__medication.nitrate..before_dct t.i.d., nitroglycerin p.r.n."
"__label__medication.ace_inhibitor..after_dct which she has not had to take, lisinopril 10 mg p.o."
"__label__Other q.d., furosemide 20 mg p.o."
"__label__Other q.d., and p.r.n."
__label__Other Motrin.
__label__Other Physical exam reveals a thin woman in no acute distress.
"__label__Other Blood pressure right arm sitting 105/78, heart rate 70 and regular, respirations 14 and unlabored, and weight is pending."
__label__Other The neck is supple.
__label__Other JVP is flat.
__label__Other Carotids are 2+ with very soft bilateral referred murmurs.
__label__Other Chest is clear.
"__label__Other Cardiac exam shows normal S1, physiologically split S2 with 1/6 systolic ejection murmur radiating from the apex to the base, and a 1-2/6 holosystolic murmur radiating from the apex to the axilla."
__label__Other No significant diastolic murmur or rub.
__label__Other The abdomen is benign.
__label__Other Extremities reveal trace bipedal edema.
__label__Other Peripheral pulses are diminished but detectable.
__label__Other Electrocardiogram is pending.
__label__Other Impression:  Ms. Vance remains relatively stable from a cardiovascular perspective.
"__label__Other However, as you know, her last echocardiogram did show evidence of at least moderate mitral regurgitation with significantly reduced left ventricular systolic function."
__label__Other She has made it quite clear that under no circumstances would she consider repeat cardiac surgery to treat her valvular heart disease.
"__label__Other Nonetheless, I think it would be helpful for her to undergo repeat echocardiogram to help gauge the current status of her left ventricle and degree of regurgitation, which may allow for additional modifications to her therapeutic regimen."
"__label__Other Beyond this, her condition is actually relatively stable from a cardiovascular standpoint."
__label__Other I have not further altered her medical regimen.
__label__Other Thank you very much for allowing me to assist in her care.

__label__Other Dear Dr. Fernandes:
"__label__Other   Dr. Nunes and I had the pleasure to see your patient, Mr. Christian Mullen, this morning in the office for a routine vascular followup."
"__label__Other It has been nearly 18 months since his last visit here and in the interim time, has been having discomfort involving both of his hips, thighs, and calves."
"__label__hyperlipidemia.mention.during_dct As you well know, Mr. Mullen is a delightful 69-year-old gentleman with history of hypertension, hyperlipidemia, coronary artery disease, type 2 diabetes mellitus, and peripheral arterial disease who previously underwent left common femoral and left popliteal artery revascularization November 2088 followed by right external, right internal, and right common femoral artery revascularization in February 2089."
"__label__Other Despite the technical success of both procedures, he continued to have bilateral hip claudication symptoms."
"__label__Other When we had last evaluated him in November 2089, we had considered moving forward with CT angiography to assess the patency of his aorto-iliac anatomy."
"__label__Other At the time, he favored moving on a conservative course with improved walking regimen and weight loss."
"__label__Other Unfortunately, despite these measures, he feels quite disabled and limited by his claudication symptoms."
__label__Other Symptoms are noticeable between 20 and 50 yards distance occurring in the hip area as well as extending down in to his thigh and occasionally the calves.
__label__Other Symptoms resolve with sitting and resting for approximately 2.5 minutes.
__label__Other He notes that symptoms will improve with standing still however sitting symptoms resolve much quicker.
"__label__Other He does not necessarily notice any change with inclines or going up stairs; in fact, he is actually able to climb 18 stairs to his office without limitation."
"__label__Other From the cardiac perspective, Mr. Mullen has been free of any symptoms of exertional chest tightness, pressure, or shortness of breath."
__label__cad.event.before_dct We understand that you are following him in closely in this regard and now requesting up coming chemical stress test given that has been nearly 10 years from his coronary artery bypass surgery.
__label__Other Past medical history:
__label__hypertension.mention.before_dct    Hypertension.
__label__hyperlipidemia.mention.during_dct Hyperlipidemia.
__label__cad.mention.before_dct CAD.
__label__Other PAD.
__label__smoker.past Prior tobacco use.
__label__obese.mention.before_dct Obesity.

__label__Other Depressive disorder.

__label__Other Congenital hypospadias.
__label__Other Prostatitis.
__label__Other Hemorrhoids.
__label__Other Colonic polyps.
__label__Other Chronic normocytic anemia.

__label__Other Hypospadias repair in childhood.
__label__Other Assessment and plan:
"__label__hyperlipidemia.mention.during_dct    Mr. Christian Mullen is a delightful 69-year-old gentleman with history of coronary artery disease, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, type 2 diabetes mellitus, peripheral arterial disease with prior bilateral aortoiliac revascularization here for a vascular followup with symptoms of bilateral hip, buttock, thigh, and claudication."
__label__Other Mr. Mullen's symptoms at present are suggestive of vascular claudication and in the sense that they are exertionally related.
"__label__Other Interestingly, he has had these symptoms dating back to immediately following his revascularization procedures in 2088 and 2089."
"__label__Other On examination today, his femoral pulses are certainly not robust and may suggest the presence of restenosis."
"__label__diabetes.mention.after_dct We discussed with Mr. Mullen the potential of going forward with lower extremity noninvasive studies; however, these revealed supra-normal ABIs in the past secondary to his diabetes."
"__label__Other Likewise, we discussed the possibility of moving forward with a non-invasive imaging study i.e."
"__label__Other CT angiogram; however, this would not provide the option of therapeutic intervention if indeed narrowings were noted."
"__label__Other Accordingly, Mr. Mullen is in favor of proceeding forward with diagnostic peripheral angiography plus/minus therapeutic intervention if restenosis of his aortoiliac segments are noted."
__label__Other It is indeed possible that there is a contributing factor of spinal stenosis in that Mr. Mullen's symptoms are relieved more quickly in the sitting position.
"__label__Other Likewise, he has noted improvement upon leaning forward and against a tree."
__label__Other We understand that Mr. Mullen is being considered for an upcoming chemical stress test to assess the patency for any silent coronary ischemia.
__label__Other He is quite reticent to go forward with the chemical stress test though we did broach the subject of performing coronary catheterization at the time of his peripheral angiogram given that we are actually going to be in there.
__label__Other He has actually requested this as opposed to going forward with the chemical stress test.
"__label__Other With your permission, we will perform both coronary catheterization to assess the patency of his grafts in addition to his peripheral angiogram plus/minus therapeutic intervention of his lower extremities."
"__label__Other Paramount to his ongoing cardiovascular fitness, we certainly recommend blood pressure of 130/80 or below and LDL cholesterol 70 or below and ongoing exercise and weight loss."
__label__Other We will plan to schedule his procedure in the upcoming weeks and he is to notify us if symptoms are progressed in the interim time.

__label__Other Dear Dr. Cooper:
"__label__cad.mention.before_dct   I had the pleasure of seeing your patient, Christian Mullen today in the office in followup for his peripheral artery disease, as well as his coronary disease."
"__label__cad.mention.before_dct I permanently follow him for PAD, as I know he follows with Dr. Fernandes for his coronary disease."
"__label__Other Regarding his peripheral disease, he is status post left common femoral endarterectomy, performed at my request by Dr. Fredrick Xa couple of years ago."
"__label__Other This alleviated some of his left leg claudication, though he still has some residual symptoms in that left calf."
"__label__Other The right calf is what bothers him more, with symptoms that are earlier in onset."
__label__Other They occurred about 100 yards of walking on the flat.
"__label__Other While Chris is affected by this, it does not preclude him from doing his usual activities of daily living."
"__label__Other He also continues to travel (on his way to Bogalusa with Brad Fair, his partner, next week), and also continues to work actively."
__label__Other The biggest problem with his claudication is that it prevents him from being physically active enough to lose enough weight.
"__label__cad.event.before_dct As he says, he put on about 80 pounds after his coronary bypass graft in 2082, and he has had trouble losing the weight."
"__label__Other He is considering weight reduction surgery, but has not made a decision about this yet."
__label__Other He is struggling with the decision.
"__label__Other I would support him either way in this regard, encouraging him to lose weight however he can do so."
"__label__Other In terms of his lower extremities, his exam demonstrates diminished pulses (absent to palpation) in both ankles, but they are audible by Doppler."
"__label__Other Both feet are well perfused, with good capillary refill."
__label__Other He has no ulcers or gangrene.
"__label__Other From a cardiac standpoint, Chris is doing well."
"__label__Other He denies significant dyspnea or chest discomfort, although he is limited in terms of walking because of his legs."
"__label__cad.event.before_dct It has been 11 years since his bypass operation, and I think it would be reasonable to do a stress test on him to make certain that there is no evidence of silent ischemia."
"__label__Other While this might be controversial, as to whether to do a stress test or not, my own gut feeling is that it is probably the right time in this patient with significant risk factors and limitations on the basis of his lower extremity disease."
"__label__Other He requests specifically we do this study here, so I will take the liberty of ordering an adenosine MIBI, and certainly will forward you the results."
"__label__Other Otherwise, Chris is doing great."
__label__Other We will continue to work on risk factor modification and I will see him again in six months.
__label__Other We will also order an exercise ABI and duplex of his lower extremities to assess where we stand at the present time.
"__label__Other If his symptoms progress to the point where they are more disabling, then we would consider further evaluation."
"__label__Other Otherwise, as long as his symptoms remain stable and his lifestyle is not terribly limited, we will continue the same."
__label__Other Other Data:
"__label__Other    I saw him today with Vernon Galvan, one of my cardiovascular fellows, who have written a detailed note."
__label__Other We will send this along to you as well.
__label__Other Thanks again.
"__label__Other Best personal regards,"

__label__Other He remains in reasonable health.

__label__Other He also has dyspnea on exertion but does not describe angina.

__label__Other Impression:
"__label__diabetes.mention.after_dct 66 yo M with h/o IDDM, large cell lymphoma in 2066, and now with myelodysplastic syndrome who presents with fourth months of cough of unclear etiology."
__label__Other The differential diagnosis is broad and includes both infectious and non-infectious diagnoses.
"__label__Other Our leading diagnosis is either radiation fibrosis or a primary interstitial lung disease, such as COP."
"__label__Other However, we also think that several infectious etiologies should be considered."
"__label__Other Endemic mycoses (histo, blasto and crypto), cryptococcal pneumonia, nocardiasis, aspergillus, mucormycosis and MAC are some diseases to consider in this patient."
"__label__Other While the clinical picture of granulomas on chest CT and cough is consistent with the diagnosis of mycobacterial disease, the patient is very low risk for this infection and his lack of fevers, progressive weight loss and systemic illness argues against this diagnosis."
"__label__Other I (AYX) have interviewed and examined Mr. Ware, and confirmed all of the findings documented in this note."
"__label__Other My highest suspicion is for an inflammatory process, such as radiation pneumonitis or BOOP/COP."
"__label__Other An occult infection is quite possible, such as pulmonary MAC or a mold (the lesion in his left lower lobe is especially suspicious)."
"__label__Other Clinically he is unchanged over many months, so empiric antibiotics would not be indicated."
__label__Other We recommend the following work-up:
__label__Other -Expectorated sputum for gram stain and culture
__label__Other -Induced sputum for
__label__Other -PCP
__label__Other -Modified AFB smear (looking for Nocardia)
__label__Other -Fungal stain and culture
__label__Other -Urine histo antigen
__label__Other -Serum cryptococcal antigen
__label__Other -Weekly monitoring of galactomannan and D-glucan
"__label__Other -Nasopharyngeal swab for respiratory viral panel (RSV, Adenovirus, Influenza A and B, paraflu A and B) and viral culture"
"__label__Other If the above work-up is unrevealing, please consult pulmonology for a bronchoscopy -- sooner rather than later."
"__label__Other It is reasonable to start is levaquin 500 mg QD now to treat empirically for typical and atypical pathogens (this medication is scheduled to begin in two days, per protocol)."
__label__Other Our recommendations were communicated to Dr. Dalton and Dr. Robin Jeffery of the patient   s primary team.
__label__Other Thank you for this consult.
__label__Other Our team will follow with you

__label__Other His post-tx course was unremarkable.

"__label__Other He had several courses of quinolones (and other abx) during this period without significant relief, but ultimately his symptoms improved on their own."
__label__Other His immune suppression was d/c'd 7/74.
__label__Other He deveoloped iron overload (Ferritin 1356) and started phlebotomy 9/74.
__label__Other Mr. Ware did well from a respiratory standpoint until 11/74 when he noticed intermittent fevers approximately every 2 weeks.
__label__Other At first they were in the 99 range and they would last 1-2days and be associated with malaise.
__label__Other He also again experienced symptoms of a dry hacking cough that occurs with change in positioning (not necessarily lying flat).

"__label__Other Hospital course c/b GIB and was found to have free air with perforated duodenum s/p ex-lap 6/22, gastrectomy with partial large bowel resection, splenectomy and primary anastamosis, with path positive for mucormycosis without clean margins."
__label__Other He also had VRE/klebsiella LUQ abscess s/p IR drainage.
"__label__Other He was initially treated with nafcillin and ambisome, but developed maculopapular rash on chest and arms thought to be secondary to nafcillin."
__label__Other So he was switched to vanco/ambisome/linezolid/meropenem/amikacin for LUQ abscess.
"__label__Other After 6 weeks of high-dose ambisome, he was taken back to OR on 7/31 for re-exploration and was found to have some more necrosis around his esophageal-jejunostomy site that surgeons ""scooped out"" as much as they could, but were not able to get clean margins because of difficult anatomic restrictions."
"__label__Other Given the inability to completely en-bloc resect Mr. Ethridge's GI mucor despite a long-trial of Ambisome, he was started on an investigational drug, posaconazole, provided by Emcor on a compassionate use basis."
__label__Other This has had 50% success of curing mucor as salvage therapy in small trials.
"__label__Other He was started on this drug on 8/28/62 and has tolerated it well despite some nausea, diarrhea."
__label__Other He has been at EDUCARE-FARGO reports increase in strength and improved ability to bear weight on his hip.
__label__Other He walks with a walker.
