__label__Other Dear Dr. Trujillo:
"__label__Other Thank you for referring Mrs. Shirley Trent, a 68-year-old lady"
"__label__Other with peripheral artery disease, on whom you plan to do"
__label__Other revascularization of the right leg.
__label__Other Her history is well known to
__label__Other you but I will repeat it for our records.
__label__Other She has a long history
__label__smoker.past of cigarette smoking with a 3-packet-per-day history for 30
"__label__Other years, stopping 15 years ago."
"__label__Other She has developed claudication,"
"__label__Other particularly in the right leg, over the last year since her"
"__label__Other husband died, which has all the typical symptoms and is relieved"
__label__Other by rest.
__label__Other This seems predominantly in the right calf but is also
__label__Other in the right thigh as well.
__label__Other She had segmental leg pressures done
__label__Other which shows some mild diminution in the left leg but an
__label__Other ankle-brachial index of 0.65 in the right leg.
__label__Other An MR angiogram
"__label__Other showed stenosis, although I do not have the full report on this"
__label__Other as yet.
__label__medication.insulin..after_dct She has intercurrent problems with insulin-dependent diabetes
"__label__Other mellitus, which she has had for 10 years."
__label__Other Her other cardiac risk
__label__smoker.past factors apart from cigarette smoking include a family history of
"__label__Other myocardial infarction in her father, and it is uncertain what her"
__label__Other cholesterol level is.
"__label__Other She has no history of hypertension,"
__label__Other although I am uncertain whether this has been checked in the
__label__Other past.
__label__Other She has a past history of partial gastrectomy in 2059 for
__label__Other a bleeding peptic ulcer and this has led to some difficulty in
__label__Other swallowing tablets and keeping them down.
__label__Other She also has a past
__label__Other history of a right middle lobectomy in 2079 for adenocarcinoma
__label__Other that had clear margins and did not require further adjunctive
__label__Other therapy.
"__label__Other She also had a cholecystectomy in 2079, which was"
__label__Other uneventful.
"__label__Other Systems review reveal no chest discomfort, dyspnea, ankle edema,"
"__label__Other palpitations, syncope, cough, sputum, hemoptysis, GI bleeding,"
"__label__Other weakness down the arms, face, or legs, seizures or visual"
"__label__Other disturbances, and all other systems are negative."
"__label__medication.insulin..after_dct She lives alone, and her current medications include insulin"
__label__Other only.
__label__Other She has no allergies.
"__label__Other On physical examination, she is alert and orientated without any"
"__label__Other signs of jaundice, clubbing, or cyanosis."
__label__Other Her heart rate was 85
__label__hypertension.high_bp.during_dct beats per minute with a blood pressure of 160/85 in both arms.
"__label__Other The jugular venous pressure was not elevated, and her carotid"
"__label__Other upstrokes were reduced, but she had no bruits audible."
__label__Other Her apex
"__label__Other beat was not palpable, and she had a normal first and second"
"__label__Other heart sound without added sounds, murmurs, or gallops."
__label__Other Her chest
__label__Other was clear to percussion and auscultation.
__label__Other She had no
__label__Other hepatosplenomegaly and no abdominal masses or pulsations.
__label__Other She
__label__Other had the scars from previous operations present.
__label__Other Her femoral
__label__Other pulses were absent on the right side and reduced on the left side
__label__Other without bruits.
__label__Other She had reduced but palpable dorsalis pedis and
__label__Other posterior tibial pulses on the left leg but no pedal pulses on
__label__Other the right leg.
__label__Other There were no trophic changes in her legs.
__label__Other had reduced sensation to pinprick in both feet to the mid calf
__label__Other level in a stocking distribution.
__label__Other Her ECG showed sinus rhythm without abnormalities.
__label__Other Assessment:  This lady obviously has severe claudication and
"__label__Other requires revascularization, but is uncertain whether she has any"
__label__Other myocardial ischemia.
__label__Other I therefore think a stress test is
__label__Other required.
__label__Other She also has difficulty in swallowing medications and
__label__Other this will prove a problem for the long-term management of her
"__label__Other atherosclerosis, which I would like to further evaluate."
__label__Other Plan:  I therefore organized a dobutamine stress test to assess
__label__Other for myocardial ischemia and cardiovascular risk.
__label__Other I have also
__label__medication.beta_blocker..after_dct asked her to start on a small dose of a beta-blocker for reducing
"__label__Other her perioperative risk as well as treating her blood pressure,"
__label__Other which is elevated.
__label__Other I have also asked her to have a fasting blood
"__label__Other lipid test today so we can assess her cholesterol level, as it is"
__label__Other likely that she would benefit from lipid-lowering therapy.
__label__Other I
__label__Other plan to evaluate all these in approximately a month or so after
__label__Other her operation so that we can manage her in the long term.
__label__Other I will let you know the results of her stress test when they
__label__Other become available.
__label__Other Thank you for allowing me to take part in this
__label__Other lady's care.
"__label__Other Yours sincerely,"

"__label__medication.insulin..before_dct HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS:  Ms. Trent is 69, a pleasant lady who is now a widow well known to me for her insulin-dependent diabetes and her poor compliance with treatment."
"__label__Other In the past, she also has experienced upper GI bleeding due to a peptic ulcer and has undergone cholecystectomy as well as lobectomy for carcinoma of the lung."
__label__medication.insulin..after_dct CURRENT MEDICATIONS:  Humulin N 25 units in the morning.
__label__Other She is supposed to be using 28 units in the morning and 8 units in the evening depending on blood sugars.
"__label__medication.ace_inhibitor..after_dct She also has been prescribed an ACE inhibitor and a beta blocker, which she has neglected to take."
__label__Other Her last visit to the practice was in September of last year.
"__label__Other At the time of her last visit, I referred to vascular surgery because of claudication of the right leg."
__label__Other She underwent a femoral public TL bypass in December and did well postoperatively.
"__label__medication.ace_inhibitor..after_dct She was discharged on simvastatin, Plavix, as well as atenolol and lisinopril."
__label__Other She abandoned all tablets on her own and did not come for her followup appointment with us.
"__label__Other Today, she tells me that claudication in the right leg has disappeared completely but during the past two months, she has begun noticing pain in the left leg after 10-15 minutes of walking which forces her to stop."
"__label__Other An arteriogram carried out in September of last year showed mild diffuse disease involving the left common iliac, external iliac, and common femoral arteries."
__label__Other She did not have symptoms on the left side at the time.
"__label__Other The patient denies chest pain, palpitation, shortness of breath, orthopnea, and ankle edema."
"__label__Other Prior to her bypass surgery on the right leg, she underwent a Persantine MIBI which showed only 1 mm ST depressions and was considered not diagnostic."
__label__Other Ms. Trent has experienced some polyuria and mild polydipsia and has two times nocturia.
__label__Other She denies dysuria.
__label__diabetes.a1c.before_dct The last hemoglobin A1c was 8.4 in September of last year.
"__label__Other At that time, her serum cholesterol was 238, HDL was 59, and triglycerides were 263."
"__label__Other PHYSICAL EXAMINATION:  Today, she is pleasant and talkative."
"__label__hypertension.high_bp.during_dct Her weight is 127-1/2 pounds, blood pressure 180/76, and heart rate is 96."
__label__Other Oxygen saturation 100% on room air.
__label__Other Random fingerstick glucose is 202.
__label__Other Extraocular movements are full.
__label__Other The thyroid is not enlarged.
__label__Other The neck veins are flat.
__label__Other The chest is clear to auscultation.
__label__Other The breasts are free of masses.
__label__Other There is no axillary lymphadenopathy.
__label__Other The heart sounds are regular.
__label__Other There are no rubs or gallops.
__label__Other There is a midline abdominal scar which corresponds to an old operation for peptic ulcer.
"__label__Other There is also a right upper quadrant cholecystectomy scar which is surrounded by a mass, which has been present in the past that probably represents fibrosis under the scar."
__label__Other No other masses are palpable.
__label__Other The lower extremities are free of edema.

"__label__diabetes.mention.after_dct IMPRESSION:  70 year-old right-handed female with h/o DM, PVD presenting to ED for RUE and RLE numbness and weakness, onset 12/07/94 AM."
__label__Other She has had numbness/tingling and shooting pain in the RLE for the past 1-2 months likely due  to disease in the lumbar spine seen on MRI (L5-S1).
"__label__Other She states that the current weakness in the RLE is new, as is the weakness in the RUE."
"__label__Other Additionally, she has new nausea/vomiting and SOB since this AM."
"__label__hypertension.high_bp.during_dct While in the ED, following her CT scans, she was tachycardic to the 150s and hypertensive to the 230s systolic."
__label__Other She had persistent nausea and vomiting.
__label__Other Her neurological exam was difficult with inconsistent findings.
"__label__Other She appears to have decreased spontaneous movement of the RUE, but when passively moved into shoulder flexion she was able to hold the position against gravity for several seconds."
__label__Other Her RLE symptoms are likely confounded by her lumbar spine disease at L5/S1 as noted above.
"__label__diabetes.glucose.during_dct She is hyperglycemic (serum glucose 313), has a mild leukocytosis, is iron deficient, and has new onset today of fairly severe nausea/vomiting and SOB of unclear etiology."
"__label__Other She appears to have vasculopathic changes/lacunes in the brain seen as hypodensities on the CT today, all appearing old."
"__label__Other She does not have any right facial weakness, no dysarthria, no aphasia, no flaccidity/spasticity, no gaze preference."
"__label__Other While stroke can not be ruled out, her exam does not clearly suggest a typical stroke syndrome."
"__label__Other Ddx includes seizure, infection or metabolic abnormality causing unmasking of stroke-like symptoms, migraine phenomena superimposed on current medical/metabolic abnormalities."
__label__Other RECOMMENDATIONS:
__label__Other 1.
"__label__Other MRI/MRA of the head and neck (stroke protocol), as well as MRI of C-spine given UE symptoms"
__label__Other 2.
"__label__hypertension.mention.during_dct We currently recommend admission to medicine given multiple medical issues (severe HTN, SOB as yet unexplained, N/V, hyperglycemia)."
__label__Other 3.
__label__medication.beta_blocker..during_dct BP control:  Labetolol to maintain BP less than 200 systolic; avoid large/rapid shifts to maintain cerebral perfusion pressure.
__label__hypertension.mention.during_dct Would allow some degree of hypertension (max 200 SBP) until stroke protocol MRI/MRA obtained.
__label__Other 4.
__label__Other Glycemic control-need to clarify home insulin regimen
__label__Other 5.
__label__Other Resend cardiac markers in setting of tachycardia to 150s
__label__Other 6.
__label__Other F/u PE protocol CT (done in ED).

__label__Other Dear Dr. Pearson: 
__label__Other I had the pleasure of seeing Mrs. Shirley Trent in follow up this morning.
__label__Other Mrs. Trent is a 71 year-old right-handed woman with a history of a left corona radiata stroke in December 2094 complicated by a dense right hemiparesis.
"__label__Other She presented today with her granddaughter, Ms. Carey Trent."
__label__Other Ms. Trent translated and provided supplemental interval history.
__label__Other Interval History
__label__Other Mrs. Trent moved to the Eddie Bauer Nursing home approximately one month ago.
"__label__Other She has continued to have a dense paresis of the right arm and leg, which has confined her to a wheelchair."
"__label__Other She has had spasticity, in particular of the right leg, that has been painful at times and has contributed to sleeping difficulties."
"__label__Other Baclofen was initiated and titrated to 20 mg TID, with some efficacy."
"__label__Other According to Carey, another medication may have been used around the turn of the year."
__label__Other Gabapentin was initiated at a dose of 100 mg HS on 2/10/96.
__label__Other Mrs. Trent related that she has had a depressed mood in recent months.
__label__Other A son with whom she was close died in August of last year from complications following an admission to the hospital with asthma.
__label__Other This was extremely difficult for Mrs. Trent.
"__label__Other She has felt ""alone,"" but has enjoyed visits to the nursing home from Carey and from Carey's aunt, one of Mrs. Trent's daughters."
__label__Other Her other children have not maintained close contact.
"__label__Other Mrs. Trent had increased weakness and slurring of her speech in early February, which may have been related to a urinary tract infection or sedating medication used at that time."
"__label__Other Aside from that episode, Mrs. Trent reported no episodes of weakness, numbness, clumsiness, visual changes, slurred speech, dizziness, language difficulties, or other neurological symptoms concerning for stroke since her stroke in December 2094."
__label__Other Past Medical History
__label__diabetes.mention.during_dct type 2 diabetes mellitus requiring insulin
__label__Other h/o peptic ulcer disease with GI bleeding 
__label__hyperlipidemia.mention.during_dct hyperlipidemia 
"__label__Other peripheral arterial disease, bypass surgery on the right leg, mild symptoms of claudication on the left"
__label__Other left internal carotid artery stenosis
__label__Other Medications (confirmed)
__label__Other Baclofen 20 MG (10MG TABLET take 2) PO TID 
__label__medication.thienopyridine..after_dct Clopidogrel 75 MG (75MG TABLET take 1) PO QD 
__label__Other Gabapentin 100 MG (100MG CAPSULE take 1) PO QHS 
__label__Other Metoclopramide HCL 10 MG (10MG TABLET take 1) PO AC 
__label__Other Mirtazapine 30 MG (30MG TABLET take 1) PO QHS 
__label__Other Multivitamin WITH FOLIC ACID (MULTIVITAMINS) 1 TAB PO QD x 60 days
"__label__medication.insulin..before_dct Novolog (INSULIN ASPART) SC QAM, QPM and SS "
__label__Other Omeprazole 20 MG (20MG CAPSULE DR take 1) PO QD 
__label__medication.beta_blocker..during_dct Toprol XL (METOPROLOL SUCCINATE EXTENDED RELEASE) 100 MG (100MG TAB.SR 24H take 1) PO QD 
__label__Other Allergies
__label__Other NKA

__label__Other Mrs. Trent is originally from Suriname.

"__label__Other A son died at age 42 in August, 2095."
__label__smoker.past Mrs. Trent has a remote history of smoking.
__label__Other She does not consume alcohol.
__label__Other She has recently spent much of her time watching television (like soap operas in Dutch) and participating in group activities (such as Bingo) at the home.
__label__Other Review of Systems
"__label__Other Negative for chest pain, shortness of breath, visual changes, weakness, numbness, burning pain, paresthesias, difficulties speaking or understanding others, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, pain or burning on urination."

__label__Other MOTOR: increased tone with clasp knife phenomenon right arm and leg.

__label__Other 5/5 strength in proximal and distal muscles of the left arm and leg.

__label__Other MRI brain 12/10/94: small-to-medium sized stroke in the left corona radiata 
"__label__Other CTA head and neck 12/11/94: dense calcification at the carotid bifurcation, precluding a legitimate interpretation."
__label__Other CNIS 12/14/94: demonstrated 25 to 49% stenosis in the proximal left ICA; velocity of 143 in the proximal ICA versus 50 in the distal CCA suggests a possible moderate (50-70%) stenosis of the vessel
"__label__Other Echocardiogram (transthoracic) 12/14/94: estimated EF of 55 to 60%, no regional wall motion abnormalities, mild left atrial enlargement, and no other significant abnormalities."
__label__Other Impression
__label__Other Mrs. Shirley Trent is a 71 year-old right-handed woman who had a stroke in the left corona radiata in December 2094.
"__label__hyperlipidemia.mention.after_dct Her stroke risk factors include history of diabetes mellitus, dyslipidemia, peripheral arterial disease, and left carotid stenosis with a calcified plaque."
__label__Other She has not had any clinical events suggestive of stroke in the interim between 11/94 and now.
__label__Other Mrs. Trent's current neurological and psychiatric problems include spasticity of the right arm and leg and depression.
__label__Other Plan
__label__Other 1.
__label__Other We will obtain repeat carotid studies to assess for interval progression of the left carotid stenosis.
__label__Other 2.
"__label__Other We recommend continued management of vascular risk factors, with (1) target BP 120/80 or less, (2) target LDL < 100, (3) continued glycemic control."
__label__medication.thienopyridine..after_dct Continue clopidogrel as an antiplatelet agent.
__label__Other 3.
"__label__Other Regarding the spasticity, it is reasonable to utilize a higher evening dose of gabapentin and assess the efficacy."
"__label__Other Other potential agents to consider for future use include cyclobenzaprine, tizanidine, and trihexyphenidyl."
__label__Other I will continue to follow and would be happy to discuss this management with you at any time.
__label__Other 4.
__label__Other I agree with mirtazapine for antidepressant therapy given Mrs. Trent's poor appetite and impaired sleep.
"__label__Other After her gabapentin has been appropriately titrated, one may consider increasing mirtazapine to 45 mg HS."
__label__Other 5.
__label__Other Mrs. Trent will be scheduled for follow up in approximately 6 months.
__label__Other It is a pleasure to participate in the care of Mrs. Trent with you.
__label__Other Greater than 50% of this 60 minute follow up visit was spent counseling regarding the above issues.
__label__Other Please do not hesitate to contact me with questions.
"__label__Other Sincerely,"
__label__Other ______________________________
"__label__Other James Rosado, M.D."
__label__Other Neurology
__label__Other Lenox Care Center

__label__Other Resting oxygen saturation is 98-99% with
__label__Other ambulation in the hallway.
__label__Other This fell to a minimum of 97% with an
__label__Other increase in his heart rate to 100.

__label__Other clear oropharynx.

__label__Other Conjunctiva are minimally pale.

__label__Other The thyroid gland is normal.
__label__Other Jugular venous distention to
__label__Other approximately 10 cm.
__label__Other was noted.
__label__Other Neck was supple.
__label__Other Examination of the
__label__Other chest revealed diminished breath sounds bilaterally with dullness
__label__Other at both bases.
__label__Other There was no egophony and no wheezes.
__label__Other Otherwise the
__label__Other lungs were clear.
"__label__Other Cardiac exam with a regular rate in rhythm,"
"__label__Other normal S1 and S2, an intermittent S4 was appreciated."
__label__Other No RV heave
__label__Other or lift was appreciated.
__label__Other No pulmonary artery tap was appreciated.

__label__Other murmurs were detected.

__label__Other anterior axillary line.

"__label__Other nontender abdomen with a palpable liver edge, three fingerbreadths"
__label__Other below the right costal margin.
__label__Other This was nontender and smooth.

__label__Other sounds were present.

__label__Other plus symmetric edema to the top of the thigh in the lower
"__label__Other extremities, one plus edema was also present in both upper"
__label__Other extremities.
__label__Other No clubbing was noted.

__label__Other consistent with collagen vascular disease.

__label__Other lesions were noted on the anterior aspect of the right thigh as
__label__Other well as on the left arm.

"__label__Other white count of 11.8, hematocrit of 32.1, platelet count of 250."

__label__Other most recently 22.

__label__Other protein.

__label__Other of 2.4 on 1/05/20.

__label__Other LV function.

__label__Other hypertrophied with mild reduction in RV function.
__label__Other There was trace
__label__Other MR with moderate TR.
__label__Other A peak systolic artery pressure of 64 plus
__label__Other right atrial pressure was noted.
__label__Other In summary Dr. Rodriquez is a 77-year-old gentleman with a clear cut
__label__hypertension.mention.after_dct pulmonary hypertension.
__label__Other The etiology of this is not clear at the
__label__Other moment.
__label__Other Differential diagnosis could include chronic thromboembolic
"__label__Other disease, occult underlying pulmonary disease (doubt), obstructive"
"__label__Other sleep apnea, and collagen vascular disease."
__label__Other In addition some
__label__hypertension.mention.after_dct patients develop a marked pulmonary artery hypertension in the
__label__Other setting of stiff left ventricle even with preserved left
__label__Other ventricular function although this I think would be a diagnosis of
__label__Other exclusion.
__label__Other The degree of his edema is quite striking and I agree
__label__Other with increasing his diuretic regimen.
__label__Other I'm embarking on a course of
__label__Other evaluation to exclude the most likely causes.
__label__Other In specific he will
__label__Other be having a CT with IV contrast to rule out chronic thromboembolic
__label__Other disease this afternoon.

__label__Other Faust.

__label__Other antidouble stranded DNA and an anti SCL70.

__label__Other Page 4

__label__Other pulmonary function testing performed in addition to having an
__label__Other arterial blood gas drawn.

__label__Other he may require more invasive diagnostics.

"__label__Other HENDRICKS, HANNAH"

"__label__Other Hunter N. Ishikawa, M.D."
__label__Other Surgery
__label__Other 03 Greenwood Drive

"__label__Other Dear Hicks,"
__label__Other I had the pleasure of seeing Hannah Hendricks in Internal Medicine today.
"__label__Other She was seen alongside my attending, Dr. Heidi Erik-Roy."
"__label__Other As you know, she is a lovely 52-year-old female in whom you have found a left lower extremity bypass surgery."
__label__Other She comes in today for perioperative risk assessment.
"__label__hyperlipidemia.mention.during_dct Ms. Hendricks tells me that she has longstanding type 1 diabetes, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and peripheral arterial disease."
__label__Other She in fact has undergone lower extremity bypass grafting in both her left and right lower extremities.
"__label__Other Specifically, she is status post a right fem-pop bypass in 2066 and a left fem-DP bypass also in 2066."
"__label__Other It appears that her right graft has been functioning well, but her left graft was noted to be occluded many years ago."
__label__Other She comes in now with a nonhealing ulcer and gangrene in her left toe.
__label__Other You have planned a redo bypass for this upcoming Saturday.
__label__Other Ms. Hendricks tells me that she has never had any history of coronary artery disease.
"__label__Other She has never had any chest discomfort, shortness of breath, orthopnea, PND, lower extremity edema, palpitations, lightheadedness, or syncope."
__label__family_hist.present She does have a strong family history of coronary artery disease with a brother who had several myocardial infarctions and died at the age of 48 of an MI.
__label__cad.event.before_dct She has a report of a prior EKG with suggestion of an old anteroseptal MI.
__label__cad.mention.during_dct She has never had any evaluation for underlying coronary artery disease nor has she had any symptoms referable to CAD.
"__label__Other In terms of her functional capacity, she tells me that up until a year ago, she was doing spinning classes without any chest discomfort or shortness of breath whatsoever."
"__label__Other Because of increasing discomfort in her left lower extremity, she had to reduce her exercise and of late has only been able to do weightlifting without aerobic exercise."
__label__Other She is however able to climb stairs in her home without any discomfort in her chest or any shortness of breath.
__label__Other She is unfortunately limited significantly by foot pain.
"__label__hyperlipidemia.mention.during_dct Her past medical history is as noted above including type 1 diabetes for which she uses an insulin pump, peripheral arterial disease, status post bilateral lower extremity bypass, hypertension, and hyperlipidemia."
"__label__medication.aspirin..before_dct Her current medications include aspirin 325 mg, which she started a few days ago, Lipitor 10 mg once daily, Diovan 160 mg twice daily, vitamin C, vitamin B and folic acid supplementation."
"__label__Other She has no clear drug allergies, but does get nauseous and vomiting with Percocet."
"__label__smoker.past She is a past smoker and had smoked for approximately three years, one pack per day in her early 20s."
__label__Other She works as a Senior Manager of Broadcasting at giant food in Albemarle.
"__label__family_hist.present As I mentioned previously, her family history is notable for a brother who died of an MI in his late 40s."
"__label__Other On physical examination, her blood pressure is 135/79, heart rate is 97 and her weight is 137 pounds."
"__label__Other In general, she is very well appearing and in no apparent distress at rest."
__label__Other She has a jugular venous pressure of approximately 5 cm of water.
__label__Other She has 2+ carotids with no audible bruits.
__label__Other Her upper extremities demonstrate 2+ brachial and radial pulses bilaterally.
__label__Other Her chest is clear to auscultation bilaterally.
"__label__Other Her cardiac exam reveals a regular rate and rhythm, normal S1 and S2, and a soft 2/6 systolic ejection murmur best heard at the left sternal border."
__label__Other Her abdomen is benign.
__label__Other She has no abdominal bruits and no significantly palpable aorta.
"__label__Other Her lower extremity exam is notable for a hyperemic left foot with a bandage, which is covering what is reportedly a gangrenous toe."
"__label__Other Her left lower extremity pulses are 1+ in the femoral, absent popliteal and absent distal pulses."
"__label__Other In her right lower extremity, she has 1+ femoral, with no bruit, 2+ popliteal, 2+ DP and 1+ PT."
__label__Other An EKG done in our clinic today demonstrates a normal sinus rhythm at a rate of 97 beats per minute with a left axis deviation.
__label__Other There is left atrial enlargement and Q-waves in V1 through V3 suggestive of an old anteroseptal MI.
"__label__cad.event.before_dct There are also Q-waves in lead III and aVF, which raises suspicion of an old inferior MI."
"__label__hyperlipidemia.mention.during_dct In summary, Ms. Hendricks is a lovely 52-year-old female with longstanding diabetes, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and peripheral arterial disease who comes in today for perioperative risk assessment in light of an anticipated redo left lower extremity bypass graft."
__label__Other She appears to have an excellent functional capacity up until several months ago.
"__label__cad.mention.during_dct However, I am concerned by her electrocardiogram, which raises the suspicion of underlying coronary artery disease given the findings of a probable inferior and old anteroseptal myocardial infarction."
"__label__Other As such, I think that it would be wise to better delineate her burden of coronary artery disease by way of a stress test prior to her surgery."
"__label__Other Given that her functional status has been so good up until recently, I do not think that we need to delay her surgery."
"__label__medication.beta_blocker..after_dct However, I would start her on a beta-blocker and as such, I have given her a prescription for atenolol 25 mg once daily, which she will start today and continue up to and beyond the perioperative period."
"__label__Other During the perioperative period, we would recommend that she has tight control of her blood pressure and heart rate with a goal blood pressure less than 120/80 and a goal heart rate less than 60."
__label__Other I would also make sure to obtain a postoperative EKG to ensure there has not been any changes.
__label__Other We will try to arrange for an exercise test with arm ergometry and MIBI imaging for tomorrow morning.
"__label__Other If we are unable to do arm exercise, we will obtain an adenosine MIBI."
__label__Other I will follow up with the results tomorrow after the study is performed.
"__label__Other As I mentioned because her functional capacity is good, I do not anticipate that we will need to make any changes in the surgical scheduling based on the test results."
__label__cad.mention.during_dct This is more in order to give us a sense of the underlying burden of coronary artery disease.
__label__Other It was a pleasure seeing Ms. Hendricks in clinic today.
__label__Other We are certainly available during the perioperative period if any cardiovascular issues are to arise.

__label__Other She is now comes here complaining of left foot pain.

__label__Other She explains the discomfort as pain and burning in the bottom of her foot as well as her arch and over the dorsum of the foot.

__label__Other She is alert and oriented x3.
__label__Other She appears grossly neurologically intact.
__label__Other Her lower extremity exam reveals easily palpable bypass graft pulse in her left leg.

__label__Other This does not appear infected and I cannot probe to bone.
__label__Other It remains superficial.
__label__Other She has no other ischemic skin changes noted.

__label__Other I have said she would be able to try either Neurontin or Lyrica to help with the peripheral neuropathy.

"__label__Other Dictated at: 05/06/2092 by EDWARD XAYASANE, M.D."
__label__Other CHIEF COMPLAINT: Right leg pain and difficulty walking.
__label__Other HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS: Ms. Wilhelm is a 68-year-old right-handed female who has had a three-week history of having right leg pain and difficulty walking.
__label__Other She states that her pain started about three weeks ago when she was bending and picking up a pot.
"__label__Other She states she had a pain in her back that radiated around her right side down her groin into her medial leg, not past the knee."
__label__Other She states that it went away at that time.
__label__Other The next day she felt worsened and had difficulty working and saw her physician.
__label__Other An MRI was ordered.
"__label__Other Since then, she feels about 60-75 percent better."
__label__Other She states that her pain is constant and describes it as a sharp pain.
__label__Other She does state she feels weak and her knee would buckle.
__label__Other She does not have any numbness or tingling.
"__label__Other She states she uses a walker to get to her bathroom, however, otherwise stays in the recliner."
__label__Other Her symptoms are increased with lying down and standing and decreased with sitting.
"__label__Other Therapeutically, she has not received any physical therapy or occupational therapy."
"__label__Other She is currently taking Darvocet, however, less frequently, and Celebrex for arthritis."
"__label__Other Diagnostically, she has had an MRI scan in April 2092 that showed multi-level spinal stenosis, most prominent at L3/L4, especially on the right side, secondary to facet arthropathy and ligamentum flavum infolding, as well as possibly a mild disk bulge."
__label__Other Her mammogram was done in 2091 which was okay.
__label__Other She has not had a bone mineral density at this time.
"__label__medication.arb.diuretic.during_dct MEDICATIONS: Currently, the medication she is on is Celebrex, Hyzaar for her blood pressure, and Darvocet for her pain."
"__label__Other ALLERGIES: She states that taking Tylenol With Codeine gives her toes a burning sensation, and ibuprofen causes tinnitus."
__label__Other PAST MEDICAL HISTORY: She has got high blood pressure and shoulder arthritis.
__label__Other PAST SURGICAL HISTORY: She had a left breast biopsy which she states was not cancerous.
__label__Other SOCIAL/FUNCTIONAL HISTORY: She is functionally currently not working.
__label__Other She is taking sick time.
__label__Other She has not worked for the past three weeks.
__label__Other She is a Head Nurse and worked at The Library Corporation for the last 35 years.
__label__Other She states her job is medium as far as intensity of work.
"__label__Other Functionally, her activities of daily living are limited, and she uses an assistive device."
"__label__Other SOCIAL HISTORY: She is widowed and she has four healthy children, ages 51, 50, 48, and 46."
__label__smoker.never She does not smoke or drink.
__label__Other FAMILY HISTORY: She has aunts with diabetes and brother that had an myocardial infarction at 59.  
"__label__Other REVIEW OF SYSTEMS: On review of systems, no fevers, chills, recent infections, bladder, thyroid problems, rash, shortness of breath, palpations, chest pain, nausea, abdominal pain, diarrhea, or bowel or bladder or sexual problems or urination difficulty."
__label__Other She does have some joint pain and swelling in her shoulders and her feet occasionally.
__label__Other She does have some trouble walking secondary to the pain.
__label__Other She does not feel fatigued and her appetite is okay and she does not feel anxious or stressed.
"__label__Other She does have some mild trouble with sleeping, however, this has improved over the last few days."
"__label__Other PHYSICAL EXAMINATION: On physical examination, well-developed, well-nourished, well-groomed, normal mood and affect, but slightly anxious with movement, female in no acute distress at this time."
"__label__Other On musculoskeletal examination of lumbar spine, flexion was within normal limits."
__label__Other Extension she had her type of pain at about 10-20 degrees.
__label__Other Side-bending was unremarkable.
__label__Other On hip examination she had some decreased internal rotation on the right when compared to the left.
"__label__Other Straight leg raise bilaterally was negative, however, supine, slight guarding on the right."
__label__Other Femoral stretch was positive on the right but not on the left.
"__label__Other On neurological examination, as far as motor examination, there is some slight decrease, half a grade, quadriceps and hip flexors; however, this was functional; otherwise unremarkable on the right or the left."
__label__Other Her reflexes were 2 plus in the achilles.
"__label__Other Babinskis were downgoing, 1 plus at the patella on the right, and 2 plus on the left."
"__label__Other Sensory examination slightly decreased at L3 on the right; however, normal throughout; otherwise, gait was antalgic on the right and she did not want to bear weight."
__label__Other IMPRESSION:  
__label__Other 1.
__label__Other Right L3 acute radiculopathy secondary to herniated disk and facet arthropathy.
__label__Other 2.
"__label__Other Functional limitations secondary to pain, causing her functional weakness."
__label__Other RECOMMENDATIONS:  
__label__Other Transforaminal epidural steroid injection at L3 and L4 on the right.
__label__Other Physical therapy after her injection.
__label__Other 3.
__label__Other Continue her medications of Darvocet and Celebrex.
__label__Other 4.
"__label__Other Keep her out of work until she is able to receive the injection, as well as continue with her physical therapy to improve her strength, given her acute radiculopathy."
"__label__Other The patient was seen and examined with Dr. Xayasane, who agrees with the plan above."

__label__Other Discussion:
"__label__Other Sarcoidosis, until proven otherwise."
"__label__Other She is obviously older than typical presentation of sarcoidosis, but she had previous lymphadenopathy that may have been a first presentation of the illness with spontaneous remission."
"__label__Other The lung findings, systemic symptoms, hypercalcemia, anemia, abnormal serum ACE level are all suggestive of this diagnosis."
__label__Other Her hypercalcemia is symptomatic and should be treated with volume repletion.
__label__Other She should not receive diuretics at present.
__label__Other Long term treatment will be dependent on the underlying diagnosis and its treatment.
"__label__Other I think she will need corticosteroids for her sarcoidosis and I expect this will improve the hypercalcemia, but we need definitive diagnosis first."
"__label__Other The cardiac murmur is impressive, but likely unrelated to the pulmonary disease."
__label__Other We need echocardiogram to better define valvular function.
__label__Other The minimally elevated troponins are not felt to be of clinical significance at this point.
__label__Other Appreciate Cardiology input on this finding.
__label__Other Suggest:
"__label__medication.arb.diuretic.during_dct Stop HCTZ,avoid diuretics until fully volume repleted."
__label__Other IV normal saline.
"__label__Other May need rates in the 150-200 range to control her hypercalcemia acutely, but she has had this for some time, so can be conservative with fluids approach."
"__label__Other Agree with check PTH, vitamin D levels."
"__label__Other Follow lytes, creatinine, calcium, Hct."
__label__Other Agree with check echocardiogram.
__label__Other We should ask the Pulmonary Service to see her in consultation.
__label__Other Bronchoscopy with biopsy may be the best way to obtain confirmatory tissue for diagnosis of sarcoidosis.

__label__Other Impression: 
"__label__Other 73F h/o newly dx HOCM, chronic systemic LAD, fatigue, and weight loss concerning for sarcoid vs. PBC vs. neoplasm, presenting with acute renal failure in setting of little PO intake and likely hypercalcemia."
"__label__Other Hypercalcemia (as in vitamin D excess secondary to sarcoid) can cause polyuria via osmotic diuresis, with dehydration, anorexia, constipation, and PUD, fatigue and depression."
"__label__Other This would thus represent a unifying diagnosis for this pt   s anorexia and acute renal failure, which is most likely prerenal."

"__label__hypertension.mention.before_dct HPI: Ms. Wilhelm is a 74 year-old woman with a history of HOCM, HTN, DM, and sarcoidosis who underwent a Hartmann&#8217;s procedure with small bowel resection on 10/18 after which she was discharged to Harton Center on 11/07 and then re-admitted to MEDIQUIK on 11/17 with left-sided pleuritic chest pain and a saddle pulmonary embolus as well as large right lower extremity DVT."
"__label__Other She had an IVC filter placed and was started on anticoagulation and discharged again to Harton Center on 12/1 and now presents with nausea, vomiting, and several days of poor PO intake."
__label__Other This is actually her fifth admission to MEDIQUIK this year &#8211; first in June when she was diagnosed with HOCM and then in July when she was started on empiric steroids for sarcoidosis.
__label__Other She says her appetite has never returned to normal since her surgery (although her July admission note also documented malaise and poor appetite) and that she has had some mild nausea on a daily basis since her surgery.
__label__Other The nausea and her fatigue became worse four or five days prior to admission and since then she has been vomiting many times a day.
__label__Other The nausea is not related to meals and she has not noted any blood in the emesis.
__label__Other She has had poor intake as a result of the nausea and has only had broth over the last few days.
"__label__Other She denies fevers, chills, headaches, cough, abdominal pain, or change in the character of her colostomy output."

"__label__hypertension.mention.after_dct Ms. Wilhelm is a 74 year-old woman with a history of HOCM, hypertension, sarcoidosis, diabetes, who underwent a Hartmann&#8217;s procedure with small bowel resection on 10/18 and was re-admitted on 11/17 with a saddle PE and large RLE DVT for which she was managed with IVC filter and anticoagulation who now presents with several days of nausea and vomiting and concern for small bowel obstruction on CT.  "
__label__Other SBO: Her clinical presentation and CT findings are concerning for small bowel obstruction (although ileus remains a possibility.
__label__Other Lactate was within normal limits so small bowel ischemia unlikely.
__label__Other Also abdominal exam remains benign at this time.

__label__Other NGT to low wall suction

__label__Other Check colostomy output guaiac
__label__Other Acute renal failure: Her creatinine was up from a baseline of 1.0 to 2.1 on admission.
__label__Other With IVF hydration in the ED it has already started to come down to 1.8 so it was likely pre-renal in the setting of poor intake and vomiting.

__label__Other Will trend Cr and pursue further ARF work-up if not down on AM labs
"__label__Other Anemia: Baseline hematocrit in low 30s, last 32.6 prior to discharge on 11/30."
__label__Other She does not appear to have an active source of bleeding and her bilirubin is within normal limits so she is unlikely to be hemolyzing.
__label__Other She likely either has iron-deficiency anemia (although she has been taking iron supplements) or anemia of chronic disease &#8211; or a combination thereof.
__label__Other Her RDW is only mildly elevated which likely indicates inappropriately low hematopoiesis.

__label__hypertension.mention.before_dct A/P: 77 yo F w/h/o DM and HTN who presented with several weeks of worsening bilateral LE burning pain exacerbated by movement and pressure.
__label__Other She was found to have exquisitely tender joints up to and including her knees with visible synovial effusions of her knees bilaterally.
"__label__Other Aspiration of one of her knees revealed needle-shaped negatively birefringent crystals, diagnostic of gout."
__label__Other This is consistent with her elevated uric acid and her elevated markers of inflammation (ESR/CRP).
"__label__Other Given that she has a long history of symptoms of LE diabetic neuropathy and that she has some diffuse soft tissue tenderness, she may also have some pain from diabetic neuropathy that may declare itself after her gout is treated."
"__label__Other However, her current inability to walk can be clearly attributed to gout."
__label__Other Recs:
"__label__Other - Solumedrol 40 mg bid IV, prednisone 40 mg qd starting tomorrow with 12-day outpatient taper (40 mg x 3 days, 30 mg x 3 days, 20 mg x 3 days, 10 mg x 3 days)"
"__label__Other - Colchicine po 0.6 mg qd for 2 weeks, then 0.6 mg qod for 2 weeks"
__label__medication.diuretic..before_dct - Continue to hold HCTZ     discuss with PCP need to restart as outpatient as it is a risk factor for hyperuricemia
__label__Other - F/u with rheumatology in 4 weeks for initiation of allopurinol (please arrange appointment w/ Dr. Yau)
__label__Other Procedure: R knee aspiration
__label__Other Patient was informed of the risks of bleeding and infection and gave consent.
"__label__Other The medial aspect of the right knee was sterilized using iodine swabs x3, sterile gloves used in a one-handed sterile lateral approach."
__label__Other 1.5cc of 1% lidocaine was injected to raise a wheal inferior to the R patella.
"__label__Other A 18G needle was inserted into the knee and approximately 20cc of opaque, yellow fluid was withdrawn."
"__label__Other A slide was prepared and examined under the microscope by myself, Dr. Yau, and Dr. Woodard."
__label__Other Abundant intracellular and extracellular needle-shapped negatively birefringent crystals were observed.
"__label__Other Synovial fluid sample was also submitted for culture, Gram stain, cell count, and crystal analysis."

__label__Other Coumadin due to her fear of having a repeated thrombotic stroke.

"__label__Other month about her Coumadin, and we both feel that it seems to be"
"__label__Other working well in terms of stroke prevention, but that she is at"
__label__Other increased risk for falls.

__label__Other area with no clear right answer in terms of risk benefit analysis
__label__Other for Coumadin for her.

__label__Other continue.

"__label__Other daughter, and this probably is a reasonable decision."

__label__Other encouraged her to restart physical therapy to work on her

__label__Other I understand you have recently been adjusting her antihypertensive regimen.
__label__Other I would recommend a goal systolic blood pressure no lower than 120 mmHg.
"__label__Other I think a reasonable way to approach this is to use (1) her clinical status, and (2) 'functional' imaging, such as Diamox SPECT, to follow her cerebrovascular disease."
__label__Other I think intervention would be warranted if there were a deterioration in one of these parameters.

__label__Other HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS:  This 61-year-old ambidextrous female is referred by Dr. Orellana for followup of possible stroke or TIA.
__label__Other The patient is interviewed and available records are reviewed.
"__label__Other In February, she developed left leg weakness on arising one morning."
__label__Other There was also some possible ataxia of the left upper extremity with decreased control of both the arm and the leg.
"__label__Other This seemed to occur for two days in a row and on one occasion, she fell getting out of bed."
__label__Other The symptoms resolved before she could be evaluated.
"__label__Other She attributed the symptoms to not enough air pressure in her air mattress and once this was corrected, she feels that the event has not re-occured."
__label__Other The second event was apparently associated with some left facial weakness as well.
__label__Other She was seen by Neurology on 02/10/43 after she was admitted.
__label__Other The history includes also lightheadedness and foggy vision per that report.
__label__Other Initially MRI of the head showed no acute events but did show a change in the right posterior cerebral artery and a lesion in the left temporal lobe.
"__label__Other Also, in the record is noted that at the time of the second event, her glucose was very low at around 32 and symptoms resolved after treatment with D50."
__label__Other There was also further history that the patient had been seeing a chiropractor for treatment of neck pain in the several months leading up to the event.
"__label__Other On examination at the time of admission, there were no clear findings."
__label__Other MRI was said to show periventricular white matter changes.
__label__Other The area of abnormality adjacent to the left lateral ventricle was thought to perhaps represent an old prior small hemorrhage.
__label__Other MRA of the brain showed absence of visualization of the right PCA about 1 cm beyond its origin but MRA of the neck showed no significant changes.
__label__Other Subsequent echocardiogram showed mild LVH with no evidence of a shunt.
"__label__Other Currently, the patient is asymptomatic and presents for routine followup."
__label__Other It has been unclear what the cause of her symptoms was.
__label__Other Some have attributed the symptoms to hypoglycemia and another formulation was that of a thalamic TIA given the changes in the right PCA on MRA.
__label__Other Another consideration was dissection from manipulation by the chiropractor.
__label__Other There is no clinical history to go with the possible old small hemorrhage.
__label__Other REVIEW OF SYSTEMS:  Notable for multifocal muscle aches and a chronic cough.
__label__Other The patient also has some shortness of breath but there is no report of chest pain or fever or chills.
__label__Other There are no medication allergies reported.
"__label__hypertension.mention.after_dct PAST FAMILY/SOCIAL HISTORY:  Past medical history is notable for hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, spinal stenosis, diabetes, depression, neuropathy, anxiety, COPD, arthritis, and sinus symptoms."
"__label__medication.ace_inhibitor..during_dct MEDICATIONS:  Lisinopril, Lopressor, glyburide, Naprosyn, Neurontin, Paxil, Lescol, Advair, trazodone, Glucophage, and ?___?."
"__label__smoker.current Not withstanding the above, the patient continues to smoke."
__label__Other She uses alcohol occasionally.
__label__Other She has a 12th grade education.
__label__Other She lives alone and is a widow.
"__label__hypertension.high_bp.during_dct PHYSICAL EXAMINATION:  Blood pressure is 148/86, pulse 83 and regular, respirations 20."
__label__obese.mention.before_dct The patient is overweight.
__label__Other Height is 5 foot 3 inches.
__label__Other Weight is 217 pounds.
"__label__Other Range of motion of the neck is reduced in all quadrants, though without clear spasm."
__label__Other Poor neck posture is noted.
__label__Other Funduscopic examination is normal with regard to disks and vessels.
"__label__Other Cardiovascular testing, carotids are 2+ without bruits."
__label__Other Temporal arteries are normal.
"__label__Other Musculoskeletal testing, gait and station show a slight slowing of gait that has been present for years."
__label__Other Romberg is negative.
__label__Other Tandem gait is normal.
"__label__Other The patient does move slowly in general, this is probably not reflective of true bradykinesia."
__label__Other There is some asymmetry of the shoulders with elevation on the right compared with the left.
__label__Other This affects movements of the arms and range of motion of the arms but it appears to be orthopedic in nature and not neurologic.
__label__Other There is no focal muscle weakness or atrophy noted.
"__label__Other NEUROLOGICAL TESTING:  Mental status is essentially normal to orientation, memory, attention, language and fund of information."
"__label__Other Cranial nerve testing, pupils are 3 mm and briskly reactive."

__label__Other Oropharynx is normal.
__label__Other Palate elevates well.
__label__Other Tongue is midline.

__label__Other There is possible withdrawal at the left toe but the right toe seems downgoing.
__label__Other Coordination testing today seemed intact.
__label__Other Prior neurologic evaluation from 02/10/43 is reviewed.
"__label__Other Homocystine level was elevated at 14, normal zero to ten."
"__label__Other Recommended treatment included folate, pyridoxine, and B12."
"__label__Other IMPRESSION:  Transient neurologic symptoms, question etiology."
__label__Other Comment.
__label__Other I would agree with prior examiners that the symptoms probably do not relate to the position of the bed or air in the air mattress.
__label__Other I do not think the symptoms are approximate enough to the chiropractic manipulation to be relevant.
__label__Other Symptoms could have related to hypoglycemia or could have been vascular in nature.
"__label__Other In this regard, the PCA stenosis or occlusion may be relevant."
__label__Other It is not immediately clear how to fit in the old hemorrhage.
"__label__Other PLAN:  Although, she should be on some type of antiplatelet agent."
__label__medication.aspirin..before_dct She was on aspirin at the time of the event and therefore would be considered an aspirin failure.
__label__Other We therefore suggested Plavix 75 mg daily.
__label__Other We were subsequently called by the pharmacy and informed that she is already on Aggrenox.
"__label__Other It probably does not matter which medication she chooses; however, she should be on one or the other and not both."
"__label__Other For treatment of the homocysteine level elevation, we have added simply multivitamins two daily."
__label__Other I am not sure how significant this finding is in relation to the above symptoms.
__label__Other She is advised to watch her glucose level and adjust medicines accordingly.
__label__Other We have suggested a followup in Neurology in six months.

__label__Other ASSESSMENT &amp; PLAN
"__label__hypertension.mention.after_dct Mr. Jimenez is a 78 yo male with h/o Hodgkin&#8217;s dz s/p chemo, T2m, HTN, AAA, CHF (last TTE 2086 with LVEF 50%, RVSP 45), a fib on coumadin, recently discharged after prolonged hospital stay for PNA &amp; complicated pleural effusion requiring chest tube placement, now returns from rehab with 20 lb wt gain since discharge on 3/09 &amp; 7.5 lbs since 3/20 &amp; increasing pleural effusion."
__label__Other Increasing wt gain could be secondary to low ext edema.
__label__Other ?right heart failure 2/2 to pulm htn or perhaps diastolic dysfunction; however BNP not very elevated.
__label__Other Patient&#8217;s albumin is only slightly below 3.4 as well.

"__label__hypertension.mention.during_dct Thank you for allowing me to share in the medical care of Ms. Norma Mckee, a 51-year-old female patient with the history of seizure disorder, hypertension, borderline diabetes, gastroesophageal reflux disease and panic related symptoms, and depressive disorder, who complains of excessive daytime sleepiness with recent polysomnographic abnormalities."
"__label__Other HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS:  As you already know, Ms. Mckee describes a longstanding history of snoring symptomatology and suspected nocturnal respiratory pauses, and describes a ""restless sleep"", but only relatively recently (over the last five months, particularly after 12/26 of last year)."
__label__Other She has described marked increased daytime sleepiness.
"__label__Other She essentially describes a nocturnal sleep pattern which involves ""sleeping around the clock"" during which time she may initiate sleep between 12:30 and 1:00 a.m., and after a couple awakenings, will wake up at 10:00 a.m., only to demonstrate frequent and often prolonged daytime naps of four hours duration."
__label__Other The patient states she will waken for a couple of hours and then reinitiate sleep for an additional four hours.
"__label__Other She states that she is so tired that she can ""fall asleep right after breakfast""."
__label__Other She then would get up for lunch and then go right back to sleep and sustain sleep until 3:00 p.m.  in the afternoon.
"__label__Other Ms. Mckee also demonstrates a history of seizures initiated at 3 to 4 years of age, and was initially started on phenobarbital therapy."
"__label__Other She later switched to Dilantin therapy, but more recently and particularly since the mid 10's, she has been on Tegretol antiepileptic monotherapy 200 mg tablets, four tablets po q.a.m."
__label__Other and three tablets po q.h.s.
"__label__Other While Ms. Mckee also demonstrates both daytime and nocturnal seizures, there has been increased predilections for nocturnal seizures over the last year, and an increased amount of ""diffuse"" spike wave discharges are evident during light sleep, as detailed during a recent polysomnographic evaluation (please see below)."
"__label__medication.diuretic..during_dct CURRENT MEDICATIONS:  Remeron, Celexa, Zestril, Prilosec, carbamazepine (200 mg tablets, four tablets in the morning and three tablets at night), clonazepam, hydrochlorothiazide, Premarin, tetracycline and klor-con."
__label__Other ALLERGIES:  No adverse drug allergies reported.
"__label__Other SLEEP HISTORY:  Sleep onset intended for 11:00 p.m. but the patient does not often sleep until 12:30 to 1:00 a.m.  She describes one to two early morning awakenings, with relative ease with regards to subsequent reinitiation and maintenance."
__label__Other Sleep offset initially occurs at 8:30 to 9:00 a.m. and sometimes as late as 10:00 a.m.
__label__Other The patient will then get up and right after breakfast fall asleep for several hours in duration (up to four hours).
"__label__Other The patient then will reawaken and have lunch and then after a couple of hours of sustained wakefulness, will reinitiate sleep for an additional four hours of sleep."
__label__Other Patient may sleep until 3:00 p.m. on certain given afternoons.
"__label__Other The patient describes a history of prominent snoring symptomatology and suspected nocturnal respiratory pauses as well as ""restless"" sleep."
__label__Other She denies a history of restless lower limb sensory complaints of nocturnal lower limb movements suggestive of periodic limb movement disorder.
__label__Other She denies the history of abnormal arousal behaviors or associated narcoleptic symptoms.

"__label__hypertension.high_bp.during_dct Vital signs include a blood pressure of 144/88 (seated, left arm) and a heart rate of 88, with a respiratory rate of 14."
__label__Other IMPRESSION:  
__label__Other Hypersomnia (780.54):  Likely to be a result of frequent sleep disordered breathing events and their associated arousals.
__label__Other Other diagnostic possibilities include the presence of gastroesophageal reflux associated arousals as well as nocturnal sleep disruptions due to sleep related epilepsy (although seizures appear to be under relatively good control on Tegretol anticonvulsant monotherapy).
__label__Other Obstructive sleep disordered breathing (780.53):  Patient describes a history of prominent snoring symptomatology and nocturnal respiratory pauses as well as extremely frequent intermittent obstructive apneas and a respiratory disturbance index of 26 per hour as noted during a recent 3/26/27 sleep study with associated O2 desaturations down to 76 percent.
__label__Other Good clinical response to nocturnal CPAP therapy noted.
"__label__Other Seizure disorder:  Recent literature suggests that there is a possible association between treatment of obstructive sleep disorder and increased seizure frequency in patients who are susceptible; i.e., thereby giving a further impetus for regular ongoing home CPAP therapy."
__label__Other PLAN:  
"__label__Other Suggest regular home CPAP administration (CPAP Mallinckrodt; Respironics ""contour classic"" mask; ramp time of 20 minutes; warm air humidification; at 12 cm of water pressure)."
"__label__Other Pending clinical response, will reassess the patient's level of alertness, decrease amount of early morning awakenings, and possibly decrease seizure frequency at the next sleep study evaluation in 12-14 weeks times."
"__label__Other In addition, patient is advised to continue efforts at weight reduction, use of an oro-dental, and/or potential ENT surgical approaches may also help to improve upper airway signs and symptoms."
"__label__Other Patient to continue on Tegretol anticonvulsant monotherapy 200 mg tablets, four tablets po q.a.m."
__label__Other until an assessment of seizure frequency with nocturnal CPAP therapy has been made.
__label__Other Follow up neurologic reevaluation in our sleep study department is tentatively scheduled in 12-14 weeks time.
"__label__Other Once again, thank you for allowing me to share in the medical care of Ms. Norma Mckee."
__label__Other I hope this letter finds you in the best of health.
"__label__Other Sincerely, "
"__label__Other Salvador B. Irvin, M.D."
__label__Other Department of Sleep Studies 
__label__Other ADDENDUM:  Sleep study results (3/26/27):  
"__label__Other Extremely frequent intermittent obstructive (82) and partially obstructive apneas (63) during supine sleep, as well as intermittent hypopneas (19) and nocturnal hypoventilations, intermittent snore arousals (4) and episodes of moderate snoring (respiratory disturbance index = 26 per hour) with associated arousals and O2 desaturations down to 76%."
"__label__Other Insofar as stage REM sleep was not achieved, the actual degree of respiratory compromise may be under represented."
"__label__Other CPAP administration (CPAP Mallinckrodt; Respironics ""contour classic"" mask; ramp time of 20 minutes; warm air humidification; at 12 cm of water pressure) served to considerably reduce the frequency of these nocturnal respiratory disturbances, help consolidate sleep, as well as improve O2 saturations (i.e., to 96% and above, even during REM supine sleep) and overall sleep stage architecture."
"__label__Other Slightly increased periodic limb movements of sleep, activated during both ""light"" non-REM, as well as stage REM sleep (index = 8 per hour) with infrequent limb associated arousals (index = 1 per hour) both of which may serve to interfere with the continuity of sleep (the presence of REM related nocturnal lower limb movements may suggest some degree of REM motor disinhibition)."
__label__Other Cardiac rates typically ranged between 72-87 beats per minute; average 80 beats per minute.
"__label__Other EEG evidence of frequent bursts and brief runs of ""diffuse"" spike-wave discharges were evident during light sleep, without associated clinical accompaniment."
"__label__Other Inability to achieve stage REM sleep under pre-CPAP conditions, but with prominent ""slow wave and REM rebounds"" subsequently noted with CPAP administration; i.e., accounting for more than 41% and more than 31% of the CPAP sleep times, respectively."
__label__Other 7.
__label__Other Total recording period:  405 minutes; total sleep time:  377 minutes.

__label__medication.insulin..after_dct NPH        30 Units
__label__medication.insulin..after_dct Regular      8 Units                  Blood Sugar under 101
__label__Other                 10 Units                  101-150
__label__Other                 12 Units                  151-200
__label__Other                 14 Units                  201-250

__label__Other                 22 Units                  Over 400
__label__Other Before Supper:
__label__Other &#183;         This is only an initial set of guidelines.
"__label__Other The doses will have to be adjusted based on experience, diet, exercise, and illness."
__label__Other &#183;         Goal is to have blood sugars before meals in the 90-130 range and blood sugars at bedtime in the 110-140 range.
__label__Other &#183;         Check blood sugars initially before meals and at bedtime each day.
"__label__medication.insulin..after_dct Record the times, blood sugars, insulin doses and all food on the sheets provided and bring these sheets to your medical appointments."
"__label__Other &#183;         Call Dr. Xenakis&#8217;s office for any blood sugars under 70, or any symptoms of hypoglycemia (low blood sugars)."
__label__Other &#183;         Also call if blood sugars are often over 180.

"__label__Other Dear Michael,"
"__label__Other Mr. Xavier Olive presents for evaluation, thanks for your"
__label__Other referral.
__label__Other As you recall he is a 71-year-old gentleman who is
__label__Other status post angioplasty on the left for high-grade stenotic
__label__Other lesions of the distal superficial femoral artery and the
__label__Other popliteal artery on the left.
__label__Other The patient presents now for
"__label__Other further evaluation of his ""claudication symptoms""."
"__label__Other The patient states he has bilateral lower extremity symptoms,"
__label__Other there are about equivalent in nature.
__label__Other He has very minimal low
__label__Other back pain.
__label__Other He states it seems to be getting worse and seems to
__label__Other be associated with some abnormal gait.
__label__Other He states on a bad day
__label__Other its about a 9/10 and even on a good day sometimes it can be as
__label__Other high as 8-9/10.
__label__Other The episodes are almost daily and are brought on
__label__Other by things like walking.
__label__Other He can walk less than one block at which
__label__Other point he has lateral calf burning and at times notes some slow
__label__Other shuffling and occasionally falling.
__label__Other When he is having severe
__label__Other symptoms he notes his legs to be weak.
__label__Other He denies any bowel or
"__label__Other bladder abnormalities of late, but has a historic of a chronic"
__label__Other UTI secondary to his benign prostatic hypertrophy.
__label__Other He has very
__label__Other little back pain associated with his symptomatology.
__label__Other He has had
__label__Other no physical therapy to date and no spinal injections.
__label__Other He
"__label__Other describes his general health as poor, but when specially asked he"
__label__hypertension.mention.after_dct states it is because he his 71 and has a history of hypertension.
__label__Other Years ago he stated he was in excellent health.
__label__Other His weight is
__label__Other steady at 200 with no significant weight gain or loss.
__label__Other doesn't smoke and drinks socially.
__label__smoker.past Quit smoking 33 years ago.
__label__Other He does not think he will ever be pain free.
__label__diabetes.mention.after_dct Review of Systems:  Reveals that he is a diet controlled diabetic
__label__Other and he has been for the past couple of years.
__label__Other He has difficulty
__label__Other with sleep.
__label__Other He has a balance problem and also has benign
"__label__Other prostatic hypertrophy leading to chronic urinary tract infection,"
__label__Other for this he takes Cardura.
__label__Other He has a history of high blood
__label__Other pressure.
__label__Other Denies any other cardiovascular abnormality.
__label__Other No
__label__Other respiratory malfunction.
"__label__Other He has had surgery for something ""in"
"__label__Other his colon"" he has also had a bypass surgery."
__label__medication.thienopyridine..after_dct He is on Plavix and
__label__medication.aspirin..before_dct aspirin.

__label__Other appearing male.
__label__Other He is able to toe and heel walk but on the left
__label__Other side his T band seems to be slightly weak.
__label__Other Single toe raises
__label__Other show that the right leg is stronger than the left leg.
__label__Other He has no
__label__Other tenderness to his PSIS and he has no Waddell signs.
__label__Other He has
__label__Other negative Trendelenburg bilaterally.
__label__Other Forward flexion allows him
__label__Other to get to the patella.

__label__Other hyperextension does not reproduce the symptoms.

__label__Other symmetric.

__label__Other He was started on Sinemet 25/100mg tid with significant improvement in his balance & gait & rest tremor.

__label__Other He also complained of persistant fatigue in his legs.

__label__Other 			Reason for visit:
__label__Other    Second opinion regarding painful legs with walking at less than 50 yards and also balance disorder.
__label__Other Interval History:
__label__Other    Mr.  Xavier Olive is a 73-year-old gentleman who comes into Trumbull Memorial Vascular Center for a second opinion regarding his lower extremity discomfort and also his progressive difficulty walking and maintaining balance.
"__label__Other His referring physician is Dr.  Ximena Keane, practicing out of Alexandria Clinic."
__label__Other Mr.  Olive also heard about the TMH VC through TV advertisements.
"__label__diabetes.mention.during_dct He is 73 years old, has history of diabetes starting in 2135, known history of peripheral artery disease with claudication and calf discomfort, for which he has previously seen Dr.  Cain at Alexandria Clinic, and also has been evaluated and treated at the Corcoran District Hospital."
"__label__Other Specifically, he describes having been evaluated by Dr.  Cain and others some three or four years ago, and undergoing at least two procedures, all related to his legs cramping up."
"__label__Other He received prior stenting to his right common iliac artery and his left superficial femoral artery, so far as I can tell."
"__label__Other The stents were placed at Pomeroy Care Center (Big Rapids, AC) and also he had evaluation at the Corcoran District Hospital, and may have had a stenting procedure or revascularization procedure there."
"__label__Other The patient and his wife are somewhat unclear about the dates and locations and times, but he does state that the treatments apparently did not help him at all."
"__label__Other Currently, he has discomfort in both calves when he walks too far or too fast, and this stops him at about 50 yards."
"__label__Other The issue was complicated by the fact that he has had progressive parkinsonian-type symptoms, walking in a shuffle, tipping forward, and occasionally even falling forward and losing his balance completely."
"__label__Other His legs are rubbery, and he does even realize that he is falling forward when it happens."
__label__Other It is worse when he is carrying things that weigh anything.
"__label__Other At the same time, his calves do cramp up in a typical fashion consistent with claudication, and he has known peripheral artery disease."
__label__Other Also feels though his hips sometimes are cramping up.
"__label__Other The patient feels quite disabled by his symptoms, especially as a gentleman who was active and never had physical problems of this nature."
"__label__Other Again, there is some degree of blurring between the parkinsonian symptoms and his claudication, as to which is truly causing his disability."

__label__Other Dear Harry and Yair:
__label__Other My thanks for your kind referral of the above noted patient with respect to her disabling claudication and of course she is not in a very happy circumstance.
"__label__Other As you know, she is just 52 years of age."
"__label__medication.sulfonylureas..before_dct Her cardiovascular risk factors include type 2 diabetes treated with metformin and Glyburide, hypertension, hyperlipidemia and she is a former cigarette smoker but she has not smoked in a year."
__label__Other She spends a lot of time caring for her partially disabled husband.
__label__Other She has known and impressive history of peripheral vascular disease.
__label__Other She has undergone bilateral leg revascularizations.
__label__Other On the left side initially an iliac stent was tried but in January of 2063 she had a left iliofemoral endarterectomy with angioplasty and in situ above knee left fem-pop bypass graft.
"__label__Other This reconstruction is functioning well, as evidenced by pulse examination and she certainly does not have any major symptoms in the left side."
__label__Other In April of 2063 she had a right common femoral and external iliac endarterectomy with a right fem-pop bypass graft to the above-knee popliteal artery using transposed greater saphenous veins.
__label__Other There had previously been a right iliac PTA and stent.
__label__Other She states that the procedure in the right leg was only transiently of benefit.
"__label__Other By last spring, i.e."
__label__Other a year ago she again had rather limiting claudication.
__label__Other She says this is now worse over the past several months and she quantifies this as severe calf pain after just a couple of blocks.
__label__Other Importantly she does not have ischemic rest pain and she has never had tissue loss.
__label__Other Recently resting ABIs were recorded at 0.46 on the right and 0.8 on the left.
__label__Other Her continued complaints led to a repeat arteriogram last October documenting a superficial femoral artery occlusion (???
__label__Other length thereof - she did not bring the films themselves) and a patent albeit small reconstituted above-knee popliteal artery with decent runoff.
__label__Other Understandably Dr. Adcock was reluctant about recommending further revascularizations.
__label__Other She has sought an opinion here in this regard.
__label__Other She has no known coronary artery disease and her general system review is notable for a prior hospitalization in 2061 for severe pancreatitis requiring laparotomy.
__label__Other On physical examination blood pressure was 140/80.
__label__Other Pulse was 70 and regular.
__label__Other Carotid upstroke was normal and there were no major carotid bruits.
"__label__Other She has femoral pulses on both sides and the left fem-pop bypass graft in situ is palpable, as is the left popliteal pulse."
__label__Other There is no right popliteal nor right foot pulse.
__label__Other She does have dependent rubor on that right side although there is no tissue breakdown.
__label__Other This is of course a very unhappy situation.
__label__Other Further attempts at surgical revascularization in the setting of having both greater saphenous veins harvested and so forth is really not justified for claudication alone since the result can be anticipated to be not very good.
__label__Other However I am not absolutely ruling this out.
__label__Other I would suggest the following.
"__label__medication.aspirin..before_dct Her risk factor control is decent and she should certainly stay on the Lipitor, aspirin and Plavix."
__label__Other Since her problem is claudication I would like Yair to institute Pletal at full dosages and give this at least a couple of months before we can say that she has had an adequate trial with question benefit.
__label__Other She will get the actual arteriogram from the October study to me.
__label__Other If it seems reasonable and the right superficial femoral artery block is not too long an attempt at percutaneous recanalization could be considered.
__label__Other I will get back to you after review of the films themselves.
__label__Other My thanks once again.
__label__Other With every best wish.
"__label__Other Sincerely,"

"__label__Other If euvolemic, likely SIADH, which could be caused by neurologic process, pain, or infection"

"__label__Other If low sodium high osm, likely hypovolemic."
"__label__Other If higher sodium, more likely SIADH."

__label__Other I saw Nikkolas Nancy-Jasmine today for evaluation concerning his stroke in August 2091.
__label__Other The information available today is limited to his knowledge of the events.
__label__hypertension.mention.before_dct He is an 67-year-old Honduran man with a history of diabetes mellitus and HTN.
__label__Other In August he suffered a stroke.
__label__Other He reports that his speech was affected and that he developed severe right arm and leg weakness without sensory loss.
__label__Other He recalls no problem with his vision.
__label__Other He was hospitalized at Dubuque Obstetrics Gynocology Center.
__label__Other He does no know the extent of the evaluation.
__label__medication.aspirin..before_dct He was discharged on aspirin to Mitchell County Hospital.
__label__Other He is now living at home with his wife and son with visiting nurse assistance.
__label__Other His primary care physician is at Flagler Hospital.
__label__Other He has severe residual weakness of the right arm and leg.
__label__Other He also complains of dizziness and an abnormal numbness in his mouth.
__label__Other The dizziness is worst in the morning.
__label__Other He also notices a noise in his head when he sleeps.
__label__hypertension.mention.before_dct He has DM and HTN.
__label__smoker.never He is a nonsmoker.
__label__Other I don't have cholesterol information.
__label__Other There is no history of cardiac disease.
__label__Other There is no history of alcohol abuse.
"__label__medication.aspirin..before_dct He is currently taking aspirin, insulin, antihypertensive medication of some type and possibly a cholesterol lowering agent, although he is no sure of this."
__label__Other He has no known allergies.
__label__Other He is aware of no significant family history.
__label__Other He is married.
__label__Other He lives with his wife and 22-year-old son.
__label__Other He came to america from Honduras in 2073.
__label__Other He worked nights in construction until his stroke.
"__label__Other Pulse 66, regular."
__label__hypertension.high_bp.during_dct BP 186/110.
__label__Other There are no cranial bruits.
__label__Other The carotid pulses are full with no bruits.
__label__Other The lungs are clear.
__label__Other The heart is regular with no murmur.
__label__Other The abdomen is benign.
__label__Other The mental state is normal; he speaks Spanish and broken English.
"__label__Other He is able to name, repeat, and comprehend well."
__label__Other His fluency in his native language is probably normal.
__label__Other Cranial nerves are intact.
"__label__Other There is severe weakness of the right arm and leg: right interossei and finger flexors 1/5, finger extensors 0/5, biceps 1/5, triceps 0-1/5, deltoid 0-1/5."
__label__Other (He tries to raise his arm proximally by elevating the shoulder.)
"__label__Other Right iliopsoas 2/5, quadriceps 2/5, hamstrings 1/5, distally 0/5."
__label__Other The tone is only mildly increased.
__label__Other Sensation is intact.
"__label__Other Reflexes are slghtly brisker in the right upper extremity (RUE 2+/4, LUE 2/4, knees 2+/4, ankles 2/4)."
__label__Other The right plantar response is mute; he withdraws the left.
__label__Other Coordination is intact; weakness inhibits adequate testing on the right.
__label__Other He wears a right AFO.
"__label__Other He can stand up from his wheelchair and bear weight maneuvering himself to the examining table, but he cannot walk unsupported."
"__label__Other His examination is most consistent with a right equal arm and leg pure motor hemiparesis, sparing the face."
__label__Other This was likely due to a lacunar infarction in the left basis pontis from small vessel occlusion.
"__label__hypertension.mention.before_dct He has major stroke risk factors, including DM, HTN, and probably hypercholesterolemia."
"__label__Other Currently his major needs are to establish good control of his blood pressure and to control other risk factors, including optimtal glucose control and likely medication for hyperlipidemia, and to continue physical and occupational therapy to maximize his functional status."

"__label__hypertension.mention.before_dct HPI:	68yo RHM with HTN, NIDDM, 2 prior strokes (8/91 5/93) who after running out of his medications in Honduras woke up 7 days ago with dysarthria, dysphagia, and rotatory vertigo."

__label__medication.ace_inhibitor..before_dct He self-d/c'd zestril for new nausea that he felt was related.

"__label__Other He has had difficulty ambulating as well, despite the use of his tripod cane, and his children have helped him at home."

__label__Other hypertensive therapy.

__label__Other heparin.

__label__Other remain anti-coagulated.

__label__Other Plantar responses are extensor.
__label__Other DATA:
__label__Other MRI 2068: old right MCA stroke
__label__Other CT 2068: SDH
__label__Other ASSESSMENT/ RECOMMENDATIONS:
__label__Other 72 year-old woman with vascular risk factors including atrial fibrillation and prior stroke  with a subsequent SDH with super elevated INR who now returns for follow-up.
__label__Other She has had a significant recovery.
__label__Other Our goal should now be secondary stroke prevention and risk factor modification.

__label__Other status and urinary incontinence.
