__label__Other EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT COURSE:  Upon arrival to the Emergency
"__label__Other Department, the patient had history and physical exam performed."
__label__Other The patient was noted to be in atrial fibrillation with rapid
__label__Other ventricular response.
__label__Other The patient's 12-lead EKG revealed a rate
"__label__Other of 166 beats per minute, atrial fibrillation with rapid"
"__label__Other ventricular response, stable T-wave inversions noted over the"
__label__Other lateral leads as well as over the precordial leads.
__label__Other No definite
__label__Other ST segment abnormalities were noted.
__label__Other The patient then had a
"__label__Other portable chest x-ray and as per report, the patient's portable"
__label__Other chest x-ray did not reveal any acute cardiopulmonary process or
__label__Other findings.
__label__Other The patient did have a noncontrast head CT scan and
__label__Other the patient's noncontrast head CT scan was notable for some
__label__Other right-sided edema.
__label__Other The patient will have this followed up with
__label__Other an MRI of the brain.

__label__Other notable for sodium of 131 and potassium of 5.2.
__label__Other The patient's
__label__Other lactic acid was 1.7.
__label__Other The patient's white blood cell count was
__label__Other not elevated.
__label__Other The patient was not anemic.
__label__Other urinalysis was consistent with infection.
__label__Other The patient's first
__label__Other set of cardiac markers were negative.
__label__Other The patient's coagulation
__label__Other studies were normal.
__label__Other The patient was treated with ceftriaxone
__label__Other for her urinary tract infection.
__label__Other The patient could possibly have
__label__Other urosepsis given her fever and tachycardia.
__label__Other Urine sepsis is my
__label__Other leading diagnosis at this time.
__label__Other The patient's right-sided edema
"__label__Other is certainly concerning, however, I do not feel that the patient"
__label__Other will need to be admitted to Neurology at this time.

__label__Other will be admitted to medicine for presumed urosepsis.
__label__Other will need to be admitted to a monitor bed.
__label__Other The patient's blood
"__label__Other pressure is normal, and as such, I do not feel that the patient"
__label__Other needs an intensive care unit bed.

"__label__Other fibrillation with rapid ventricular response, the patient was"
__label__Other given metoprolol IV.

__label__Other medications secondary to her possible stroke.

__label__Other given rectal Tylenol as well as rectal Kayexalate for her
__label__Other elevated potassium at 5.2.

"__label__diabetes.mention.after_dct Reason for Consult: DM, chronic R and L. foot ulcerations; L. foot ulceration with surrounding erythema, pain"
"__label__diabetes.mention.after_dct HPI: 50F w/longstanding type I DM with retinopathy, nephropathy, autonomic and peripheral neuropathy, recent development of L. heel and forefoot ulcers, here with a few days of pain, erythema, and swelling around her L. forefoot ulcer."
"__label__diabetes.mention.after_dct She has an extremely complicated history of R and now L. foot infections and ulcerations, in setting of here severe neuropathy and DM."
"__label__Other She originally sustained a R. 5th metatarsal fracture in 2083, with poor union, and subsequent fracture of her 2nd &#8211; 4th metatarsals."
"__label__Other She developed a chronic ulcerated callus over her R. lateral metatarsal heads, with underlying osteomyelitis&#8212;this did not improve despite multiple courses of antibiotics."
"__label__Other She underwent I+D of her R. foot ulceration in 12/89, OR cultures grew P. aeruginosa."
"__label__Other In 3/90, she underwent debridement of her chronic R. lateral plantar ulceration and skin grafting."
"__label__Other In 6/90, she underwent deep debridement of her ongoing 5th metatarsal osteomyelitis, along with excision of her 5th metatarsal&#8212;bone cultures grew MSSA."
"__label__Other She did well until 2/92, when she underwent R. ankle revision for an equinovarus deformity of her R. hindfoot (calcaneal osteotomy, lateral translation, dorsiflexion first metatarsal osteotomy, and Achilles lengthening)."
"__label__Other She subsequently developed a R. heel ulceration, and in 4/92, underwent debridement of this ulceration, removal of a screw, and placement of a vacuum sponge."
"__label__Other Her wound continued to heal poorly, and she underwent R. SFA to posterior tibial bypass grafting."
"__label__Other In 7/92, she underwent debridement of her R. heel wound and placement of a full thickness skin graft, which has taken well; she feels that her R. heel has been healing nicely."
"__label__Other During her long hospitalization in 4/92, she started developing L. heel and L. forefoot ulcerations."
"__label__Other She attributes the heel ulcerations to chronic pressure from her position in bed, and the forefoot ulcerations to the boots that were used to relieve her heel pressure, which apparently abraded her forefoot chronically."
"__label__Other These ulcerations continued to worsen over the next few months, and she presented with cellulitis of this area in 8/92."
"__label__Other She received vancomycin, levofloxacin, flagyl initially, then augmentin, with persistent poor healing of her wounds."
"__label__Other On 9/10, she underwent operative debridement of her L. plantar heel ulcer&#8212;she was found to have extensive necrotic yellow-brown tissue underlying her L. heel eschar, which was extensively debrided; she received a course of linezolid postoperatively."
"__label__Other She had an angiogram on 9/12, which showed no significant flow limiting lesions in her LLE, and good flow through her prior R. SFA to posterior tibial bypas graft."
"__label__Other She feels that her wounds have been healing fairly well recently; she feels that her R. heel is almost completely healed, and that her L. heel ulcer is smaller than it was previously."
__label__Other Her L. forefoot ulcer is also more shallow than it was in the past.
"__label__Other Over the past 2-3 days, she developed fairly acute swelling, erythema, and pain around her forefoot ulcer, with erythema spreading to the dorsal surface of her foot."
"__label__Other She was seen in vascular surgery clinic, and was admitted for antibiotics and further debridement."
"__label__Other She has a chronic &#8216;fast heartbeat,&#8217; denies any systemic symptoms (no fevers, chills, sweats, notable weight changes), headaches, sinus symptoms, sore throat, cough, shortness of breath, chest pain, nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, diarrhea, blood in her bowel movements, dysuria, frequency, LE edema, rashes, myalgias, or new arthralgias."
__label__Other She feels that her foot erythema has improved significantly overnight with vancomycin.
__label__Other PMH:
"__label__diabetes.mention.after_dct poorly controlled type I DM since age 12&#8212;complicated by diabetic retinopathy s/p bilateral vitrectomies for retinal hemorrhage, nephropathy, peripheral neuropathy, autonomic nephropathy (gastroparesis)&#8212;on an insulin pump"
"__label__Other chronic foot ulcerations, initially R, now L, requiring numerous antibiotic courses and operative interventions:"
"__label__Other 2083: R. 5th metatarsal fracture in 2083, poor union, subsequent fracture of the remainder of her R. metarsals"
"__label__Other chronic ulcerated callus over R. lateral metatarsal heads, with underlying osteomyelitis, no improvement despite multiple courses of antibiotics"

__label__Other He subsequently was referred to Dr. Mccarthy and was scheduled to undergo left ICA stent placement in December.

__label__Other His wife called 911.
__label__Other He continued to have positional vertigo in the emergency room such that if he sat up he would become very vertiginous and off balance but if he laid with his eyes closed.

"__label__hypertension.mention.after_dct HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS:  Ms. Uhrich is a 73-year-old woman with past medical history notable for hypertension and dyslipidemia, but no coronary artery disease who presents with a three-day history of progressive weakness and lightheadedness."
__label__Other The history is obtained in Spanish from the patient and through her daughter who assisted with translation.
"__label__Other In general, she has apparently been doing well with no episodes of chest discomfort or exertional dyspnea until roughly three days ago when she has began to notice episodic problems with walking even short distances before she feels as though she might pass out."
"__label__Other The episodes have occurred multiple times per day and after a particularly severe episode this morning, she brought her mother to the emergency department for evaluation."
"__label__Other There have been no syncopal episodes and no complaints of palpitations, orthopnea, PND, or lower extremity edema."
__label__medication.beta_blocker..during_dct The patient has not had symptoms like this before and has been chronically treated with atenolol for hypertension for many years.
"__label__Other Her only cardiovascular evaluation has been with adenosine MIBI in 2085, which revealed normal systolic function and no evidence for ischemia."
"__label__hypertension.mention.after_dct PAST MEDICAL HISTORY:  Notable for hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, gastritis, and osteoarthritis."

__label__Other There is no murmur.

__label__Other The extremities are warm without edema.

__label__Other There is left axis deviation consistent with left anterior fascicular block.
__label__Other There is no response of her heart rate to mild calisthenics in the bed.
__label__Other Laboratories are notable for normal BUN to creatinine ratio of 23/1.2 with a potassium of 4.1 and a hematocrit of 35%.
__label__Other Initial cardiac biomarkers were negative.
"__label__hypertension.mention.after_dct In summary, Karson Uhrich is a 73-year-old woman with hypertension and dyslipidemia who presents with a three-day history of presyncope and weakness in the context of a new diagnosis of 2:1 AV block."
__label__Other Review of previous electrocardiograms reveals no right bundle-branch block and left anterior fascicular block and of late this represents progression of her underlying conduction system disease.
__label__Other We will proceed to permanent temporary pacemaker implantation for backup support and will arrange electrophysiologic consultation for permanent pacemaker implantation.

__label__Other Her beta-blocker will be held overnight in addition to her amitriptyline to see if this facilitates recovery of her AV nodal function.

__label__Other Additional plans will be dictated by her clinical course.

"__label__diabetes.mention.before_dct HPI: Mr. Moss is a 77 yo M with PmHx significant for DMII, CHF (EF 20-25%), afib, Parkinson's, prostate cancer s/p XRT c/b proctitis and GIB, multiple hip replacements, s/p multiple knee surgeries who, recently treated for S. aureus L shoulder septic arthritis (10/87) who presented 1/19 s/p fall."
"__label__Other Mr. Moss has experienced multiple falls recently, and was ultimately diagnosed with Parkinsons last September."
"__label__Other Following the diagnosis, he was discharged to Bellaire City Hospital, where he continued to experience falls."
"__label__Other After one episode, he was forcibly picked up, and began to have L shoulder pain thereafter."
__label__Other He also noted a cut over the L elbow on transfer to the NH that was slow to heal.
"__label__Other After several weeks of worsening shoulder pain, erythema, and warmth, he was re-hospitalized at Ouagadougou, where he underwent L shoulder aspiration."
"__label__Other MRI 10/87 demonstrated complete rupture of the rotator cuff, with associated large joint effusion."
"__label__Other Of note, he denied fevers, chills, or NS."
"__label__Other L shoulder aspiration 10/10/87 demonstrated purulent fluid, with 2,800,000 WBC (97%PMN)."
__label__Other Gram stain demonstrated GPC in clusters.
"__label__Other He subsequently underwent L shoulder I&D 10/12, with removal of 300cc of frankly purulent fluid."
__label__Other He was started on cefazolin.
"__label__Other Culture results returned a pan-sensitive Staphylococcus aureus isolate (including to ampicillin, cefazolin, clindamycin, penicillin, rifampin)."
__label__Other Blood cultures were negative.
"__label__Other He was taken back to the OR 10/16 for arthroscopy, with extensive debridement."
"__label__Other Interop findings included demonstration of significant fibrinous tissue, with no normal-appearing cartiledge present."
"__label__Other A penrose was placed into a large cavity down the subdeltoid rescess, and a second in the subacromial space."
"__label__Other He was transitioned to ampicillin 2g q6 hours x 2 weeks, and then given amoxicillin (either 1g BID or 500mg TID, unsure which) x 2 weeks."
"__label__Other Repeat R shoulder MRI obtained 12/12/87, which was reviewed with staff radiologist, and demonstrated again complete tear of the supra/infraspinatus/teres minor/ subscapularis/ biceps tendons, with also persistent large joint effusion, extensive synovitis, and full thickness cartiledge loss of glenoid and humeral head."
__label__Other Also noted was possible AVN of medial portion of the humeral head.
"__label__Other Overall, was difficult to tell from MRI whether findings represented prior vs active disease."
"__label__Other Mr. Moss was seen in the ID clinic 1/18, at which time he complained of a several week h/o progressively worsening L shoulder discomfort with activity."
"__label__Other He did not experience shoulder pain at rest, and had not recently noted erythema."
__label__Other No drainage.
"__label__Other Appetite was near baseline, though he had experienced fatigue."
__label__Other Blood glucoses had been well controlled.
"__label__Other His daughter in law brought in extensive data on his home vital signs, which revealed absence of fever except for a single isolated temp of 103, with stable pulse/BP, and overall well controlled blood sugars."

__label__Other Micro Data:

"__label__Other Shoulder aspirate as per HPI (S aureus, pan sensitive)"
__label__Other Imaging:
__label__Other Pelvis/Hip (right) films:  Bilateral total hip arthroplasties without any acute fracture or dislocation.
__label__Other The acetabular component demonstrates vertical inclination with evidence of polyethylene wear.
__label__Other The femoral component demonstrates lucency measuring more than 2mm superolaterally and along the stem consistent with granulomatous disease.
__label__Other There is no subsidence or loosening based on Grauer's classification.
"__label__Other AP chest film: no acute pulmonary process, probable cardiomegaly."
"__label__diabetes.mention.before_dct Assessment: 77 yo M with DMII, CHF (EF 20-25%), afib, Parkinson's, prostate cancer s/p XRT c/b proctitis and GIB, multiple hip replacements, recently treated for S. aureus L shoulder septic arthritis (10/87 - 11/87) who presented 1/19 s/p fall."
"__label__Other With regards to his shoulder, it is difficult to know whether his infection was cured by the 4-week abx course."
"__label__Other Though his shoulder does not appear to be grossly infected on exam, 2 months after completion of his course, it is too early to determine sterilization of the shoulder on a clinical basis."
"__label__Other The MRI is difficult to interpret, and may well reflect prior inflammatory changes."
__label__Other He did have persistently elevated inflammatory markers (though confounded by multiple comorbidities).
"__label__Other Given the possibility that he had cleared the infection, our plan as of the clinic visit Wednesday had been to observe him clinically, off abx, for signs of recurrent infection."
"__label__Other However, given his fall and the possibility of new hardware placement, would now favor a more aggressive workup of his shoulder."
"__label__Other As such, would recommend shoulder aspiration off antibiotics."
"__label__Other The source for the L shoulder staph infection was never elucidated, and blood cultures were negative."
"__label__Other However, such septic arthritis often results from hematogenous seeding, and there is a small change that his R hip may also have become infected."
__label__Other This could help to explain the prosthesis loosening.
"__label__Other Alternatively, he may have had hardware mechanical failure in setting of falls, or less likely involvement by his prostatic ca (?read of granulomatous disease around the prosthesis)."
__label__Other Recommendations:
"__label__Other -hold antibiotics, including pre-operative prophylactic antibiotics to allow optimal culture data"
__label__Other -Aspirate shoulder.
"__label__Other Send fluid for cell counts, Gram stain, aerobic/anaerobic/fungal cultures"
__label__Other -if do not see contraindication to proceeding with planned hip replacement
"__label__Other -would obtain hip biopsies in the OR, again off abx, to assess for possible hip infection"
"__label__Other -likewise, would send OR hip specimen to pathology to assess for infection vs. neoplastic involvement"
"__label__Other -check CK, given elevated Cr following fall, and possible rhabdo"
__label__Other Thank you for this interesting consultation.
__label__Other We will continue to follow with you.
__label__Other ___________

__label__Other 						RE:  Tyler Pearson
__label__Other 					                    WMC#727-19-02
__label__Other Dear Doctor Trejo:
"__label__Other I had the pleasure of seeing our mutual patient, Mr. Tyler Pearson, in follow up evaluation in our vascular surgery clinic here today."
__label__Other As you will remember he recently underwent right carotid endarterectomy with Dacron patch angioplasty after treatment of a severe underlying pneumonia.
__label__Other He returns today reporting that he is doing well from a neurologic standpoint.
"__label__Other He has had no focal, motor, sensory deficits, and no amaurosis fugax."
__label__Other A follow up duplex examination performed in our vascular laboratory reveals mild right ICA disease after his carotid endarterectomy with moderate left ICA stenosis which should be followed over time.
"__label__Other Assessment and plan:  Overall, I am extremely pleased with Mr. Pearson's outcome given his high risk pulmonary status."
__label__Other It would be prudent to see him again in follow up evaluation in six months' time with a repeat carotid duplex examination.
__label__Other I would be happy to assist in the management of this or any of your other patients as you deem necessary in the future.
__label__Other Thank you again for allowing me to assist in his care.
"__label__Other If I can be of any further assistance, please feel free to contact either myself or one of my partners directly."
"__label__Other Sincerely,"

"__label__Other Of note, he was hospitalized from May 26 until May 29 for a COPD flare, and was discharged home at that time on a prednisone taper, which he completed about one week ago."
__label__Other He was in his usual state of good health and had even spent the past weekend with family in Connecticut camping.
"__label__Other But on the evening of June 13 he began to feel short of breath, without cough or chest pain, and the dyspnea was made worse with exertion."
__label__Other Not made worse with lying down.
"__label__Other He also had a fever to 103, without mental status changes."
__label__Other EMS was called and in the field he was noted to be breathing at a rate in the 40s; he was given a dose of IV lasix and he put out 600cc of urine.
"__label__Other He was then brought to the WMC ED where he continued to display labored breathing, breathing in the 40s, afebrile, tachycardic to 147bpm."
__label__Other An ABG on BIPAP showed 7.35/53/100.

__label__Other He was given approximately 2L of NS with resultant CVP of 11.
